\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 政治學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Political Science
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程旨在致力基礎學科之訓練，強調理論與實務的結合，培養學生對政治學的興趣。透過對研究方法、基本概念，議題探索的學習，預期學生在修習完全學年的課程後，能具備基本的分析研究能力，順利銜接後續的進階專業課程，並能在教師的協助下，申請與執行國科會專題研究計畫。本課程為全學年課程，上學期的重點為介紹政治學基礎概念與理論，下學期將討論不同的制度與實證案例。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要是以法律系為對象的經濟學，主要的內容為透過個體經濟學基本理論的介紹，進而介紹完全競爭市場及不完全競爭市場的廠商決策，以帶入公平交易法、反托拉斯法等的經濟學知識。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 教授基本經濟學原理，讓學生瞭解市場運作、國民所得、總就業量、平均工資物價水準及物價上漲率等之基本概念。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 貨幣銀行學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為一學年課程。授課重點在訓練同學能分析、探討一些貨幣金融問題，作為一般理財之參考。如美國及我國中央銀行近年已多次調升利率：透過檢驗金融市場（如債券、股票及外匯市場等），金融機構（如銀行、保險公司、信用合作社等），及貨幣在當前經濟中所佔之重要性（即金融制度是否健全），希望能適切、周詳的解決一些理財之問題（如是否應立即購買股票及債券等）。另一目的在介紹金融制度與政策的的基本概念，並分別從理論及制度上，探討及評估政府的各項金融制度對我們日常生活的影響。期使學習者能透過經濟學的思考方式，認識政府所扮演的財金角色，並對我國現行金融制度的特色有所了解。此外，對現階段各國金融制度所面臨的重要問題，亦將酌量提出討論。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 貨幣銀行學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程為一學年課程，主要介紹貨幣銀行學之基本理論與其應用。
下學期課程將著重於中央銀行和各種貨幣理論的介紹及總體經濟分析。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 貨幣銀行學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程是一門中級經濟學課程，教授貨幣、金融市場、銀行和貨幣政策。旨在促進積極的學習，和培養每個學生必要的學術技能。它提供給學生有關金融結構，功能和演變，以及貨幣政策傳導機制的全面訊息。此外，它為經濟分析和思考奠定了堅實的基礎，可以讓學生於他們的教育和後續職業生涯中受益。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 貨幣銀行學(單學期)(有修即可)]

Learning the economic rationale behind policy strategies is especially emphasized.

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Sociology
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 社會是什麼？社會跟人的關係為何？人定勝天是真的嗎？為什麼俗話說「龍生龍、鳳生鳳」？藉由閱讀中外文獻，本課旨在概括性的探討社會對於日常生活的影響。我們將討論許多議題，包含家庭、教育、移民、政治等，並在各項議題中強調社會結構與社會不平等的關係。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 個體經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 個體經濟學為一學期兩學期的課程，上學期的授課內容主要為消費者理論，包括預算線、無異曲線、替代效果與所得效果、Slutsky equations、顯示性偏好理論、不確定性、以及拍賣。下學期的授課內容則包括廠商理論（包括完全競爭、獨占、獨占競爭、寡占）、要素市場、賽局理論、與一般均衡理論。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 總體經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics

Course outline includes: 
 A tour of the world and Taiwan

 Financial market

 Labor market 
 AD-AS model 
 Open economy 
 Expectations 
 Facts and Big Questions of Economic Growth 
 Technological progress and Growth 
 Monetary and fiscal policies

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 總體經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 總體經濟變化錯綜複雜，學生都以為難以掌握總體變化，且認為經濟邏輯艱澀難懂，學派理論抽象複雜。為教導學生使其了解總體經濟現象與問題，需將實際總體經濟活動做成生活化的詮釋，並結合理論分析，使學生對總體經濟運作有通盤的了解。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 經濟學課程內容主要包括兩部份：個體經濟學和總體經濟學。本學期以總體經濟學為主，課程內容包涵國民所得決定、失業率、通貨膨脹率、總合供需模型、財政政策以及貨幣政策等主題。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a one‐year introductory course to economic theory and its applications. In general, economics has two sub-fields: microeconomics and macroeconomics. While microeconomics studies behavior of individual decision makers, households (consumers), and firms (producers) in specific markets, macroeconomics studies aggregate economic behavior (economy‐wide phenomena). Microeconomics and macroeconomics will be covered in the first and second semesters, respectively.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要目的在於以更貼近生活、更生動有趣的方式介紹經濟學，由現實生活中隨處可見的行為或是現象出發，先將經濟學背後繁瑣複雜的數學略過不談，以更有趣的角度讓學生在上過傳統的經濟學課程以後，可以有一個較輕鬆有趣的方式更佳了解經濟學，有助於引領初次學習的學生對經濟學產生興趣。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為一年的經濟學原理課程。上學期主要介紹個體經濟學的基本知識，包括供需模型、消費者行為、廠商理論與產業結構、要素市場的供給與需求、政府職能、環境與永續發展及不確定與訊息經濟學。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這門課介紹總體經濟指標、總體經濟理論以及政府的總體經濟政策。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is an introductory course in the principles of economic behaviors and decisions, as well as the analytical methods for studying economic issues.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 經濟學是大學生最基礎的社會科學訓練學科，而由經濟學衍伸而出的各種知識發展，也是當前學術研究的主流。因此，本課程旨在培養學生對經濟行為的思辨與認識，從個體經濟學出發，慢慢擴大至總體，逐漸描繪出這世界經濟的輪廓。最後，也希望經濟學能夠提供學生一個理性的思考方式，為將來各種社會學科奠下良好的分析基礎。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces basic macroeconomics including measurement of national income, fiscal and monetary policies, and so on.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
Principles of Economics consist of 2 parts, microeconomics and macroeconomics. In this semester, we shall focus on the second half that study the economy as a whole. The goal of macroeconomics is to explain the economic changes that affect many household, firms and markets simultaneously. But the basic tools such as the analysis of demand and supply we have learned from Microeconomics still play essential roles in the study of Macroeconomics as the economy as a whole is a collection of these individual economic agents together.
This is a participant-centered learning course where students will take an active discussion role in the class. Students are expected to read assigned materials before coming to the class. While lecturing is still part of the classroom activity, in most of meeting students have to be actively involved in discussions over the assigned materials of concern and the cases under study. Therefore, the degrees of participation from each student shares a part when evaluating her performance.
Students taking the course are not required to equip themselves with knowledge on calculus,but should expect mathematical symbols to be employed in class whenever necessary.More importantly, the curiosity about how people act or behave is essential to succeed inthe course.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This is the second part of a one-year introductory course to Economics. The core content of this semester will focus on macroeconomics. Macroeconomics, according to Professor Mankiw, looks at the economy as a whole. This course will examine the economy in the long run (when prices are flexible) before examining the economy in the short run. 
Students in this class will learn economy-wide phenomena, including output, inflation, unemployment, and economic growth; as well as tools to examine policy issues related to those important economic variables.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Economics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 針對商管學院同學之學習需求，本課程主要目的，首先在於建立基本經濟學的知識概念及經濟問題的分析能力，進而透過案例討論，特別強調經濟學如何被用來當作制定管理決策之工具設計並瞭解公共政策以評價現代經濟體系之運作，及確實體認經濟學在現時生活的實用性。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財政學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of  Public Finance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 財政是政府部門的財務活動；簡單來說，指的是公共支出與收入。有別於經濟學，財政學除了重視經濟政策的效率面議題外，更加強調經濟政策（特別是財政政策）的公平面議題，故追求分配的公平便成為政府存在與其施政的重要基礎。本課程主要是以研究、分析和評估政府收支計畫的課程，希望能建立修課同學對政府政策的認知與分析能力，並藉此引發對公共事務的觀察與關心。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財政學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of  Public Finance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Public finance is a field of economics mainly concerned with government (or other collective organizations') activities and the associated economic effects. The understanding of government activities and the associated economic effects helps in the design and administration of public policies. The field is often divided into questions of what the government should do or are doing (expenditure side), and questions of how to pay for those activities (revenue side).

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財政學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of  Public Finance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 財政學為一學期兩學期的課程，上學期的授課內容主要為公共支出，包括福利經濟學，公共財，外部性，公共選擇，成本效益分析，公營事業定價，社會保險，與福利支出。下學期的授課內容則包括政府收入與地方財政。政府收入的內容含租稅歸宿，租稅效率與公平，租稅與誘因，個人與營利事業所得稅，與負債。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財政學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of  Public Finance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 財政學是研究政府經濟行為的一門社會科學。主要研究議題包括政府部門的支出和收入行為對經濟體系中各個組成份子所產生的影響及財政收支政策的有效性。同時亦討論政府應該採取什麼收支政策才是最優選擇。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Public Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為公共行政領域之基礎課程，課程目的在於引介學生對於公共行政理論與實務的基本內涵，培養學生對於公共行政學科的興趣，並進而擁有分析公共行政及處理公共事務的相關能力。對於未來有志從事公職的同學，本課程亦希冀培育出國家文官所必備之核心素養以及正確的服務價值觀。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 社會學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Sociology
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為提供非社會學本科系同學之社會學入門課程，旨在建立學生社會學想像與思辯之基本能力，期使學生明瞭何謂社會學、社會學何用，繼而得以透過社會學的基本知識來瞭解諸般社會現象，並得以承接後續之進階社會科學相關課程。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Political Science
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程以一學期授課。大致依照政治學的研究範圍與方法、相關基本概念、政府運作、非政府(市民社會)運作、重要政策、國際關係等順序，用兩個學期對政治學做一鳥瞰式全覽。其中政府運作、非政府(市民社會)運作、重要政策三大部分，將各以數次進度詳細說明。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Diplomacy
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course will be divided into two parts. The first half of the course will introduce the basic framework of International Relations studies, including the theoretical approaches, the actors in global affairs, the decision-making process and the levels of analysis. Then in the second half of the course, we will put the analytical framework into perspective with selected topics that are eminent in our time, such as international trade, cultural globalization, human development and human rights, and preservation of the environment. Throughout the semester, students will be divided into study groups. On each topic, students are expected to participate in gathering information and discussing with class with formed arguments. And at the end of the semester, each study group will pick a current event in world politics and present it to the class with a chosen analytical approach and also offer a viewpoint of the situation.

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Diplomacy
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將介紹國際關係之主流理論，國際社會的主要成員，以及各種成員之間如何互動，重大國際事件之發生經過，以及影響國際事件的複雜因素等等，以提升同學了解國際事務重要問題的能力。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Management Information Systems
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Software Application Introduction” is a practical training course. The goal is to train e-era college students to be confident and potential using all kinds of software while facing fierce information technology development. The pedagogical strategy is knowledge discussion and implementation, includes (1) Understand all types of software with integrity, and be able to compare and analyze. (2) Understand how to choose different tools under various circumstances, and comprehend the demand of information software in the future. (3) Not only memorize the knowledge but apply it. With enough and success implementation experiences, students become confident using information technology. (4) Cultivate leadership, organization, and communication ability through teamwork. Students will be also familiar with internet interactive tools.

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Management Information Systems
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「軟體應用導論」課程希望能培養學生在使用軟體上的能力與信心。藉由知識的分享討論與做中學的教學方式，讓學生能獲得以下知識：(1) 對資訊領域的各類軟體有較完整的初步了解，並能加以比較分析； (2) 知道在不同的工作中如何去選擇不同的支援工具；未來職場上可能會使用到的軟體需求為何； (3) 透過實作的方式，讓學生增加實作經驗，並提升使用資訊科技的信心； (4) 藉由團隊合作的專案實作，培養學生在領導、組織、溝通等能力，並熟練網路互動工具的使用。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Management Information Systems
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程共有50%課程面授（含期中、期末考），其他50%課程採非同步遠距教學，課程每週有一個單元主題，在單元主題內以下述方式進行： 
(1)課程講授：如果是遠距教學，則將教材以錄影及教學網頁二種方式置網站上。 
(2)主題討論：對於價值分享類主題，放置該單元之相關議題，讓同學發表意見或心得。 
(3)單元測驗及作業：對技術類則以作業或測驗作為教師評分及同學自我學習評量依據。 

師生互動討論方式以3種方式進行 
(1) 網上互動：主要利用「課程公告」功能告知同學訊息，以「課程討論」功能解答同學問題及同儕互動，以「主題討論」功能誘使同學分享心得，期中、末考前以線上討論方式及時回答問題。以及「常見問題」功能協助同學自助式學習。 
(2)e-mail：學生可以利用“智慧大師”軟體所提供之e-mail功能，發信給老師，老師也可以發信給全班或某個同學。 
(3)office hour ：老師提供每週2小時office hour，讓同學可至研室問問題或討論。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Financial accounting is the field of accounting concerned with the summary, analysis and reporting of financial transactions pertaining to a business. This involves the preparation of financial statements available for public consumption. Stockholders, suppliers, banks, employees, government agencies, business owners, and other stakeholders are examples of people interested in receiving such information for decision making purposes. In this class, students will be educated with the contemporary financial accounting fundamental concepts, knowledge, and practices. Lectures, discussions, and tests will be given throughout the semester.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Accounting reports are an important means of communication with investors and a basis for writing contracts both within and outside the firm. The two-course sequence represents an exciting and challenging introduction to financial accounting.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to provide a basic understanding of financial accounting and covers various financial accounting topics, including basic accounting theory, accounting principles, procedures to record business transactions, measurements of assets and liabilities and preparations for financial statements. More importantly, students will learn how accounting information assists financial statement users in facilitating their decision making.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to introduce students to the assumptions, principles, and practice of financial accounting. The course content consists of a mix of descriptive material, financial accounting rules, and the application of these rules to various business situations. Topics include a detailed discussion of the accounting cycle, accounting for assets, liabilities, and shareholders’ equity, and financial statement analysis. The course is part of the foundation for all advanced business school classes, and as such is of great importance for building a successful business career.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This is a one-year course.
Topics for the first semester include Descriptive Statistics, Discrete Probability Distributions, Continuous Probability Distributions, Sampling Methods, Estimation and Confidence Intervals, and One-Sample and Two-Sample Tests of Hypothesis.
Topics for the second semester include Analysis of Variance, Linear Regression, Time Series and Forecasting, Nonparametric Methods, Statistical Quality Control, and Decision Theory.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Success in any organization requires the use of cost accounting concepts and practices. The two-course sequence builds a foundation in the vocabulary and concepts of cost accounting, presents a process for budgeting, and provides an overview of various tools and models used to support managerial decision making such as product pricing, capital expenditures, and performance evaluation.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will provide an overview of the managerial decision-making process in Finance. It will emphasize the fact that financial management is part of a broader management process, linking an organization with external markets in which it must raise its funds, purchase its inputs, and sell its products. To this end, considerable emphasis is placed on developing a sound conceptual framework along with specific skills and techniques. Topics to be discussed include objectives of financial management, discounted cash flow techniques, value in markets, capital budgeting, establishing target rates of return, risk and capital budgeting, financing policy, cost of capital, and working capital management.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 民法概要(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
民法是私人之間法律關係的基礎法律規範，幾乎可以說，所有可能的私有財產或身分關係的法律糾紛，皆係運用「民法為基礎的法律規範」以達到「定紛止爭」的目的。生活在工商經濟活動甚為頻繁的現代社會裡，重要的民法基礎知識是維護生活利益不可或缺的常識，從生活用品的買賣、旅行契約的應有內容到借款投資的法律風險等等，如能瞭解法律、預先做好風險管理，必能預防糾紛，順利的實現生活或交易的目的。
基於前述的觀點，本課程之目標有下列三項：
(一) 瞭解一般人必備的法律知識
(二) 建立預防糾紛的風險管理觀念
(三) 培養專業經理人應有的民法基礎

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 民法概要(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本學期課程主要區分四大部分講解。第一部分為民法總則部分。於此部分將說明權利主體、權利客體、法律行為、意思表示之要件及其瑕疵。第二部分為債法部分。於此再細分為債總與債各部分講解。於債總部分將講解債之關係之基本概念、契約之成立與生效、侵權行為之債、債務不履行(將區分給付不能、給付遲延與不完全給付說明)、契約之解除。於債各部分將講解買賣契約、贈與契約、租賃契約、借貸契約 、委任契約、僱傭契約與承攬契約之債。第三部分為物權部分，將說明物權之概念、種類、效力與物權之變動、所有權及抵押權。第四部分為身分法部分。於親屬部分將說明結婚之要件與效力、離婚之方式、要件與效力以及父母子女關係。於繼承部分將探討遺產繼承之基本法理、遺產繼承人、遺產之分割與遺囑之相關問題。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要是針對非法律同學(特別是商學院)為授課對象，因此授課目標在於使修習者瞭解與商事行為有密切相關的商事法規，以期建立其法律及商事的整合觀念，有助於未來從事實務工作時經營政策或策略的提出與執行，畢竟經營政策或策略與現行的法規環境息息相關。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 民法概要(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
商事法係民法之特別法，本課程兼顧「民法基礎與商事法規範之認識」。由於民法是私人之間法律關係的基礎法律規範，所有可能的私有財產或身分關係的法律糾紛，皆係運用「民法為基礎的法律規範」以達到「定紛止爭」的目的。生活在工商經濟活動甚為頻繁的現代社會裡，重要的民法基礎知識是維護生活利益不可或缺的常識，從生活用品的買賣、旅行契約的應有內容到借款投資的法律風險等等，如能瞭解法律、預先做好風險管理，必能預防糾紛，順利地實現生活上或交易上的目的。

商事法則進一步規範主要商業交易行為安全與秩序，傳統上以公司法、票據法、保險法與海商法為範圍，而智慧財產權之保護、有價證券之交易秩序、公平交易制度與消費者安全之維護等重要課題，尚須其他法律規範的相輔相成。

基於前述的觀點，本課程之目標有下列三項：
(一) 瞭解商業交易必備的法律知識
(二) 建立預防糾紛的風險管理觀念
(三) 培養專業經理人應有的商事法基礎

一、Course objective
Civil law is the fundamental of business law. This course provides the knowledge of basic essential of civil law and the principle of business law concurrently. Because civil law is the fundamental law of personal legal relationship all possible legal disputes of private property or status are resolved through the enforcement of civil law. In our modern society business activities are very frequent therefore basic knowledge of civil law is essential common sense to ensure commerce or ordinary life benefits. If people can understand law and make risk management in advance you can prevent disputes from daily purchase travel contract to the risk of load investment and realize the legal benefit of life or transaction.

Business law further rules the security system and order of major business transaction. Traditionally it ranges from Company law Insurance law Bill law and Maritime law. However we still need other laws to help the protection of intellectual property transaction regulation of securities fair transaction system and safeguard of consumer protection etc.

Base on the above opinions the objectives of this course is shown as following three:
1. To develop the essential concept and norm of business law for professional managers
2. Understand the required legal knowledge in business transaction
3. Set up the risk management opinion of preventing disputes in business transaction.

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 商事法課程主要授課對象為商學院同學，係以介紹商業交易經常使用的商事法律為主旨，協助同學瞭解商業行為進行時所必須遵守的基本法律架構及重要規定。本學期將以最基本也最常用的商事法律：公司法與票據法，作為授課內容。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 商事法(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程以商學院學生為授課對象，旨在培養學生對於商事法律行為的基本認識以及我國商事法律體系及其原理的宏觀理解，協助學生瞭解商事法律如何在實務中運作。本課程為一學年課程，第一學期著重在商事法導論、公司法及證券交易法之基本內容與規範的介紹，期使學生對於商業組織的運作及治理有基礎但全面的認識；第二學期(即本學期)將聚焦在票據法與重要金融法規之相關內容與原理的介紹，希望能增進學生對於重要商事與金融活動之法規範的理解。本教學大綱僅列第二學期之規劃。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 商事法(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 商事法規範主要商業交易行為安全與秩序，傳統上以公司法、票據法、保險法與海商法為範圍，本學期以票據法為講授範圍。課程進行以教師講授為主要方式。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 商事法(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 股市是經濟的櫥窗，本學期將為各位同學介紹規範股票市場交易行為的證券交易法，協助同學進一步認識股票市場的遊戲規則，並透過著名案例的討論，建立對於證券交易案事的基本理解及分析能力。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Psychology
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 學習、思考、與應用心理學的理論與方法，以有助於個人現代生活的適應、人生成長、與迎接未來的競爭與挑戰，亦即透過「自我探索」與「標竿學習」進而提昇「個人競爭力」。

Course Department: Integrated Curriculum by Dept. of Mathematical Sciences
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 微積分是學習高等數學最重要的入門課程 , 本課程由極限的概念出發 , 探討函數的連續性與光滑性質 , 逐步引導學生學習微分與積分的觀念技巧 , 使學生能將微積分運用於未來學習之專業課程或提供對數學有興趣的學生基本觀念 , 以利其學習更進階之數學課程.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 一、探討何謂健康體適能

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
羽球是一個易學難精的運動項目，是一個適合台灣積極推廣發展的運動，也深受大學生的喜愛。 
此課程為羽球初級，授課內容以羽球手法與步法的基本動作為主。 
結合基本動作與比賽方法，講解規則及裁判法，使學生能參與比賽，分享經驗，欣賞球賽，並以羽球做為終身運動。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
羽球是一個易學難精的運動項目，是一個適合台灣積極推廣發展的運動，也深受大學生的喜愛。 
此課程為羽球初級，授課內容以羽球手法與步法的基本動作為主。 
結合基本動作與比賽方法，講解規則及裁判法，使學生能參與比賽，分享經驗，欣賞球賽，並以羽球做為終身運動。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程是讓初學者了解桌球簡史及桌球運動基本常識（場地器材、球拍、膠皮、握抬法介紹）。從桌球基本技術—以上旋球（定點）為主，學習反手推擋、正手反擊、平擊發球、反手平擊發球及左推右攻之結合技術的練習，並務求動作紮實。期中則是桌球比賽的單、雙打規則介紹，並實地演練，來提升對規則的熟悉與比賽經驗。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程是讓初學者了解桌球簡史及桌球運動基本常識（場地器材、球拍、膠皮、握抬法介紹）。從桌球基本技術—以上旋球（定點）為主，學習反手推擋、正手反擊、平擊發球、反手平擊發球及左推右攻之結合技術的練習，並務求動作紮實。期中則是桌球比賽的單、雙打規則介紹，並實地演練，來提升對規則的熟悉與比賽經驗。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要宗旨在協助學生學習、改善籃球基本動作，建立正確的打球觀念，學習團隊合作精神，並且提升觀賞籃球比賽的興趣。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 主要針對身體訓練時，暸解身體形態、身體機能、運動素質及健康等，讓授課者認識如何執行健身運動，並增進健力相關知識及訓練相關基礎，以利用自我重量、徒手式、簡易器具及重量訓練器械等進行健力課學習知識及動作模式暸解，同時，採用各種動作訓練及肌肉訓練方法來達到鍛鍊身體，增強肌力，發達肌肉以改善體型，使個人身體達到健、力、美之境界。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
一、本課程為羽球初級課程，著重在基礎學習,透過一系列的基本技術學習,讓同學對羽球運動有基本的認識,培養羽球運動的能力。
二、採用循序漸進的教學法結合小組的輪流演練方式,除加強個人羽球基本技術外並增進團隊合作的觀念。
三、讓同學了解羽球運動特性並設計安排練習法和小組比賽讓理論與實際結合,羽球運動與生活結合。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 一、熟練排球的基本動作技術。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 此課程是針對完全不會游泳的學生來做設計，因此教材內容會從基礎的適應水性開始。為兼顧不同程度學生需求，在課程安排上會採能力分組，給予不同的練習內容。針對初學者，上課以教授正確泳姿與動作概念為主，並幫助部分學生克服對水的恐懼，以循序漸進的方式練習，並個別調整泳姿。對於已經會游泳的學生將給予課表，設定練習重點與游泳距離，讓學生在長距離的水道進行練習，提升自我的體能與技術。

Course Department: Physical Education

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[女]—彼拉提斯墊上技巧
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 從soma的角度看待身體，本課程基於身心學 (Somatics) 理念進行彼拉提斯墊上核心運動。藉由彼拉提斯技巧的操作學習正確的身體姿態、有效率的身體使用、強化核心肌力；更輔以靜坐、呼吸練習、身體構圖等身心技法，透過一系列對身體重新探訪的練習，開發身體覺察、體驗不同的身體感受，以及瞭解個人在自我調整和控制上，身與心的互動關係，進而達到身心平衡的狀態。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 慢速壘球是綜合了投、接、打、跑四個基本動作的運動，只要具備基本運動能力要求，不須精湛、成熟的技巧即可參與比賽，並達到健身、休閒、娛樂之目的。本課程主要以單元教學及分組比賽進行，從各項基本動作循序漸進學起，再彙整單元教學學習成果運用於分組比賽。分組比賽先採循環賽再進行挑戰賽。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程旨在學習與培養良好的各種基本技術外，並加強單、雙打技術、戰術的理論與應用的結合，以期能在比賽中獲得有效的成果。且透過課程中針對比賽制度、設計與安排的學習及進行比賽、觀摩，同時學習裁判執法經驗，使學生在享受桌球運動之餘，也能提升良好的社會行為與團隊合作精神。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—土風舞初級
CourseName: Physical Education [male and female]--Folk Dance Primer
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將介紹多個國家與民族的土風舞，土風舞一詞是譯自英文Folk Dance，Folk 一字有全民、民間、通俗的意思，英文Folk Dance有時也會以Ethnic Dance (民族舞蹈；民俗舞蹈)替代。土風舞受到歷史發展、地理條件、宗教、風俗、工作等因素影響而形成帶有民族或地區文化特色的舞蹈。原本屬於全民的舞蹈，土風舞不像其他的表演藝術或競技性的舞蹈要求精緻性與困難度，大多數的土風舞動作都不會太複雜，難度太高。配合有特色的音樂，簡單又有特色的肢體動作，早已被各國採用為體育課或相關課程的教材。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 1.認知拳擊學前應自我準備知識(準備運動穿著，手綁帶，牙套，跳繩，自我體能訓練等)

Course Department: Physical Education

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—鐵人三項初級
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 要完成非凡的事情，必須要先有超凡的夢想。目標那麼高遠，過程那麼艱辛，對大多數的人而言，完成鐵人三項比賽似乎是不可能。鐵人三項能鼓勵學生勇於挑戰自己的極限，看得更高，走得更遠。鐵人三項是集合了卓越、熱情、承諾於一身的宣示，它也是體能與意志的考驗。鐵人三項指的是堅忍、耐久與超越自我極限的歷程，它所展現的是一種境界，當我們努力跨越自己的界限，完成全程並贏得鐵人頭銜！

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
1.透過有氧運動建立良好的心肺適能。
2.增強肌力與肌耐力維持較佳的健康體能。
3.增進柔軟度避免運動傷害/維持較佳的健康適能。
4.維持優勢健康適能暨提升生活品質。
5.透過本課程培養堅毅之精神進而發現生命之本質。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—太極導引初級
CourseName: Physical Education [male and female]--Tai Chi Dao Ying Premier
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 由當代人熊衛所創的太極導引是一門融通匯貫陳家、楊家、郝家太極拳理精華與丹道氣功而成的養生保健法，共分為「引體」六式與「導氣」六式；所謂「引體令柔」，其目的在於使人體九大關節透過無限放鬆的旋轉扭絞，由外而內，由淺而深，逐步絞緊鬆弛，使五臟六腑得到微妙的自我按摩效用。「導氣令和」則在深、長、綿、勻的呼吸吐納中，配合肢體、筋骨的鬆透舒冶，使全身經絡氣脈通暢健旺，以達到舒緩壓力、調和身心，預防疾病的奇妙功效。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
一、本課程為羽球初級課程，著重在基礎學習,透過一系列的基本技術學習,讓同學對羽球運動有基本的認識,培養羽球運動的能力。
二、採用循序漸進的教學法結合小組的輪流演練方式,除加強個人羽球基本技術外並增進團隊合作的觀念。
三、讓同學了解羽球運動特性並設計安排練習法和小組比賽讓理論與實際結合,羽球運動與生活結合。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—慢速壘球中級
CourseName: Physical Education [male and female]-- Intermediate SlowSoftball
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 慢速壘球是綜合了投、接、打、跑四個基本動作的運動，只要具備基本運動能力要求，不須精湛、成熟的技巧即可參與比賽，並達到健身、休閒、娛樂之目的。本課程主要以單元教學及分組比賽進行，從各項基本動作循序漸進學起，再彙整單元教學學習成果運用於分組比賽。分組比賽先採循環賽再進行挑戰賽。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—定向越野
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程旨在暸解定向越野運動的基本理論與規則，並學習定向運動的基本及綜合應用技術，透過定向運動的參與，除強健身體各部位肌力與適能，並培養堅毅忍耐的精神外，進而學習地圖導航的能力，將其用於日常生活。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—定向越野
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程旨在暸解定向越野運動的基本理論與規則，並學習定向運動的基本及綜合應用技術，透過定向運動的參與，除強健身體各部位肌力與適能，並培養堅毅忍耐的精神外，進而學習地圖導航的能力，將其用於日常生活。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—現代舞初級
CourseName: Physical Education  [male and female]-- Modern Dance Primer
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 現代舞作為體育課程的選項之一，雖與表演藝術的「現代舞」同名，但所強調的是一種動作教育的過程，不是指形式化之各類舞蹈技巧訓練，學習者將體驗跳舞、創作、表演、欣賞與討論等活動，過程中將以拉邦動作分析理論的各個動作元素－身體、時間、空間、力量與關係做為探索的重點，從模仿、即興入門，經由引導啟發之方式，讓學習者，自在地運用想像力和創造力，不斷學習探索肢體動作表現的可能性，增進肢體運動能力，達到表達、溝通及自我實現的目的。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由課堂學習與實務練習，了解肌力與體能訓練設計的生理意義與原理，並理解體能之間的交互關係與實務變化方式。將理論結合測試、診斷相關實務課程，具備基礎的肌力訓練能力。

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由課堂學習與實務練習，了解肌力與體能訓練設計的生理意義與原理，並理解體能之間的交互關係與實務變化方式。將理論結合測試、診斷相關實務課程，具備基礎的肌力訓練能力。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 體育[男女合班]—排球實務
Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
1.了解攻擊及守備戰術 
2.熟練單項技術能力(發球、接發球、傳球、攻擊、攔網及守備) 
3.提昇多項組合技術能力(接發球+攻擊、攔網+攻擊、守備+攻擊) 
4.1-1人、2-2人、3-3人、4-4人及6-6人比賽之應用及賞析(以較複雜時間差為主)

Course Department: Physical Education
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 凡具本校正式學籍、籃球運動成績優良，或具備運動發展潛能，均可參加代表隊選拔。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語語言學概論(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides an introduction to the scientific study of language with special focus on English language. Students will learn how to examine linguistic problems, diagnose communication gaps and evaluate their own language systems in a scientific way. Through these inquiry processes, students will have better understanding of the connections and possible contradictions between forms and meanings in language use.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語口語訓練(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This oral training module requires students to develop various speaking skills and the instructor emphasizes creative ideas. Students are especially encouraged to apply their ideas exchanged during class discussion to their presentations and other tasks required for this module. The training of speaking skills is combined with reading and writing practice. Students must be prepared to preview their assigned texts before attending class. All submitted scripts and other homework, unless otherwise announced, will be available for the class to read and discuss as course materials. There are also group projects and other class activities including workshops and film screening as well as lectures from guest speakers.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語口語訓練(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is designed to help students improve their communication skills in English through class discussions as well as listening and reading practices. Students will be provided with opportunities to express their thoughts on various topics in both formal and informal settings. They are required to participate in pair and group discussions, and to present ideas on assigned topics as a group and an individual.

Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to provide students with an overview and basic understanding of English Phonetics. Topics to be covered include phonetic transcription, the speech mechanism, the characteristics and classification of English vowels and consonants, sentence stress and rhythm, intonation patterns, and English variations.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英美文學(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為英美文學,共計兩學期授課完畢.課程設計為第一學期英國文學,第二學期美國文學,此為第二學期.課程內容安排以時間為為軸,起自獨立戰爭,而後超驗主義,地方色彩,而後失落世代,沈默世代,最後止於垮派與當代.每週以一位作家作為一個單元,以該作者之作品為主授課,以時代背景與藝文思潮為輔.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英文作文（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course teaches students how to generate and organize their ideas, to order and link paragraphs into cohesive and coherent essays, to create the various genres of academic essays, and to draft, revise and edit their written work.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英文作文（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Systematical application of English vocabulary, grammar, and rhetoric in order to be well-equipped with skills in presenting a concise, persuasive essay.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英文作文（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This Composition module requires students to develop various writing skills and the instructor emphasizes critical thinking as well as creative ideas. Students are especially encouraged to apply their ideas exchanged during class discussion to their essays and other writing tasks required for this module.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英文作文（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course aims to familiarize students with the fundamentals of academic writing, starting from basics of paragraph writing, including the formation of questions for research, idea generation and structuring, collectin relevant supporting materials. Students are furthermore exposed to various styles of composition with the final intention to pave the way for students’ access to the domain of research paper writing. In addition to lectures, the class will also make use of active class discussions and workshops. The teacher will also provide additional materials, including handouts and videos, for homework preparation.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級日語(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將講授初級程度的重要文法、常見詞彙、句型及相關會話表現，並做短文閱讀訓練，期使學生在經過一年的學習之後，具備日檢N5程度的語文能力。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級日語(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
在每週3節課的時間內，依序採用以下授課模式，以期達到學習效能。 
1.學習3-5個核心句型。 
2.口說及書寫練習，強化對句型之掌握。 
3.導入日常會話，提升句型的運用能力。 
4.相關日本文化之介紹。 
5.課前及課後以多媒體教材輔助預習及複習。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級日語(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程係針對初學者，給予整體之訓練。除加強生詞、文型之解說外，並注重發音及語調之流暢感。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級日語(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為日文輔系必修課程中的文法課程，從動詞變化到常體為止。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 學習日文初級後段的動詞各種活用.敘述較長的日常生活會話及較帶感情,推測之說法.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 日本文化的講解:老師在每章開頭都附上了一段日本的文化常識。這些常識描述了日本人的風俗習慣、節慶活動、以及日本特有的特色。在這裡，為了增加學生學習日語的熱情及加深對日語的理解，老師意在使學生對日本人的生活方式及風俗習慣產生興趣。希望學生更加理解文化的多元，並對章節裡介紹的主題產生更具體的感官印象。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 1.熟悉日語發音之音質、音量、音調的特色，讓同學的口調更自然。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程定位於日文學習之初級課程。在「聽說讀寫」四技能中，著重於「說」的部分。以口說的方式進行演練，熟悉初級的語彙與句型，循序漸進地奠定穩固的基礎，進而發揮創意活用所學，培養日語的口說表達能力。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為會話課程，因此非常注重課堂上的口語練習。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: １、学習日本語的文字。日本語の文字を学習する。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 日語會話（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 採對答及實際演練等互動式教學，同時佐以CD之播放，讓同學習得正確之發音，養成適切表達正確日語之能力。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 中級日語(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Dept. of Japanese Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
在每週3節課的時間內，依序採用以下授課模式，以期達到學習效能。 
1.學習3-5個核心句型。 
2.口說及書寫練習，強化對句型之掌握。 
3.導入日常會話，提升句型的運用能力。 
4.相關日本文化之介紹。 
5.課前及課後以多媒體教材輔助預習及複習。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 閱讀指導(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of English Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This course offers students the opportunity to be exposed to a variety of reading materials, including literature, popular fiction, non-fiction, and general news media [both print and online]. 
-Strategies and techniques to increase vocabulary and comprehension will be implemented using materials with both lexical complexity and density of information. Critical thinking skills and a critical response to reading will also be taught, especially as they relate to culture-specific material. Extensive reading materials at independent levels of readability will be provided by outside reading material; intensive or close reading materials will form the basis for the instructional level materials used during class.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程承續上學期 主要介紹我國會計準則對於負債類及股東權益的帳項處理 特殊會計問題例如所得稅會計 租賃會計 現金流量表以及會計變動與錯誤更正等 並說明國際會計準則的規定 以利朝向國際接軌邁進

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 國際公法(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Dept. of Diplomacy Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程希望透過教師授課、案例報告及討論的方式，教授國際公法各主題的理論、實踐及運用。課程中將針對國際法各領域之各論及原則做介紹，除使用教科書等資料協助授課外，另將針對每週課程主題及指定閱讀內容及配合案例報告，於課程中提問並鼓勵討論，希望修課同學能經由聽講及討論過程中學習，並擴展其對國際法認識之深度及廣度。

Course Department: Dept. of Diplomacy Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 1648年西伐利亞體系(Treaty of Westphalia)建立後，以國家為基本單位的國際體系確立，「主權國家」成為現代國際關係中的主要角色。隨著16世紀近代資本主義國家出現，世界經濟體系形成，透過各國經濟貿易和國際事務的發展，加上國際爭端和戰爭的頻繁，形成國際組織誕生的原因。西伐利亞會議、維也納會議、歐洲協商等皆為多邊國際會議，標誌國際組織的萌芽。緊接著19世紀末20世紀初，各種專門性國際組織大量出現，一次大戰後的國際聯盟亦象徵現代國際組織的形成。二戰後，以全球性國際政治組織～聯合國的建立，使國際組織進入了成熟發展時期，種類日益增多，範圍不斷擴大，數量急劇猛增，影響和作用也不斷加強。

Course Department: Dept. of Diplomacy Course Schedule for Minor Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
橫看成嶺側成峰，同一歷史事件在不同立場的解讀下，卻可能得出迥然不同的結論。中國外交史於今日兩岸多元的史觀下，即有多重樣貌的詮釋，更遑論從西方的角度看待。國際關係雖是一門相對年輕的學科，但話語權百年來仍為西方大國所掌握。然而，奠基於西方特殊歷史經驗的當代國際關係論述，是否也能全然適用於東方的中國？此乃有志於國際關係的學子，所應深刻反思的命題。
課程將從中國自身的主觀理念與所處的客觀現實談起，再帶領同學由不同的角度回顧史實，並適時交互運用中國傳統概念與西方國關理論解讀中國外交史，以啟發學子的多元思考。

Course Department: Dept. of Korean Course Schedule for Minor Students

Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程取以語言學觀點分析唐詩的相關研究為講授基礎，一方面說明語言學分析方法與傳統詩評鑑賞「超脫妙悟」的不同，另一方面，則是讓學習者建立起以句法理論分析唐詩語言的基本知識。為了讓課程內容能有初步的系統性，本課程採以王力《漢語詩律學》、梅祖麟〈文法與詩中的模稜〉以及曹逢甫〈從主題—評論看唐宋詩的句法與賞析〉（上）（下）、曹逢甫〈四行的世界—從言談分析的觀點看絕句的結構〉四文獻，作為唐詩句法分析的初步依憑。

Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 中國古典詩與日常生活緊密關聯，而非脫離現實、不切世務者。詩人創作必有其意圖，有意圖則具根本之態度，無論抒情、實用、遊戲，三者態度實質相互含括又互不相屬。因此，本課程先就抒情、實用、遊戲三個向度，掌握詩人創作之意圖與態度。接續介紹古典詩的發展脈絡，大致了解詩的整體演進歷程。繼而再以時事、愛情、詠懷、別離、自然、遺民六大主題為課程主要方向，先從切合時事且具強烈現實意義之詩入手，漸次進入以表現心靈內在為主的自我呈現之詩；再由詩人精神超越之向度趨返於現實。冀能於培養閱讀、鑑賞古典詩的興趣、能力之外，增進對人文、社會的關懷。以下則對上述六大主題詳加說明：

CourseName: Chinese- Readings of Classical Chinese Proses
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 古典散文不僅具有高度的文學藝術價值，而且亦包含豐富的學術思想內涵。深入古典散文的世界不但可體會中國文學之優美，同時亦能略窺古代學術之堂奧。本課程包含「文學行旅與地景書寫」、「儒學價值與文明衝突」和「多元視角下的詮釋與解讀』等三個單元。每個單元由若干古典散文名篇組成，藉由研讀這些作品，來體會思考每個單元蘊含的內容與指向的理念。

CourseName: Chinese- Readings of Classical Chinese Proses
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
古典散文看似與現代生活脫節，缺乏實用性。然而古典散文並非只有聖人的道德教條，也不是只有文人的審美意趣，還有那些精心設計、縱橫恣肆的議論文章。這些議論文章，旨在說服讀者，傳遞作者獨特的想法。古人對於論述的層次是如何設計？這些設計又起了什麼樣的作用？倘若能揭去古代漢語的面紗，就能看見藏在我們不熟悉的語言背後那些珍貴的資產。 
中國文學批評宗師劉勰曾說過：「觀千劍而後識器，操千曲而後曉聲。」廣泛的閱讀，可以提升一個人的閱讀鑒賞能力。寫作能力的培養或許依各人情性不同而異，然而閱讀能力卻是一個接受高等教育的大學生必備的技能。閱讀，不是只有單純接受訊息，而是要能看透文字背後的意義、文化與價值觀，檢視論據是否堅實，養成獨立思考的能力，才不會在當今充斥各種論述的網路世界中無所適從。 
因此本課程先介紹文學與古典散文，而後逐篇導讀與討論選文。本課程選文以語錄、議論、寓言為範圍，以四個學習目標為方向：摘要寫作、文本分析、詮釋方法與寫作策略，將看似枯燥的論說古文化為今用。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 主要分為導論、選讀及討論三大部分。

CourseName: Readings of  Selected Classical Chinese Fiction
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程以唐人小說的內容為主，使用的教科書《唐人小說》共收錄十四篇唐代著名小說，並依照故事內容分成五大類，分別是：１．愛情類：〈李娃傳〉、〈鶯鶯傳〉、〈霍小玉傳〉，２．歷史類：〈長恨傳〉、〈東城老父傳〉，３．俠義類：〈虬髯客傳〉、〈謝小娥傳〉、〈紅綫傳〉、〈聶隱娘〉，４．幻夢類：〈枕中記〉、〈南柯太守傳〉，５．志異類：〈離魂記〉、〈柳毅傳〉、〈無雙傳〉。

CourseName: Readings of  Selected Classical Chinese Fiction
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「四大奇書」是中國人耳熟能詳的章回小說經典，也衍生出不少次文化的電影、戲劇、漫畫、遊戲等等，已融入我們的文化心理，但是實際上去閱讀文本的人卻不見得那麼多。人們對於四大奇書的理解，也往往會有一些先入為主的看法，小覷了這些小說。然而，學界對於四大奇書的研究與詮釋，已取得一定的成績，往往能帶給我們嶄新的視野，值得向大家介紹。本課程希望透過實際閱讀與講師講解，帶給學生對於四大奇書的不同理解，並從其中的敘事符碼去窺見四大奇書的遼闊世界。此外，透過分組討論的形式，也有助於學生學習團隊合作與口語表達的重要。

CourseName: Chinese- Readings of Selected Modern Chinese Poems
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程內容約分成四個面向：一、現代詩概論。二、台灣現代詩史。三、詩作閱讀與賞析。四、現代詩創作。 

在概論部分，主要探究何謂現代詩，首先將透過古典與現代詩歌的對比，藉此掌握現代詩的特色，由此擴及現代詩的基本要素以及當代批評視野底下對於台灣現代詩的各種分類。 

就詩史的部分，首先將介紹日治時期的台灣現代詩和其所代表的始源意義，其次是導覽國民政府遷台後、尤其著重在50-70年代的台灣現代詩發展，此中特別側重於詩社群的互動及其辯證發展之過程，最後是展演80年代迄今的當代台灣現代詩之多元面貌。 

而關於詩作閱讀與分析的部分，將就各斷代或各項主題選取重要詩人及其代表作品進行選讀，並教導對於新詩的賞析方法，藉以提升對於文本作品的鑑賞能力。 

最後在創作方面，將實際練習現代詩之創作，包含意象的形塑、字句的選取以及分行換段等技巧的運用。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 中國歷代思想名作所描摹的是生命整體的力動過程，其透過思辨所完成的著述，不僅在追求客觀的真理或事實，同時也在於了解、開拓人類自身的心靈境界。思想家的世界觀不僅對應著其身處的歷史情境，同時也可以超越利害攸關的現實世界，提供一個想像及思辨的空間，啟引人們以更寬廣的視界與赤子之心去認識古往今來的諸般事相。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國文－中國思想名作選讀
CourseName: Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Thought
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要內容為主題式選讀中國思想名作。規劃選讀的內容如「道」、體用論、逍遙與樂、養生觀念、為學態度、人性善惡論…等。希望同學能在脫離升學考試之後，將心情沈澱下來，以一種重新去體會思索其中道理的態度來閱讀。透過對於古代思想文獻的閱讀、相關觀念的解析與討論，以及作業之寫作，在語文的運用上有所進步，並對於傳統文化中的重要思想典籍有所瞭解與思辯，亦可作為面對當下生活的參考。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國文－中國思想名作選讀
CourseName: Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Thought
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程旨在介紹中國古代思想。以周代為範圍，依主題選讀著作，精讀文本，理解思想家的主張與關懷，並期望引領同學觀察文化的演變、體悟生命。

Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 現代神話學的誕生其源可以溯自十七、十八世紀，甚至更早，如西方維柯（Vico，1668-1744）的《新科學》（1725）之作，即可做為神話學發軔時期的代表作。至十九世紀、二十世紀，西方神話學達到了鼎盛之時期，學派林立，眾論紛陳、成果豐碩。相對於西方強勢的神話學研究，東亞各國對於神話學之研究，大約遲至二十世紀初始有顯著的發展。神話是象徵的表述；也是文學的源頭，本課程精選中國神話重要文本進行閱讀與探討，藉由古代與現代神話文本的閱讀、思考與寫作，進而強化語言符號之象徵解讀力、創作想像力與運用書寫能力。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國文－中國語言文字名作選讀
CourseName: Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Language and Philology
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這是一門利用漢語、漢字的發展演變歷程，讓同學更了解日常生活中使用的語言文字；進而了解漢字在世界文化史的地位，從而對漢字的未來有所思考。語言文字在日常生活中不斷被使用的過程中，造成語言文字的發展變化。透過深入地了解語言文字發展變化的軌跡與掌握變化的規律，引起學習語文的興趣及有助於提升語文能力。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國文－中國語言文字名作選讀
CourseName: Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Language and Philology
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 語言文字是維持華人文化永續的精靈，而漢語（含漢字）又以其特有的內在風格及外在形態，不斷建構華人文化，豐富其生命歷程。因此，本課程教學采取學理及實務相互配合：學理方面，以漢語漢字為主軸，配合「應用語言學」（Applied Linguistics）學理，相互參驗研究；實務方面，兼采書面語及口語材料，並以電影為課程內容的主體。在逐步探討由漢字匯流而成的漢語文化內涵的同時，透過課堂導讀及討論，引導學習者認知並建立個人之語文風格。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國文－中國語言文字名作選讀
CourseName: Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Language and Philology
Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程首先採取傅斯年〈清代學問的門徑書幾種〉（《傅斯年全集第四冊》）、胡適〈清代學者的治學方法〉（《胡適文存／第一集第二卷》）兩篇文章，交待清儒於文獻考證的研究取徑。並取以清儒吳皖兩大學派，簡略說明清儒重經學以及語言文字學的簡史。次者，為了使課程內容具有學習上的系統性，本課程將著重講授古漢語文法結構的基本概念為起始，並透過漢語語序、時序結構的認知過程，說明古文法的形式分析與功能結構。課堂講義主要以蒲立本《古漢語文法綱要》（Edwin G. Pulleyblank.1995.Outline old classical Chinese grammar, UBC Press.）內容進行延伸，並於課程講授中適度增補相關內容。

Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程借由主題式的文章導讀，希冀從漢人社會與文化觀的角度來探索語言，包括語音、詞彙、風俗習慣等皆是本課程的探討範圍。期望透過漢民族文化的獨特視野，來解析語言以及語言背後所隱藏的文化意義，並在此基礎上進行漢語與其他民族語言、漢文化與其他國家文化的對比與探索。

Course Department: Chinese Literature
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程採取以漢語句法結構的基本概念為起始，並透過語序、時序的認知概念，說明古代漢語句法到現代漢語句法的形式分析與功能結構。同時，為了使課程內容具有初步的系統性，課堂講義主要以周法高《中國古代句法》（1961）、蒲立本《古漢語文法綱要》（Edwin G. Pulleyblank.1995.Outline old classical Chinese grammar, UBC Press.），並於課程講授中適度增補相關內容。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 進階國文─大眾文化中的戲曲身影
CourseName: Advanced Chinese - Chinese opera figure in mass culture
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 國文(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文（一）(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文（二）(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文─中國近現代思想名作選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文─中國神話選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－中國思想名作選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－中國寓言選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－中國語言文字名作選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－古典小說選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－古典曲選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－古典散文選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－古典詞選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－古典詩選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－古典戲曲選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－現代小說選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－現代散文選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－現代詩歌選讀(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 國文－臺灣文學選讀(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Chinese Literature
Prerequisite: [ Chinese or Chinese（Ⅰ） or Chinese(II) or Readings of Master Pieces of Modern Chinese Thought or Readings on Chinese Myths or Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Thought or Readings of Chinese Fables or Readings of Master Pieces of Chinese Language and Philology or Readings of Selected Classical Chinese Fiction or Readings of Classical Chinese Gi Poems or Chinese- Readings of Classical Chinese Proses or Chinese -Readings of Classical Chinese Ci Poems or Readings of Classical Chinese Poems or Readings of Selected Classical Chinese Dramas or Readings of Selected Modern Chinese Fiction or Readings of Selected Modern Chinese Proses or Chinese -Readings of Selected Modern Chinese Poems or Readings of Selected Taiwanese Literature]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 根植於民間的歲時節慶與生命禮俗，體現著人們的生活習俗與情感信仰，擁有著獨特的表演體系與審美思維的「傳統戲曲」，曾經是雅俗共賞的「時代流行文化」。然隨著時代社會的急遽變遷，傳媒娛樂的多元興起，青年學子遂失落了從戲曲中透視人生風景的美妙因緣，也錯過了與想像力及創造力的會面機遇。因此本課程結合融入傳統戲曲元素的「流行歌曲」、「電影」與「紀錄片」及「新編戲曲」作為講授教材，由此引領同學進入傳統戲曲的園圃，掌握其劇作文本與舞台藝術，也思索大眾文化與傳統的結盟與創新。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will be taught in English. This will be a learner-oriented course. The teacher will evaluate students' needs and insufficiency to design and provide appropriate teaching methods and learning materials. This course will build proficiency in reading, listening, speaking and writing through engaging themes and authentic materials. Students are required to participate in all activities in the class.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English I/II is a 4-skill integrated two-semester course, designed to help students to become proficient in English. This course contains fresh and timely topics with strong global focus, providing students with essential practice in the types of study skills needed in an academic environment. This course also gives students opportunities to speak and write about their own experiences, country, and culture in English.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed for intermediate learners of English. A communicative approach is adopted to ensure students’ ability to use English in academic disciplines and in the future at work. ESL as well as authentic audio, audio-visual and printed materials will be designed and provided by the instructor based on the textbook topics and the real-world happenings especially relevant to the students’ major area.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course teaches students with the necessary language and communicative skills needed to develop the English proficiency. The learning activities for each lesson will give students the opportunities to practice the four language skills, including reading, listening, speaking and writing.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Welcome to Our College English Classroom!

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The College English II is the second half of the required four credit Freshmen English course in NCCU. The course covers a four-skill integration of the English language, including reading, listening, speaking, and writing. Students are expected to learn and practice through different theme based classes and develop their own self-learning strategies.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Productive language skills and academic research skills will both be emphasized. Written production will be of special interest this semester. Class activities/tasks include: lecturing, pair/group discussion and writing, individual/group oral presentation, group reading and research project, after-class assignment, extra-curricular reading, oral/written reports, etc. From College English I, the instructor tries to build learner confidence and both reading and oral fluency through carefully staged and monitored collaborative activities. Students’ levels of English are reassured in their final oral presentation. Therefore, in College English II, the students will benefit from less controlled practice, be more active and responsible for their own learning. Meanwhile, the students will take their chosen topic of interest in reading and explore the topic to a higher and deeper level through a reading and research project/presentation at the end of the course. The course also encourages students to compile a learning file/portfolio to monitor their own learning progress and build up sense of achievement. As required by the university curriculum, this course includes an online cross-cultural component to facilitate student’s cultural knowledge.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to provide a setting where students can develop all four language skill areas (listening, speaking, reading and writing) to communicate in English. Lessons are presented in thematic units to reinforce vocabulary and structure across all skill areas.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This communicative course is designed for intermediate learners of English. It features an innovative topic-based syllabus which integrates practice in reading, listening, speaking and writing around engaging meaningful tasks. Using readings coming from a variety of sources along with abundant usage of related cultural information, the course aims to sharpen learners’ vocabulary-building, language analysis skills and learning strategies in all four skills. Listening activities give learners the opportunity to hear people using the language in a variety of different contexts, and the content of the recording often serves as useful input for task-based discussions that follow. Then, the discussions can also serve as a springboard for additional project work and writing activities. In general, with a combination of bottom-up (based on language decoding) and top-down processing skills (based on context and background knowledge), students are allowed to develop their language ability through integrated practice in linguistic and cultural points presented in the course.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is intended for Non-Major freshmen with intermediate English competence. Four skills (speaking, listening, reading, and writing) will be emphasized and practiced through in-class reading/speaking activities, listening practice, video watching, writing assignments, and oral presentations. In order to accomplish the general goals, the emphasis is on students’ language fluency rather than accuracy. The course will be conducted primarily in English.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English II is part two of a 4-skills integrated two-semester course, designed to help students to become more proficient in English. The second semester course focuses on advanced skills of speaking, especially in the context of interacting with the reading. Reading interesting articles from National Geographic magazine engages students’ learning and provides a context for discussion. Listening excerpts vary in difficulty, training students to listen for main ideas and details. Writing is given greater emphasis this semester as students learn to express their thoughts and reflect on the topics under discussion. A final group capstone project emphasizes a presentation on culture and topics that students have studied in both College English I and II.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course aims to improve students' English reading and speaking skills with a special focus on increasing the awareness of cultural differences between groups. To broaden students’ knowledge and increase students’ interest in learning, this course incorporates teaching materials from various sources, including one chosen textbook, documentaries, current world news and social media articles.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English II is a follow-up course to College English I, designed to help students improve their English language proficiency and develop the ability to engage critically with the world. While it is a four-skills (listening, speaking, reading, writing) integrated course, a particular emphasis will be placed on speaking and writing skills freshman students tend to lack most. This course will be conducted entirely in English. Students are expected to come to class prepared and participate actively in discussions.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English II, as the name implies, is to follow the guidelines of the College English curriculum by furthering students’ English learning potential.  Readings from a variety of knowledge areas mark the core component of the course.  Students are expected to use the English language to absorb information, examine their own thinking, interact with others, and eventually expand their personal horizon.  It is hoped that through the vehicle of English language, students are able to, not only sharpen their language skills, but also develop their interpersonal skills and thinking styles that are essential to their university studies.

Reading interesting articles from National Geographic magazine engages students’ learning and provides a context for discussion. Listening excerpts vary in difficulty, training students to listen for main ideas and details. Writing is given greater emphasis this semester as students learn to express their thoughts and reflect on the topics under discussion. A final group capstone project emphasizes a presentation on culture and topics that students have studied in both College English I and II.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English II, as the name implies, is to follow the guidelines of the College English curriculum by furthering students’ English learning potential.  Readings from a variety of knowledge areas mark the core component of the course.  Students are expected to use the English language to absorb information, examine their own thinking, interact with others, and eventually expand their personal horizon.  It is hoped that through the vehicle of English language, students are able to, not only sharpen their language skills, but also develop their interpersonal skills and thinking styles that are essential to their university studies.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English II is a follow-up course to College English I, designed to help students improve their English language proficiency and develop the ability to engage critically with the world. While it is a four-skills (listening, speaking, reading, writing) integrated course, a particular emphasis will be placed on speaking and writing skills freshman students tend to lack most. This course will be conducted entirely in English. Students are expected to come to class prepared and participate actively in discussions.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Productive language skills and academic research skills will both be emphasized. Written production will be of special interest this semester. Class activities/tasks include: lecturing, pair/group discussion and writing, individual/group oral presentation, group reading and research project, after-class assignment, extra-curricular reading, oral/written reports, etc. From College English I, the instructor tries to build learner confidence and both reading and oral fluency through carefully staged and monitored collaborative activities. Students’ levels of English are reassured in their final oral presentation. Therefore, in College English II, the students will benefit from less controlled practice, be more active and responsible for their own learning. Meanwhile, the students will take their chosen topic of interest in reading and explore the topic to a higher and deeper level through a reading and research project/presentation at the end of the course. The course also encourages students to compile a learning file/portfolio to monitor their own learning progress and build up sense of achievement. As required by the university curriculum, this course includes an online cross-cultural component to facilitate student’s cultural knowledge.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: One of the goals of this course is to help students bridge the gap between high school English and college English. Under the instructor’s guidance, it is with hope that students can make use of their already well-learned grammar and vocabulary to orally express themselves clearly and effectively and to produce well-planned writing assignments at the college level. Listening and reading serve the purpose of internalizing correct sentence structures and patterns used in speaking and writing and will therefore be much emphasized. Through in-class discussions on different topics, students will be exposed to different kinds of knowledge necessary to develop critical thinking and academic skills. These, along with listening, speaking, reading, and writing, will be valuable skills that students need to be equipped with to continue with their college work throughout their university lives.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This course extends the English language skills (listening, speaking, reading, and writing) introduced in the previous semester and further prepares students to communicate across cultures. Through frequent class discussions, student-centered tasks, and collaborative group projects, the course aims to facilitate students to develop the mindset and skills for intercultural communication. Upon completion of the course students are expected to be able to:
1) Communicate confidently and appropriately in various academic and social contexts.
2) Appreciate the diversity of cultures and the complexity within cultures and individuals.
3) Gain critical thinking skills such as interpretation, analysis, synthesis, etc. to tackle global issues.

They will also form groups at the beginning of the semester, and each group will give a presentation on a topic they pick from the handouts. Students will need to practice speaking in class and submit take-home written assignment several times during the semester.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Welcome to Our College English Classroom!

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This communicative course is designed for intermediate learners of English. It features an innovative topic-based syllabus which integrates practice in reading, listening, speaking and writing around engaging meaningful tasks. Using readings coming from a variety of sources along with abundant usage of related cultural information, the course aims to sharpen learners’ vocabulary-building, language analysis skills and learning strategies in all four skills. Listening activities give learners the opportunity to hear people using the language in a variety of different contexts, and the content of the recording often serves as useful input for task-based discussions that follow. Then, the discussions can also serve as a springboard for additional project work and writing activities. In general, with a combination of bottom-up (based on language decoding) and top-down processing skills (based on context and background knowledge), students are allowed to develop their language ability through integrated practice in linguistic and cultural points presented in the course.

Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: College English III is to follow the guidelines of the College English curriculum under the big umbrella of General Education. Students of this course are recognized as having already studied a lot of English grammar, vocabulary, and language functions. What they need at this critical intermediate stage of learning is the ability to combine a lot of words they already know into communicative expressions so as to express their opinions over issues of business content. Students are expected to use the English language to tackle tasks requiring higher-order thinking, such as identifying hidden assumptions behind a message, analyzing or evaluating arguments, engaging in group discussions of complex case studies, or conducting presentations etc. It is hoped that, through the vehicle of English language, students are able to, not only sharpen their language skills, but also nurture their thinking skills that are essential to one’s success in any profession.

Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This Business English Listening and Speaking Training course is a one-semester concentrated course designed for high-intermediate learners of English with a primary goal to help students to learn and use English in business-relevant contexts. A variety of listening tasks and speaking activities will be provided to students to be used as simulations for the real world use.

Students will be asked to practice planned and impromptu speeches, as well as group debates and poster presentations.

Class time will consist of watching part of a film, learning new vocabulary and idioms as they are used in the context of the film, and interacting with classmates in groups or pairs.

CourseName: College English III: Listening and Speaking Training onCultural Topics
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed for high-intermediate learners of English. A communicative approach is adopted to help students build cross-cultural listening and speaking skills. Students will watch selected episodes of this American TV series which demonstrates specific American social-cultural aspects, and then compare them with those in the Chinese culture and the Taiwanese society on a team.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to help students enhance their listening comprehension, note-taking skills and cultural awareness through academic lectures and longer conversations. Besides, this course tries to build students’ critical and creative thinking ability. The teacher will encourage students explore different aspects of cultures and seek the profound meaning of engaging topics. This course mainly focuses on listening and speaking skills and strategies. Plenty of audiovisual materials will be used in the class. Students are required to participate in all activities in the class.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大學英文（三）：讀小說學英文
CourseName: College English III: English Proficiency Through Fiction
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is intended for Non-Major students with intermediate-advanced English competence. It aims to improve the students’ English proficiency through the reading of fiction, and hopes to enrich the students’ minds through the meaningful life lessons embedded in the stories. In this semester, we will read two contemporary novels of about 160-200 pages each. Four skills (speaking, listening, reading, and writing) will be integrated and the students will be encouraged to develop independent thinking through class discussions, oral presentations, writing assignments, film watching, and other in-class activities. The course will be conducted primarily in English.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大學英文（三）：讀小說學英文
CourseName: College English III: English Proficiency Through Fiction
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is intended for non-English major sophomores and above with intermediate to advanced English competence. In this course, we are going to read two novels: The Catcher in the Rye and The Perks of Being a Wallflower. Through reading the two novels, students are encouraged to develop critical and independent thinking and the ability to reflect upon themselves. Class activities include discussions, oral presentations, film watching and writing assignments. These activities aim to enhance students’ English skills in reading, writing, speaking and listening.

Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is an introduction to academic writing through the fundamentals of essay writing with an emphasis on genre knowledge and audience awareness. It will help learners prepare for course papers and research writing. The course is designed to include mini lectures incorporated into workshop sessions in which class-time is full of activity. Writing assignments provide students the opportunities to practice writing skills while they explore current issues through their own interests and experiences. Students learn ways to approach writing assignments, how to find an interesting topic, and how to go through the process of writing a powerful essay in English. An assigned textbook is used as a guide, but other materials and references are available on the course Moodle. At the end of the course students will have produced their own individual electronic portfolio of compositions.

Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is an introduction to academic writing through the fundamentals of essay writing with an emphasis on genre knowledge and audience awareness. It will help learners prepare for course papers and research writing. The course is designed to include mini lectures incorporated into workshop sessions in which class-time is full of activity. Writing assignments provide students the opportunities to practice writing skills while they explore current issues through their own interests and experiences. Students learn ways to approach writing assignments, how to find an interesting topic, and how to go through the process of writing a powerful essay in English. An assigned textbook is used as a guide, but other materials and references are available on the course Moodle. At the end of the course students will have produced their own individual electronic portfolio of compositions.

Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: In this course, students will read and write various kinds of essays, including classification essays, comparison-contrast essays, cause-effect essays and argument essays. They will also learn to generate ideas, cite sources and avoid committing plagiarism. Students will conduct in-class and after-class individual writing tasks, as well as engage in pair and group work in class. The course will be conducted entirely in English. Students are expected to come to class prepared, participate actively in discussions, and express their own views on topics covered in class.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大學英文（三）：口語訓練二（ETP專班）
CourseName: College English III : Speaking II (for English TaughtProgram)

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course prepares students for listening, note taking, and academic discussion through videos of realistic and engaging lectures. Explicit presentation skills prepare students for public speaking, a requirement in today's academic and professional world. The course will highlight strategies for academic listening and speaking that guide students through the complete academic process.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大學英文（三）：口語訓練二（ETP專班）

With the help of Pathways 4, the aim of this course continues to be training students’ fluency in oral communication and improving their familiarity with different conservational occasions. The topics, which will also broaden students’ scope of world view, will range from science to humanities, politics and major global trends.

CourseName: College English III : Writing  II  (for English TaughtProgram)
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（三）：寫作一（ETP專班）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center

Topics to be covered include essential vocabulary in academic English, basic English sentence structures, and common patterns for English paragraph/essay writing.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大學英文（三）:寫作二（ETP專班）
CourseName: College English III : Writing  II  (for English TaughtProgram)
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 大學英文（三）：寫作一（ETP專班）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Foreign Languages Center
Prerequisite: [ College English III : Writing I  (for English Taught Program)]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: In the ETP Writing II course, students will build upon the foundation of the academic writing skills from ETP Writing I by composing and editing well-structured and cohesive business letters and academic essays. These include preparing job application materials, writing for customer service, composing the narrative and descriptive essays, and crafting a logical argumentative essay. After midterm, the course shifts to learning other various modes of writing to utilize critical thinking strategies and creative input: including academic reading/response writing, short stories and fiction, and news stories. This also includes creating their own theme blog in English and presenting their blog to the class at the end of the semester. The primary goal of ETP Writing II is to master more diverse rhetorical modes that prepare students to accomplish advanced writing tasks, build a foundation for research writing, and perform well on standardized tests.
