\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 無課程簡介

Course Department: PhD Program of Ethnology,  First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 民族學是民族系最核心的課程，學習民族學的概念也是民族系從學士、碩士、博士三個過程中最重要的核心，對於這個核心概念的瞭解，是透過逐層加深、逐層擴大的方式進行。本課程主要是探討民族及依附在民族身上的文化，透過學習民族及其文化的這個概念，擴及認識民族志及民族史，也延伸至民族理論與民族政策的發揮，終極目標是要讓該民族得到發展。民族學從民族出發，以分類、比較、推導、演繹、理論提出、理論確證、理論調整等工程，在論述上要邏輯合理有據，在方法上使用或任何相關學科的方法，特別是田野的實證方法，以期擁有從民族出發的觀察視野與見地。

Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology,  First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 田野工作是民族學所採用的重要方法，民族誌書寫為該學科的核心。本課程會一步一步地帶領學生設計研究題目與撰寫研究計畫書。在學理上，授課教師介紹田野工作如何從民族學和人類學的主要方法，漸漸發展成跨社會學科的方法，民族學者或人類學者又如何反思民族誌的真實性與重新定位田野工作。在方法上，授課教師一步一步的引導學生從選擇題目、田野地點，進行田野調查的預備工作與工具準備之說明，到實際參與觀察與深入訪談的訓練，並探討田野筆記與影像資料的紀錄方法之優劣，最後討論與練習資料的整理分析與民族誌書寫的步驟與方法。

Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「空間」自從自1970年代中期開始，在社會科學中成為共同的關注的焦點，「空間轉向」 (spatial turn)一詞，即是被用來形容環繞著空間此一主題產生問題意識的跨學科思潮。這股思潮從各學科對於地方、地景等空間語彙的廣泛興趣，發展出對空間本質的反省，也從對民族製圖（ethno-cartography）、參與式製圖(participatory mapping)等研究方法的採用，進一步形成對其方法論的檢討。對原住民研究而言，「空間」具有多重的重要性：首先，原住民一詞本身即指涉特定人群和特定地方的關係，它暨是人群現象，也一種空間現象；其次，許多原住民所面臨的議題，諸如：土地流失、主張傳統領域權利乃至都市原住民的居住和生存等等，都和社會關係產生空間/空間再生產社會關係的過程有關；再者，從原住民的文化經驗中所呈現的世界觀，既是西方空間理論的一種挑戰，也可以透過空間概念的異同比較，作為原住民知識和西方理論對話的一個起點。

Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology,  First Year

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 台灣原住民社會文化專題
CourseName: Seminar on Society and Culture of Taiwan Aborigines
Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 經由閱讀課程指定書目，認識下列課題相關之研究成果，學習其方法，思辨其與當代台灣原住民發展重要議題之關聯

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 民族學田野：菲律賓文化與地理研究
CourseName: Fieldwork of Ethnology: Studies on Philippines Culture and Geography
Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為民族學系「民族學田野調查」中的其中一組，目的是使學生透過田野調查的訓練（田野地點為菲律賓呂宋島之Ifugao及Bicol兩個地區），得到實作的經驗，以及對於菲律賓文化與人文地理的認識，並能夠將這樣的認識，與相關民族地理思想相互連結對照。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 舊社考古田野方法與實習
CourseName: Archaeological Field Work Method and Practice of Old Village
Course Department: PhD Program of Ethnology,  First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 近年來台灣考古研究的發展議題出現了民族考古學的趨勢，包含聚落考古和舊社考古等等，帶給我們對於原史時代想像的新刺激。當代世界各地原住民族多元複雜的文化樣貌是長期發展的結果，然而擁有多元族群原住民的台灣，對舊社考古的研究和理解仍有待發展。

Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology,  First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 縱覽經濟人類學，由Malinowski至當代的一系列發展，探索其範圍、認識論、議題及體系的轉型。

Course Department: PhD Program of Ethnology,  First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides a preliminary overview and coverage of (1) the research process; (2) basic elements that make up a research project (variables, hypotheses, etc.); (3) a survey of a range of research methods, including but not limited to qualitative and quantitative methods in the social sciences, (4) applications and examples of these methods related to specific disciplines and area studies, in particular their application to the study of non-Western societies; (5) the process of dissertation research and working with dissertation committees; (6) practice in formulating a research proposal. In addition, students will familiarize themselves with journals and past research in their specific area of interest. Students will gain practice in making a draft research proposal, either on the basis of the research topic that they submitted for acceptance into the PhD program, or on some other topic of interest.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 台灣社會文化史專題─人類學的觀點
CourseName: Topics on Social and Cultural History of Taiwan -- AnAnthropological Approach
Course Department: MA Program of Ethnology,  First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將透過每周的講課，針對台灣的族群和區域歷史課題，就人類學文化社會概念的觀點從事一些闡述和分析。本學期授課內容包括三個單元：A. 南島語族之源流與人類學課題；B. 十七世紀以前的台灣與東亞世界； C. 清代台灣史與漢人社會意識的形成。各單元內容詳見每周課程進度表。[補充說明：關於晚清、日治和當代台灣社會文化的部分則納在下一學期「文化政治、現代性與台灣經驗」課程中]。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國際關係理論與中共外交
CourseName: Theory of International Relations and Study of Chinese
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在蘇聯解體、冷戰結束之後，國際體系中最重要的變化就是中國的快速崛起，而主要以近代歐洲國家經驗為主所發展出來的西方國際關係理論是否能夠繼續適用於當代中國崛起的新局則充滿了爭議。中國是否真的能夠和平地崛起？還是不可避免地將對美國與周邊國家帶來巨大的威脅？一個不論是在軍事上或是經濟上都甚為強大的威權國家，是否能夠與民主國家的世界秩序兼容並蓄？在冷戰時期，民主陣營靠著強大的經濟力與軟實力獲得了勝利，但是，當今天的西方資本主義社會面臨了貧富分配不均、民主品質倒退、經濟發展停滯、金融危機層出不窮等等問題時，中國強勢的經濟發展是否將會成功地形成一個新的國際秩序典範？在西方秩序的國際體系下，中國是如何在全世界布局？而世界上的其他國家，又是如何回應因中國崛起而同時帶來的威脅與機會、如何處理與中國的競爭與合作？這些有關中國崛起的問題，對於深陷兩岸關係困境的台灣來說，更是具有思索未來發展方向的重要性。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 中國在當前的國際世界經濟體系中扮演著舉足輕重的角色，然而在三十多年前，中國仍是一個經濟發展落後的社會主義國家。究竟中國經濟是如何融入國際經濟體系？在整個過程中，中國挑戰了或是接受了那些國際經濟體系的既有規則？本課程從國際經濟體系的形成與發展開始教授，並介紹國際政治經濟學相關理論，最後檢視中國與國際經濟體系的互動。

CourseName: Chinese Foreign Relations: Perception, Power and Policy
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies MA Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
1、探討中國大陸國際關係研究的現況與發展。 
2、分析中國大陸對世界格局的認知，評估中國大陸軍事、經濟與政治力量在國際政治中的影響。 
3、比較其他大國與中國對中國大陸角色的認知、力量與意圖之異同。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 中國大陸社會轉型與變遷
CourseName: Social Transformation and Change in Mainland China
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies MA Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 隨著市場化改革以及對外開放的發展，中國大陸正歷經一場劇烈的政經社會變遷，一方面，其出現了現代化理論者（modernization theory）所言的工業化、都市化、識字率提升、社會流動加速……等特徵，使社會部門發生重大變化，包括社會結構分化、社會組織的出現、單位體制的崩解、戶籍制度的弱化、風起雲湧的社會運動以及資訊科技的發展所帶來的效應等。若將此經濟社會現象置於政治發展的脈絡中，可發現一種自由主義者的學術興趣，即經濟發展與政治民主間的關係，其多以西歐經驗為張本，認為經濟成長將會帶來社會結構的重組與社會價值的多元化，進而出現獨立而強大的中產階級，其對政治參與的提高將會帶來政治民主化。而將此邏輯套用在對中國的研究上也成為西方學界關注的焦點。其中值得關注的是，中國網民規模超過7.5億，且隨著微博、微信影響力呈爆發式增長、手機上網用戶大增以及網路意見領袖的出現等都將大大影響中國社會發展。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程的目標在使學生能夠運用現有的分析工具與自己的理智，對於一些國際政治與國內政治交錯的複雜議題、例如兩岸關係，梳理出具有理論批判性又有政策說服性的分析。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 爭辯中的人類安全：正義、平等、人道與人權
CourseName: Debating Human Security: Justice, Equality, Humanity and Rights
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies MA Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Human security is a new interdisciplinary topic that originates from two groups of literature: human rights and international security. The first group is full of practitioners and theorists who care about justice, humanity, and equality, mostly in the battles of defending human rights in the developing world. The second group gathers the best minds of security experts, policy-makers, and strategic analysts who delicate to defend the peace, stability, and sustainability of the world, which, arguably, relies on the actions from the developed world. This somehow chaotic and self-contradictory nature makes this topic one of the most fascinated and debatable developments in the IR field. Students here will firstly learn various definitions and theories from two sub-disciplines. Then they will be introduced to case studies in two very different worlds. The final goal is to help students to build their own perspectives on selected issue areas: human rights, just war, humanitarian issues, trade and immigration, and sustainable politics. The semester is divided into five issue blocks and each block contains roughly one class on debates popular in the developed world and one case on practices in the developing world.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This graduate seminar offers a broad introduction to the field of political economy of contemporary China. It examines the main theoretical and methodological approaches to the study of Chinese economic reform. After more than three decades of reform, China has become one of the economic powerhouses in the world today. In the course of reforming its economy, China has experienced the fastest economic growth and social transformation in human history. To what extent, however, does China’s development follow the orthodox recipes prescribed by the literature of political economy?  What exactly is the source of China’s economic growth for the past three decades? What is the current state of the market institutions in China? How do we interpret China’s ascendency economically and politically?

CourseName: China and Economic Integration in Asia
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies MA Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course aims to explore key issues areas and important factors affecting the rise of China and the development of Asian economic integration in recent decades from perspectives of international political economy.

CourseName: Seminar on International  Relations of South East Asia
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要設計為對東南亞國際關係主要理論與核心議題有深入研究興趣的碩博士班研究生所開設。由於東南亞國際關係研究並不只該侷限於外交關係與各國外交政策之解析，本課程內容選擇不採探討個別國家外交政策之傳統研究途徑，而是以議題導向針對東南亞國際關係的主要理論及概念，對應當前東南亞最新發展進行參照研究。目的在於提供選修學生最新的東南亞區域研究概念、知識與方法，以及對於東南亞當前國際議題與發展關注的進階知識。

CourseName: The Analysis and Interpretation of the Chinese CommunistParty Documents
Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程藉由探討文本或檔案text？document？or writing article？以及文本的定義：A text is any discourse fixed by writing，by talking or by the meaningful symbolization.，讓學生了解如何閱讀分析中共文獻。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course combines theoretical material with corresponding practical instances as they have taken place and continue to occur in Southeast Asia. The aim is to expose students to the diversity of the region whilst cultivating a critical awareness of key theoretical models and dominant narratives, which have and continue to define the political and social climate of each country. Upon completion of this course, students should be familiar with the dominant approaches and theories in comparative politics, as well as the basic contours of modern Southeast Asian politics. Students should also have the ability to determine the merits and weaknesses of various theoretical approaches, and to apply such to critically analyze current political developments in the region.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of East Asian Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
由於人類越來越重視數據做為決策的依據，因此資料科學最近變得非常熱門，但是早在資料科學出現之前，統計學已經幫助我們描述資料以及找出變數之間的關係。不過，資料科學的用途更廣，而學好統計學則能避免被龐大的資料所困惑。不論是學資料科學或是統計學，需要具備一些技術的訓練，才能透視資料後面的故事。
R是免費的統計軟體，近年來廣被政治、經濟、醫學、管理等領域使用，有豐富的網路資源，不僅可用於各種統計模型，而且資料容易轉化為圖形，也就是視覺化非常容易，更可延伸至大數據分析。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a doctoral level seminar that demands heavy readings and intensive in-class discussion. It will cover issues in development and politics as well as policies in responding to these issues. Concrete cases will be brought up for demonstration purpose.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 國家發展研究乃是以政治、經濟、社會發展為基礎，以生態主義為導向的永續發展作為目標，做區域研究的比較觀察。所謂政治發展（political development）的意涵，即是指政治系統取得更為廣泛的能力，其重點在於政治結構和過程能否更加專業化，更有效地處理內部問題和因應環境挑戰。而在比較政治中，1970年代以前的顯學是政治發展。但自從1974年葡萄牙革命啟動第三波民主化以來，90年代以後，民主化研究已成為比較政治研究中的顯學。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course has a concern with the concept of sustainable development, thirsty years on from the influential Brundtland Report (1987), and its applications for the conduct of public policy. By reflecting within the discussions on what sustainable development is, why it is advocated, who is responsible for it, how it can be achieved, and how it can be measure, the aim of this course is to provide ample demonstration of these. Many of these conversations stem from a shared concern about the development paths that both developed and developing countries are on. As the world’s development paths indeed reflect complex interactions between different intellectual disciplines and policy foci, mapping out the structure of this course is of multidiscipline and interdiscipline, mostly among Political Science, Economics, and Sociology. This course, therefore, attempts to offer a comprehensive, but accessible, portrait of the sustainable development literature, in which students from different disciplinary and work backgrounds can find of interest.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
社會科學能夠為社會做些什麼貢獻？社會科學研究方法能夠做些什麼？ 
我們存在的社會有著層出不窮的現象與議題，充滿著各種不同的解釋，那些解釋是合理的，是正確的，是具有預測能力的？那些解釋是偏頗的，是背離事實的，是恰巧碰上的？社會科學研究方法是幫助我們蒐集資料，找尋議題與理論關係的聯繫，發展與驗證假說，建立可以重複檢測事實發生的解釋規律。 

社會科學研究方法基於研究對象、研究途徑取捨的差異，大體可以區分為質性研究與量化研究，事實上有些研究需要兼採質化與量化的長處。 

質性研究的概念區分與研究種類概述: 
個案研究、自然探究、實地理論、田野研究、俗民誌、俗民方法學、詮釋研究、文件分析（廣義的包含影像、聲音素材），本課程將選擇其中部分施教，並要求學生以實做的方式完成指定作業。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 東亞與南亞之民主與民主化
CourseName: Democracy and Democratization in East and South Asia
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is concerned with recent political developments in East and South Asia. In addition to the issues that have long been central to research in democratisation in the region concerned and studied extensively, we draw attention to some important/new issues that have been neglected in the existing literature. These issues include: the contesting conceptions of democracy (e.g. the ‘liberal vs. illiberal democracy’ debate); the relations between gender, development and democracy; and the impact of globalisation on democracy.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這門課討論「性別與發展」的相關議題，課程內容主要分為兩大部分：第一部分為婦女/性別/女性主義與發展研究，這部分屬於比較理論性的探討，特別著重於性別研究跟女性主義的興起與流行對發展研究這個領域及其理論發展的影響；第二部分著重於從婦女的角度來探討與發展相關的議題，例如女性在發展中所扮演的角色、發展對女性之社會經濟生存條件以及政治參與（即「女性的發展」）的影響等等。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a class training graduate students to conduct a qualitatitive research and publich the result accordingly.  It starts with the introduction of ontology, epistemology, methodology, and eventually research methods for a decent qualitative research. It also covers the issues of identifying workable research topics from daily life observation.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 幫助學生對台灣外部環境中最重要的「美中台關係」產生比較全面的了解。這組三角關係實際上有六個面向，即美國、中國大陸、及台灣各自內政構成的三個角，與美中關係、美台關係、及兩岸關係構成的三個邊。對這六個面向的認識，如果在任一個面向有所欠缺，就不容易掌握全貌，當然也容易研判失準。本門課擬逐一介紹這三個角與三個邊，以使學生對此主題具有概括性的理解，將來據此宏觀理解，就更容易凌空進入美中台關係中的任何微觀子題。

CourseName: Seminar on Ethnic Development in Southeast Asia
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This seminar will explores the relationship between ethnic minorities and states from colonial to contemporary period in Southeast Asia, with particular attention to how nation-states attempt to incorporate and assimilate multiethnic populations into their unified national identity and discourse of nationalism.

CourseName: Global Poverty Relief and Chinese Experiences
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程的目的在於深入了解發展中國家的貧困問題，並且探討在對抗貧困的工作中，各國政府、國際機構、捐助者、非政府組織和私人機構的策略差異。除了概述傳統做法， 也將強調企業家精神和私營部門的參與。 由於中國過去三十餘年推行世界上最大規模的扶貧工作，本課程也將應用這些理論， 探討其在中國窮困人口中的應用成效以及遭遇的挑戰。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程著重於臺灣地方展業的認識與相關全球化、科技化經濟趨勢發展的掌握，除地方產業發展歷程與現況外，針對環境、經濟再造、產業服務化、數位治理、科技社群發展、以及在地化文創發展等趨勢進行探討與分析交流，以期學生培養出對臺灣地方產業未來發展藍圖描繪與研究深化的能力。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Graduate level students will learn from Taiwan’s world-class business leaders on global economy, industry trends, and corporate management. The curriculum aims to educate Taiwan’s future leaders to become globally competitive, visionary, and earn a charitable mind. Students will have the opportunity to present their understanding of global economic and business trend implications to Taiwan industries and companies. The learning outcome will be developments of analytical framework, business presentation skill, and project based team collaboration.

CourseName: Poverty and Inequality in Era of Urbanization
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course examines urbanization and its influence from the perspective of economics. First, we will study the causes and consequences of poverty and inequality. We then turn to an analysis of the demographic forces—fertility, mortality, migration—that are propelling urbanization in poor countries and are also shaped by urbanization. Lastly, we will focus on slums and homelessness, which are two common phenomena during urbanization, and investigate related issues, such as irregular land tenure; upgrading and redevelopment schemes; and the capacity of municipal governance and planning.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Deveopment Studies PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course explores the foundations of economic issues in developing countries. The objects of this course are (1) to provide a critical overview of the recent literature and important debates in economic development and (2) to examine the impact of development policies. We will use the microeconomic framework to study theories and empirical evidence on different facets of development: agriculture, health, education, gender, family, labor markets, risk, consumption, and credit markets. For each topic, we will study examples chosen from around the world. While studying each of these topics, we will ask: What determines the decisions of poor households in developing countries? Is there a scope for policy – by government, international organizations, or nongovernmental organizations (NGOs)? What policies have been tried out? Have they been successful?

CourseName: Special Topics on Theory of Labor Law
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 勞動法學專題研究(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
Prerequisite: [ Special Topics on Theory of Labor Law]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 由於國際勞工組織之影響，各國勞動法國際化之趨勢遠大於其他法律領域，國際規範對內國法的影響亦極為深遠，故本學期課程主要係以分組方式進行各項課題之研究，透過法制上比較研究，以深化對勞動法中各項制度與議題之瞭解，並藉由其他國家之制度提出修正與改善法制的建議。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動事務實習：勞動市場（一）
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 勞動研究除學理整合思考外，實務體驗將有助於學習成效的提昇。本課程規劃於碩一下學期，安排實習準備；碩一與碩二間暑假，安排至少一個月的職場實習體驗；碩二上學期，進行實習體驗之報告與分享。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動事務實習：勞動法令（一）
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 針對法院訴訟及行政救濟相關個案進行分析，以培養進入勞動行政機關、工會或企業實習之基礎能力

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動事務實習：勞資關係（一）
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 與選修同學討論實習計畫、決定實習方向，並協助同學選定與安排實習機構，以提升同學實務能力，進而有助於同學論文方向與題目的規劃與日後論文的撰寫。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動事務實習：人力資源（一）
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程為碩士班一般生必修學群課程，學分數為一學年兩學分，分為：
1、勞動事務實習（一）：勞動政策。
2、勞動事務實習（二）：勞動法令。
3、勞動事務實習（三）：勞資關係。
4、勞動事務實習（四）：人力資源。
5、勞動事務實習（五）：社會安全。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動政治經濟名著選讀（二）
CourseName: Direct Readings of Political Economy in Labour Study (Ⅱ)
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 指定同學閱讀政治經濟有關的專書，希望透過專書閱讀與討論，提升學生政治經濟有關的專業知識。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces how globalization or global governance is linked to or affects domestic policy process. It is closely related to the subjects of International Relations (IR), International Organizations, Public policy and Governance. It draws from much of IR’s conceptualization, but is differentiated from traditional state-centered or Realist International Relations. It covers transnational networkings of public sectors, subnational units, civil societal forces, or knowledge sectors. Besides, it introduces policy diffusion, global cities and private organization governance in issues such as sustainable development, health and refugee migration.

CourseName: Development Aid and Asia Pacific Cooperation
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will instruct various analytical perspectives, issues and major countries’ practices in development assistance and cooperation in the Asia Pacific region. These countries are not limited to donors, but also including recipients in the region. It is related to the areas of Foreign Policy and International Relations; Public Policy and Governance; Political Economy. The course is essentially divided into four parts: conceptual framework and perspectives; development aid strategies; actors and institutions; key issues; countries and region practices.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動經濟理論與政策（一）
CourseName: Labor Economics: Theory and Public Policy (I)
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要透過經濟學的分析方法，應用市場供給和需求的模型，來分析勞動者和雇主的行為，以及各類政府政策對勞動市場的影響。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動社會學論文專題研究
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本門課程是為預備寫論文的同學開設。由於本所同學畢業於不同的大學科系，文學院、商學院、理工學院及社會科學院，因而對於論文該如何開始、未來會遇到哪些挑戰、走量化或質化取徑，無不充滿了疑惑及擔心。因而課程設計將帶領同學閱讀一些研究設計及研究方法的經典著作，有此基礎之後，再挑選不同取徑之好的研究論文做為觀摩討論的對象，最後鼓勵同學於期末提出自己的論文計畫書，並逐一協助設定問題、聚焦研究議題、討論其中可能的問題及需要修正的地方。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動法學論文專題研究
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由勞動法學研究方法之講授，包括法學方法論、質性研究、比較研究，以及勞動法學相關概念之釐清，協助學生論文寫作。

CourseName: Special Topics on collective Bargaining and Industrial Relations
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 探討當代集體協商與勞資關係變遷。 探討今日勞資關係是否已經面臨轉型? 主要的原因為何? 如果轉型，對於當代勞動關係之過程與結果有何影響? 學習者能夠瞭解影響當代勞資關係變遷之主要因素，並探討集體協商與勞動關係之各項議題。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 勞動政策係整體公共政策的一環，勞動政策的制定於實施關係著企業、產業與整體社會經濟發展的成敗，重要性不言可喻。尤其隨著經濟社會發展的多樣性，勞動政策的研究與探討也應該朝向著多元化與多樣化的方向努力。因此，本課程除著重於一般勞動政策理論的探討外，也將著重於一些勞動政策專題的討論，希望能對同學在觀念和思考上多所啟發。同時，為與其他課程相區隔，這門課程會比較著重於勞動市場與就業有關議題討論。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 勞動社會學專題研究（二）
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 繼上學期勞動社會學主要焦點放在探究資本主義社會經濟性質後，本學期勞動社會學將閱讀三個主要領域的經典文獻及其相關論文，分別是（一）探討工人階級的形成，資本主義先進國家與後進國家，在社會的階級結構形成上，因著歷史發展脈絡的差異，而有不同，但先進國家工人組織率的下降，也打擊著工人階級運動的能量，而資本主義全球化究竟是限縮還是促進工人階級運動？（二）勞動去技術化的命題，十九世紀末二十世紀初大工業大工廠生產的年代，泰勒科學管理模式因運而生，導致技術勞動被拆解的現象，是否僅限於影響製造業？二十世紀中期以後彈性生產下所強調的多能工，是否讓工人得以奪回勞動過程的主控權？這些發展趨勢如何深刻地影響勞資關係？（三）勞動過程理論，核心的提問從「何以工人要摸魚？」到「何以工人如此積極勤奮？」的變化，探究工人在勞動過程中主體性與結構間的關係，生產共識如何形成？

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 女性勞動參與專題研究
CourseName: Special Topics on Women Workers Participation
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 女性對資本主義的生產及擴大再生產、資本的積累、及這套生產制度的鞏固所扮演的重要角色，早已為理論及經驗所肯定。無論作為職場的勞動者，或非職場的勞動者，女性對資本主義社會的發達，均能起直接或間接的促進作用。然而幾乎所有的研究也指出，女性在勞動力市場是處於相對弱勢的位置，無論是薪資、升遷、福利或教育訓練、甚至資遣及解雇，女性受到與男性不公平的待遇。隨著女性教育普遍的提升，父權規範的箝制已漸鬆動的情況下，女性在勞動力市場的處境是否也日漸改善？然而經濟全球化的影響下，勞動力彈性化及非典型化的發展趨勢，女性的處境是否是雪上加霜？

CourseName: Special Topics on Labor Union Law
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 閱讀國際勞工組織對團結權之詮釋，增進學習者對工會與勞動三權之瞭解，並與我國法制進行比較分析

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國際勞動基準專題研究
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Labor Research MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 國際勞動基準由勞資政三方組成之國際勞工組織所制頒，國際勞工組織則係聯合國之專門機構，向以促進世界經濟繁榮，提昇勞工人權，保障社會安全為宗旨。在國際社會中，規範勞資關係及相關基本人權之國際法源，主要有國際勞工組織的憲章、宣言、公約、建議書以及聯合國、歐盟及各種地區性的國際勞動法文件。其中，數量最為龐大體系最為完整，對於各國相關立法與制度的建立影響最大者，非國際勞動基準莫屬。國勞基準以公約與建議書的形式表現，公約的批准國有制定相關立法適用公約基準的義務。隨著全球化進程的開展，國勞基準對於世界各國勞動法與社會安全制度的影響與日俱增，各國在相關立法上以其為參考座標或標準，其他的國際經貿組織，如國際貨幣基金會、世界銀行、經濟合作發展組織及世貿組織，皆一再肯定國勞組織在基準設定及增進全世界各國勞資關係與社會安全功能上的主導地位。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 俄羅斯藝術在人類文明及世界藝術發展史上獨塑一格，

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: More than two decades after the collapse of the Soviet Union, Russia has been searching for its own identity in a changing world. In light of Russia's revival and NATO's eastward expansion into the former Soviet states, Russia's foreign policy has shifted from a defensive position to a more assertive direction, as indicated by the war with Georgia in August 2008 and the annexation of Crimea in 2014.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 中國大陸與俄羅斯經濟發展比較研究
CourseName: Comparative Studies on Economic Development in the MainlandChina and Russia
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 中國大陸和蘇聯、東歐等共產主義計畫經濟體在市場導向經濟改革後已經蛻變為國際上熱門的新興市場，其經濟發展潛能備受各界關注。然而，其經濟發展亦面臨許多挑戰，且其經濟改革與發展途徑也截然不同。本課程將對其經濟變遷進程與發展模式進行探討與比較，藉此提升學生對此兩經濟體之認知，熟諳和掌控俄羅斯與中國大陸經濟發展動態及其對國際之影響，培育相關專才。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 歐盟與俄羅斯經貿關係專題
CourseName: Study on Economic-Trade Relation between EU and Russia
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 蘇聯、中東歐國家在二十世紀九零年代陸續宣布朝市場導向轉型後，不但導致持續多年之冷戰國際格局丕變，此後歐盟東擴更促使中東歐國家加入歐盟，歐盟與俄羅斯之政經關係亦隨之改觀。透過對歐俄互動過程的暸解與掌握，一方面加強學生對此區域之認知，學習區域經濟整合理論及歐盟整合與東擴實證；另一方面使學生們學習如何應用相關學理來分析總體經濟實勢及其變化，訓練其獲得自我學習、分析探討之能力，以便未來能進一步自我研究，掌控歐盟、中東歐國家和俄羅斯之經濟狀況與變化趨勢，培育相關的經貿專才。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程期藉由講授、課堂報告討論之方式，增進學生對俄羅斯能源相關議題之瞭解。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 1990年代中期以來，隨著經濟全球化的浪潮，區域經濟整合也成為了當今世界經濟的發展趨勢。與此同時，新興市場經濟體的崛起，也改變了國際經貿的格局，以致G20取代G7成為全球經濟金融治理的重要要平台。然而，近來國際社會卻也出現反全球化和保護主義的聲浪，面對錯綜複雜的世界經濟情勢，本課程將從國際經貿和金融理論的研習，輔以國際經貿現勢的政經因素的分析，使學生得以了解當前國際經貿的特點及未來可能的發展。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 俄羅斯國家與社會關係
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Russian Studies MA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 俄羅斯面對內外環境的改變，不斷進行制度、政策、人事、和觀念上的調適，試圖在變動的世局中，尋求自身的立足之地。本課程著重俄羅斯國家與社會關係的動態發展，從其兩者的互動過程與力量消長，檢視普丁時期領導階層的施政績效及俄國民主內涵；觀察重點在於國家解決社會問題的政策與能力，以及公民社會的發展情形。

Course Department: MA Program of Social Work, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 社會工作研究所學生於入學後第二學期，至各實務領域實習以印證各領域的理論與實踐。

Course Department: MA Program of Social Work, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 社會工作研究所學生於入學後第二學期與暑假，至各實務領域實習以印證各領域的理論與實踐。

Course Department: PhD Program of Social Work, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is intended to help students explore, analyze and integrate current social work theories for practice. It consists of review of important theories, impact of social changes on social work practice, and the related changes of social work methods.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 社會政策與社會立法專題
Course Department: MA Program  of Social Work, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要包括兩大部分，第一部分介紹社會政策與立法之基本概念、意識形態、價值觀與政策制訂原則，第二部分則就我國各領域當前重要社會立法與政策，探討其內容、議題、執行及國際發展趨勢，期待透過此課程之修習，使學生就社會政策之基本原則及重大議題有所理解，具備分析與研究之能力，並進而發展特定社會政策與立法議題之興趣及研究方向。

Course Department: PhD Program of Social Work,Third Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 質性研究的教學目標是希望同學可以在期末有能力提出一份以質性研究為研究法的碩士論文計畫書，並有初步執行質性研究的經驗。

Course Department: MA Program  of Social Work, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將嘗試從社會工作者的視野，理解社區工作的範疇。社區工作是一種與別人合作的精神，不只是一套方法。社區工作當然有方法，但是這種方法不能單純被當作一種方法，而是透過民主的精神，願意與他人合作、相互理解。社區工作方法不能單單視為一種技術，因為視之為一種技術，就容易落入操弄別人的陷阱，就違背了社區工作的精神。

Course Department: MA Program  of Social Work, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之目的乃是使學生能夠結合統計於研究中，瞭解如何選取適當之統計方法解答研究問題，瞭解常用統計程序的基本概念，熟悉資料分析方法、程序及原則，運用SPSS統計軟體進行資料分析，並能解釋統計結果。

Course Department: PhD Program of Social Work,Third Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這是一門社工理論的課程，著重於後現代主義帶給社工專業的衝擊與回應。社會工作專業是現代化的產物，以客觀中立的科技理性做為專業知識的發展依據的輝煌時光，已經在八零年代的後現代批判主義面臨瓦解與挑戰。後現代主義下的基進社工何去何從？是這堂課想要開展的議題。本課程選擇以法國哲學家傅科的規訓權力為理論架構，佐以後現代基進社工學者的文章，試圖發展社工從基層微觀觀點分析社會政策的能力。因此，本課程的目標在於提供社工新的視角，理解社工的理論與實務。課程內容將介紹受到傅科的知識權力觀點啟發的觀點，作為社工員分析日常生活的理論視角，並提供同學將課堂所學實際應用在社會工作的分析與批判上，並從社工的角度，練習發展社工行動策略，促成社會改革。

Course Department: PhD Program of Social Work,Third Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程說明：本課程預定剖析長期照顧的相關議題，期使學生認識長期照顧政策的目標、服務對象、服務模式、照顧管理制度、財務規劃、以及品質管制等服務輸送相關主題，並促使學生瞭解國內外長期照顧研究之現況與發展，進而培育日後從事長期照顧政策研究之能力。

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides a preliminary overview and coverage of (1) the research process; (2) basic elements that make up a research project (variables, hypotheses, etc.); (3) a survey of a range of research methods, including but not limited to qualitative and quantitative methods in the social sciences, (4) applications and examples of these methods related to specific disciplines and area studies, in particular their application to the study of non-Western societies; (5) the process of dissertation research and working with dissertation committees; (6) practice in formulating a research proposal. In addition, students will familiarize themselves with journals and past research in their specific area of interest. Students will gain practice in making a draft research proposal, either on the basis of the research topic that they submitted for acceptance into the PhD program, or on some other topic of interest.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Graduate level students will learn from Taiwan’s world-class business leaders on global economy, industry trends, and corporate management. The curriculum aims to educate Taiwan’s future leaders to become globally competitive, visionary, and earn a charitable mind. Students will have the opportunity to present their understanding of global economic and business trend implications to Taiwan industries and companies. The learning outcome will be developments of analytical framework, business presentation skill, and project based team collaboration.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 因果推論與資料科學在經濟學的應用
CourseName: Casual Inference and Data Science in Economics
Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will survey empirical methods for conducting causal inference and data science in economics.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 環太平洋語言：歷史，語言，社會與政治
CourseName: The Languages of the Pacific: History, Linguistics, Sociology, and Politics
Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Despite the fact that the Pacific Region is largely covered by water, it is a culturally extremely diverse region. From Island South-East, and more than 2300 languages on its islands. In this course, we will investigate the languages belonging to the main language groups of the Pacific region from an interdisciplinary perspective. We will discuss their history, their present distribution and status, their associated cultures, and some of their structural properties. While mainly focusing on indigenous languages, we will also discuss the linguistic impact of different colonization waves. In a number of case studies, students will discuss interesting aspects of key languages.

CourseName: Development Aid and Asia Pacific Cooperation
Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will instruct various analytical perspectives, issues and major countries’ practices in development assistance and cooperation in the Asia Pacific region. These countries are not limited to donors, but also including recipients in the region. It is related to the areas of Foreign Policy and International Relations; Public Policy and Governance; Political Economy. The course is essentially divided into four parts: conceptual framework and perspectives; development aid strategies; actors and institutions; key issues; countries and region practices.

CourseName: Theories and Methods of Comparative Politics
Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a core course for Ph.D. students in the subfield of Comparative Politics in the Political Science Department. We will examine classic works in comparative politics and incorporate them in the research projects of students.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to enhance students’ ability to conduct survey research and to familiarize students with required techniques. To that end, the structure of the course is combined with lecture, practice, group discussions, and simulated academic forums. This class is practice oriented, so students will be required to learn primary questionnaire building tools and platforms such as Google Document, SurveyMonkey, and Qualtrics as well as basic statistics software such as Stata and SPSS.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces how globalization or global governance is linked to or affects domestic policy process. It is closely related to the subjects of International Relations (IR), International Organizations, Public policy and Governance. It draws from much of IR’s conceptualization, but is differentiated from traditional state-centered or Realist International Relations. It covers transnational networkings of public sectors, subnational units, civil societal forces, or knowledge sectors. Besides, it introduces policy diffusion, global cities and private organization governance in issues such as sustainable development, health and refugee migration.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
While the adoption of neoliberal, free-market economic policies and the subsequent deregulation of
education began in the 1980s, its influence in recent years has only continued to increase. Over the
last decade, these trends have continued to put pressure on many education systems throughout
Europe, North and South America, and Asia. As a result, the increasing gaps between rich and poor
on the individual, school, national and international scales are obvious, and they continue to intensify
ethnic conflict, cultural disputes, gender inequality, and social instability.
Secondly, in the global environment, increasing competitiveness and accountability have become
the priority for many educational institutions. Accelerating competition between and within schools
has run rampant and become the norm with which administrators, educators and students must all
comply. Emphasis on benchmarking has become increasingly pervasive in all aspects of education
systems. For students, this has been realized through international assessments of student academic
achievement, such as the Program for International Student Assessment (PISA), Trends in
International Mathematics and Science Study (TIMSS), and Progress in International Reading Literacy
Study (PIRLS), as well as standardized testing at the national and sub-national levels. For educators
and higher education institutes, world-class university rankings and the proliferation of publication
indices as quantitative indicators of faculty and university performance, described as the SSCI
syndrome, have continued to shape policies at all levels.
In addition, the rise of information and computer technology has brought forth a new
2
revolutionary trend in learning. The dominant role of the Internet in students’ lives inside and
outside the classroom has challenged conventional schools and classrooms in an unprecedented way,
so that all educators, teachers and parents are forced to comply with the trend of change.
In this context, it is worthwhile to analyze some case studies of education reforms in Asia, Europe,
and North America, and compare their outcomes in the context of globalization and localization. This
is the reason why the instructor tends to correspond to displaying some cases of education reform
policies in the last two decades from comparative perspective as an ideal testimony to observe how
long-lasting effects of educational policies can occur in response to efforts to enhance national
development.
Participants of this class will be able to discuss a wide variety of education issues from
comparative, international and even personal perspectives. There will be two-way and interactive
discussions between instructor and students, which intends to invite more critical ideas and
inspiration about the topics. It is hoped this class will help students acquire knowledge/skills on
comparative methodology and use educational policies/practices from their own countries as
comparative pedagogy.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 東亞與南亞之民主與民主化
CourseName: Democracy and Democratisation in East and South Asia
Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is concerned with recent political developments in East and South Asia. In addition to the issues that have long been central to research in democratisation in the region concerned and studied extensively, we draw attention to some important/new issues that have been neglected in the existing literature. These issues include: the contesting conceptions of democracy (e.g. the ‘liberal vs. illiberal democracy’ debate); the relations between gender, development and democracy; and the impact of globalisation on democracy.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a class training graduate students to conduct a qualitatitive research and publich the result accordingly.  It starts with the introduction of ontology, epistemology, methodology, and eventually research methods for a decent qualitative research. It also covers the issues of identifying workable research topics from daily life observation.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course combines theoretical material with corresponding practical instances as they have taken place and continue to occur in Southeast Asia. The aim is to expose students to the diversity of the region whilst cultivating a critical awareness of key theoretical models and dominant narratives, which have and continue to define the political and social climate of each country. Upon completion of this course, students should be familiar with the dominant approaches and theories in comparative politics, as well as the basic contours of modern Southeast Asian politics. Students should also have the ability to determine the merits and weaknesses of various theoretical approaches, and to apply such to critically analyze current political developments in the region.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is a continuation of "Introduction to Statistical Analysis." It introduces students to more advanced tools of statistics and shows how they are used in the analysis of social science data. The course will introduce students to the idea of multivariate analysis. It covers the basics of regression analysis and more advanced statistical methods.

Course Department: International Doctor Program in Asia-Pacific Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a doctoral level seminar that demands heavy readings and intensive in-class discussion. It will cover issues in development and politics as well as policies in responding to these issues. Concrete cases will be brought up for demonstration purpose.

Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a one-semester introductory course to microeconomic theory for students in the IMES program. The course is intended for students who are interested in learning basic tools, techniques, and applications of microeconomics. While an intuitive appreciation of the principles will be the primary objective, mathematical tools will be employed to illustrate the implementation of these principles to practical cases. Any advanced mathematics that is used will be developed in class.

Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course explores the foundations of economic issues in developing countries. The objects of this course are (1) to provide a critical overview of the recent literature and important debates in economic development and (2) to examine the impact of development policies. We will use the microeconomic framework to study theories and empirical evidence on different facets of development: agriculture, health, education, gender, family, labor markets, risk, consumption, and credit markets. For each topic, we will study examples chosen from around the world. While studying each of these topics, we will ask: What determines the decisions of poor households in developing countries? Is there a scope for policy – by government, international organizations, or nongovernmental organizations (NGOs)? What policies have been tried out? Have they been successful?

Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to offer a broad overview of the topics that generally fall within the purview of labor economics. These topics include the reasons why people work, the reasons why firms hire employees, the wages and benefits workers are paid, the educational and occupational choices individuals make, the structure and effects of unions, the structure and effects of labor market regulations, and the structure and effects of many public programs.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 貿易、經濟與永續發展專題
CourseName: Seminar on Trade, Economy and Sustainable Development
Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: In this course we will introduce and discuss the literature on the nexus between trade, economy and sustainable development. Countries derive additional economic benefits from trade than otherwise. However, environmental stress tends to follow trade as natural resources are used as input for producing exported goods. Asian-Pacific economies are attracting the world’s attention in their rapid economic growth, sizable markets and increasingly significant role in the global economy. Domestic and global factors have together shaped the diverse economies in this region, particularly in their economic structure and development strategies. Inextricably linked with economic activities, environmental quality and natural resource endowment in this region are facing tremendous stress from far and near. Developed and developing countries of this region share a common development experience by thriving their economies on trade, though now even more intensive globalization. Sustainable development in both the economy and environment is thus concerned. A good grasp of the economy-environment nexus from both economy-wide and world-wide perspectives is imperative and helpful in guiding pertinent policies to effectively tackle the dual challenge of sustainability transition.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 因果推論與資料科學在經濟學的應用
CourseName: Causal Inference and Data Science in Economics
Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will survey empirical methods for conducting causal inference and data science in economics.

Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 貿易政策的議題，在傳統上，是聚焦在政府應否對外開放其本國的自由貿易、或應否對貿易作某種管制的討論上。而無論哪一種政策工具，一旦施行，便不可避免地會國際市場的供需產生或多或少的影響，也因此會影響到貿易的價格、貿易的數量、國內的生產、國內的消費、乃至所得分配等等的面向，而最終也將會影響到社會福利。

Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides a comprehensive overview of the modern Chinese economy, and discusses several important aspects of the Chinese growth and development, including the major shifts in economic philosophy through time, the macroeconomic trends, agriculture and the rural industrialization, the economic development of urban areas, international trade and foreign investment, as well as the challenges facing China today.

CourseName: Development Aid and Asia Pacific Cooperation
Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will instruct various analytical perspectives, issues and major countries’ practices in development assistance and cooperation in the Asia Pacific region. These countries are not limited to donors, but also including recipients in the region. It is related to the areas of Foreign Policy and International Relations; Public Policy and Governance; Political Economy. The course is essentially divided into four parts: conceptual framework and perspectives; development aid strategies; actors and institutions; key issues; countries and region practices.

The course will introduce students to the idea of multivariate analysis. It covers the basics of regression analysis and more advanced statistical methods.

Course Department: The International Master Program of Applied Economics and Social Development (IMES) , Second Year

Course Department: Selective courses of master level,College of Commerce
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: In an era that promotes public private partnership (ppp), social enterprises (not NPO) help solve social problems at the same time make profit for sustainability. With increasing social problems world widely, more social innovations are needed to improve the well-being of  societies.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 智能供應鏈：趨勢與應用
CourseName: Intelligent Supply Chain: Trends and Applications
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 作業管理(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Selective courses of master level,College of Commerce
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 智能贏用（如：大數據）可以為供應商網絡 (Supplier Networks) 提供更好的數據準確性 (Accuracy)、清晰度 (Clarity) 和洞察力 (Insights)，從而在共享的供應網絡中實現更多的情境智能 (Contextual Intelligence)。如今的製造商都立足於在準確性(Accuracy)、速度 (Speed) 和質量 (Quality) 方面展開市場競爭，這一定位迫使企業的供應商網絡必須具備一定程度的情景智能的能力。本課程將介紹如何將供應鏈管理與智能應用結合。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程講授行銷研究的程序、方法與相關的管理議題。也探討行銷研究方法的發展趨勢、研究產業的概況、及研究倫理。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 國立政治大學課程教學大綱

Course Department: Selective courses of master level,College of Commerce
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: “Occupational Health Psychology (OHP) involves the interdisciplinary partnerships of psychological and occupational health science professionals seeking to improve the quality of working life, and enhance the safety, health and well-being of workers in all occupations. Because it exists at the intersection of behavioral science and occupational health disciplines, OHP is inclusive of knowledge and methods from psychology, public/occupational health, organizational studies, human factors, and allied fields (such as occupational sociology, industrial engineering, economics, and others). OHP is concerned with the broad range of exposures and mechanisms that affect the quality of working life and the responses of workers. These include individual psychological attributes, job content and work organization, organizational policies and practices, and the economic and political environments in which organizations function. OHP research and practice explores interventions targeting the work environment as well as the individual, to create healthier workplaces and organizations and to improve the capacity of workers to protect their safety and health and to maximize their overall effectiveness.” (Society for Occupational Health Psychology, 2017; http://www.sohp-online.org/field.htm ).

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財務管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 投資學(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Schedule of College of Commerce Elective Courses for Commerce Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 增進同學對金融投資工具衍生性商品之風險管理，期貨、選擇權、以及交換之衍生性商品的理論與實務結合，建立正確的交易觀念與實務增進同學對金融投資工具衍生性商品之風險管理，期貨、選擇權、以及交換之衍生性商品的理論與實務結合，建立正確的交易觀念與實務。

Course Department: Selective courses of master level,College of Commerce
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在大數據的狂潮下，全世界掀起了一股產業變革的滔天巨浪，開啟了企業4.0、行銷4.0的時代。未來，誰掌握了大數據、誰活用了大數據，誰就掌握了市場。因而，投入大數據的研究與應用成了國與國之間的競爭策略，也成了國家競爭力的一部份。

Course Department: Schedule of College of Commerce Elective Courses for Commerce Students

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Intermediate Writing gives students an insight of the business world by exposing them to knowledge of the English language skills, especially in the writing skill area, necessary to succeed.  Students will also receive academic writing training to develop the ability to produce well-organized and logical essays.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與口語訓練（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 寫作與口語訓練（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Schedule of College of Commerce Elective Courses for Commerce Students
Prerequisite: [ English Writing]  AND  [ Writing and Oral Training II]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is conducted in four ways: in-class discussion and lectures, in-class activities, writing tasks, and voluntary oral presentations. We will begin by discussing three major clause types, four sentence types, and the correct use of conjunctions, which are fundamental to effective writing. Then we focus on the structure and elements of a paragraph. Following that, we discuss how to develop paragraphs into an academic essay; we explore major writing strategies such as summarizing and outlining, process analysis, narration, and argumentation. To enhance grasp of writing skills, we will read and analyze essays by professional authors. Students will be assigned writing tasks on the individual or team basis to apply and incorporate the writing skills and will learn to communicate and solve problems in simulated business settings.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Writing and Oral Training II is a continuation of the comprehensive training in students’ speaking skills as well as paragraph writing skills.  With the confidence that students have developed during the first-semester training in using the English language, students will continue to polish their communication skills to effectively deliver their messages in a natural way and to enhance their improvisation skills to reach and engage their audience.

Course Department: Schedule of College of Commerce Elective Courses for Commerce Students

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與口語訓練（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Schedule of College of Commerce Elective Courses for Commerce Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
Course Description: 
The course is a continuation of Oral Training and Writing I. This course offers you opportunities to practice and improve oral and written communicative ability. The course is designed to help you become more comfortable with speaking English in public and expressing your ideas in writing, so you can be more confident when communicating in English.
We will focus upon 6 to 8 topics and issues this semester. You will practice language functions in various occasions such as making appointments, making complaints, giving advice, and introducing one’s native culture. Communication activities including role-playing, group discussion, simulation practice will be frequent in class, allowing you to improve oral fluency. The course prepares various oral and writing tasks and you are required to employ the skills and knowledge learned in completing the tasks. To help cultivate your global perspective, you will research on a chosen international issue or event and present your viewpoint and lead a group discussion. Also, you will present on a person with global influence. For the final project, you will work as a team, spending weeks to produce an English play.
The minor focus of the course is basic academic writing. We will discuss basic paragraph structure and research paper format. You will learn how to develop main ideas in one paragraph and how to build paragraphs into a mini-essay, and you will have the opportunity to share personal experience by writing.

It contains the knowledge of Microeconomics that will help students with a theoretical framework to aid analysis of the microeconomic problems.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 數理統計學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Schedule of College of Commerce Elective Courses for Commerce Students
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to cover some introductory theoretical knowledge of the probability and statistics. Although the primary focus is on a mathematical development of the subject, examples and exercises are oriented toward applications. After taking this course, students can gain solid mathematical understanding of probability theory fundamental to all future work in probability and statistics.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 國際貿易經營管理旨在引領同學理解跨國交易的法律風險，以及基於此而衍生的種種法律以及商業制度，從貿易公司的設立，締結契約、交易流程、到交易的爭端解決等相關問題，逐一解析，以期同學對於跨國交易有全面性的理解。

CourseName: Senior Research Seminar in International Trade andInvestment
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(全學年)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is divided into two parts. The first part introduces the normative theory of trade. We analyzethe optimal trade policy when the government has different objective functions (maximizing welfare of the society or maximizing the welfare of the  government etc.) and under various market structures. We also consider the strategic interactions of home and foreign governments and examine the economic principle of GATT and WTO. The second part considers some advanced topics of positive trade theory including the decisions of export, foreign direct investment andstructure of multinational firms.

CourseName: Seminar on International Economic and Trade Law
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 國際經貿法(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將選擇重要之國際經貿法專題，深入討論WTO下之相關規範以及GATT/WTO爭端解決案件，以便同學得深度瞭解國際經貿法下各重要專題。修課同學必須具備國際經貿法之基本知識，以修過本系必修之國際經貿法為佳。本學期所選擇之專題為動物福利以及氣候變遷兩類政策與國際經貿法之關係。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財務管理(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to provide perspective on the central issues faced by a financial vice president or a financial officer within the company. Topics include measuring foreign exchange risk, managing the risk with both contractual and operating strategies, foreign investment decisions, capital budgeting and cost of capital in an international perspective, political risk, working capital management, and performance evaluation and control. Students will also be required to develop conceptual understanding of the foreign exchange market, the Euro-currency market, the international bond market, and equity market in various countries. Emphasis is on underlying economic principles, institutional features helpful in understanding the structure and operations of the market will also be dealt with in detail. This course also directs specific attention to the burgeoning development of mergers and acquisitions. Students will be disciplined to understand and practice on a properly defined process (10 phases) that contributes to the success of a business combination.

CourseName: Senior Research Seminar in International Finance
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 國際金融(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The aim of the course is that the students develop an understanding of the main implications of increasing integration of the world economy. By describing the various ways that countries are affected by each other -through trade linkages, multinational production, or financial markets- the course will try to explain how these forces affect the decisions of individuals and firms. Topics covered in the course include theories and facts about the gains from globalization, the current account, exchange rate determination, currency crises, Optimum Currency Areas and Monetary Union, and Sovereign Debt and Default . The class will maintain focus to applying this knowledge to real world applications.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: As of 2002, Taiwan became a Member to the World Trade Organization (WTO), and obliged to comply with the rules under the WTO covered agreements. This course will  discuss    relevant international trade rules, ongoing negotiatin issues and   important   trade   disputes    under the WTO. This course covers the brief introduction to the history and structure of the WTO, and examine various rules regarding trade in goods, services and trade-related intellectual property rights under the covered agreements including the GATT, GATS and TRIPS. Selected WTO dispute settlement cases will also be discuessed.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 菁英商務英語: 團隊領導與商務社交技巧
CourseName: Elite Business English: Team-Building and Socializing Skills
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides intensive, skills-based professional English training in executive business skills. In this course, various of topics to enhance key communicative and managerial skills are introduced to the class. For instance, build rapport, build a team and stimulate morale, business entertainment and small talks, chair and participate a meeting, manage a crisis, handle conflicts, etc.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 菁英商務英語: 提案與談判技巧
CourseName: Elite Business English: Making proposals and Negotiation Skills
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Negotiation has been defined as the art of letting the other person have it your way! Can you get the deal you want whilst making your opponent feel the same?

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 國際企業管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course focuses on the strategic management issues important to the operations of the firm in the international context.

CourseName: Advanced Weminar on WTO Law : Trade in Service
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 服務的產值約占全球國民生產毛額的三分之二，相關投資也幾乎達全球外人直接投資總額的三分之二，以貿易加值為核心的統計，更估計服務貿易占今日全球貿易比重近百分之五十。雖然其重要性與日俱增，但全球服務貿易多邊規範之發展卻一直到1986年烏拉圭回合談判才展開。由於至今不過才30餘年的歷史，相較於貨品貿易，無論是在自由化程度、規則之發展、或爭端案例之累積方面，仍有相當大的進步空間。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程主在建立碩士班學生獨立研究之能力。學生必須自行尋找研究主題，與授課教師討論，在課堂上報告問題、動機、重要性，可能解決問題的方法以及預期的結果，並在期末撰寫書面報告。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Through illustration of 15 international business trading topics, stuents are to be taught step-by-step how to write clear,concise and effective business correspondences,including emails,memos,faxes,letters,reports and so on. This course will also teach students in understanding key elements of written communication, i.e. language, medium, format, sturcture, perspective and appropriateness. Furthermore, an adaquate portion of class time will be dedicated to lecturing grammar,punctuation,and styles for business writing. In addition, the course requires students to practice some assigned writing tasks both in the class and at home. From time to time,through group/pair work, students will learn to review and critique writing works among one another. Upon completion of the course, students are expected to make their written messages more structural,logical,effective and with grammatical correct as well as business appropriateness.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 能力項目說明

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The one-semester course aims to introduce undergraduate level students some well-established econometric and statistical techniques for financial data analysis with R, a free and popular software for scientific data analysis. We will start with a basic introduction of how to use R, including how to input, output and manipulate data, and how to use basic operations, functions and program statements, etc.. We will then proceed to learn how to calculate individual asset's and portfolio's returns and various risk measures, estimate linear regression models, construct minimum variance portfolios and evaluate derivative prices.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之前身為開設給國貿系碩士班選修之「金融市場法規」，故屬研究所等級課程，惟大三、四同學想要嘗試研討型課程（Seminar）、且願意花時間獨立研究者，歡迎選修此門課程。國際金融法專題（一）與（二）各自擁有獨立主題，故未修專題（一）者，仍可修習專題（二），不影響學分之承認。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Please see the attached.

CourseName: Special Topics on International Business Management
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 經濟學(全學年)(有修即可) 或 管理學(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由每周邀請實務界的高階管理者，讓同學吸收最新的實務知識。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of International Business
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要介紹跨境電子商務的理論與實務, 除了介紹全球主要跨境電商平台之外, 課程還包括五個個案的討論, 以及最後三周的彈性教學, 期能讓同學有完整的實務訓練.

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Money and Banking
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The design of this course is by courtesy of HSBC Taiwan. Various guest speakers will discuss multiple issues of contemporary bank management in practice.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財務管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Money and Banking
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will introduce the big picture of international financial environment, including multinational firms, countries' balance of payment, and international financial markets. This course will also introduce the foreign exchange risk and how to hedge that.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 統計學(全學年)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Money and Banking
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces some basic econometric theories, methods and various empirical applications at the undergraduate level. Econometric methods are crucial to data analysis and interpretation in various disciplines, including evaluating the effects of a treatment, gauging the significance of a correlation and/or causal relationship, and providing forecasts for variables of interests. Those who wish to take this course should be familiar with probability theory, statistics, calculus and at least one programming software/toolkit.

CourseName: Case Study in New Financial Products
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Money and Banking
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程簡介：

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Money and Banking
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 透過元大金控投資銀行業務團隊多年專業經驗累積，從傳統輔導國內企業上市上櫃掛牌，擴及至外國企業來台掛牌、創投、策略性經營資金導入、私募、海內外籌資規劃以及企業重整、合併、收購、分割等專案性業務，所設計一系列課程：

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Money and Banking
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為專題演講，每週將分別邀請金管會官員、高階金融主管及Aberdeen Standard Investments公司，針對金融監理、銀行、證券、保險、信託商品、公司治理、金融科技等議題，深入剖析。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 現代社會的各種經濟活動，均與租稅發生關連，尤其是從事會計相關工作者，更需要具備充足的租稅知識。本課程期透過理論的解說與實務案例的研討，將租稅法的基本規定，傳授予學生，俾使其於畢業之後，能用於職場或作為進一步研究的基礎，至少於未來能有效保護自己在租稅上應有的權利。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provide an opportunity to understand the fundamentals of business analysis with foci on issues of financial reporting, accounting, financial analysis and valuation.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class A, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This two-semester course is designed to provide a conceptual background of the audit environment as well as adequate procedural coverage as to be sufficient for those intending to take positions in public accounting or internal auditing. In this semester, we will concentrate on basic audit concepts (e.g., audit standards, audit report, professional ethics, audit planning, audit evidence, and risk assessment). In the next semester, we will focus on special audit techniques (e.g., EDP audit and audit sampling) and how to apply these techniques to various transaction cycles (e.g., revenue, acquisition, inventory and production, and payroll cycles). Please note that this course does not intend to be a CPA exam preparation course. However, understanding the concepts in this course will assist you when you prepare for the CPA exam.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This two-semester course is designed to cover both concepts and procedures of auditing and assurance services. The following chapters are covered in the first semester:

Chapter 1 The demand for audit and other Assurance Services
Chapter 2 The CPA profession
Chapter 3 Audit Report
Chapter 4 Professional Ethics
Chapter 6 Audit Responsibilities and Objectives
Chapter 7 Audit Evidence
Chapter 8 Audit Planning
Chapter 9 Assessing the Risk of Material Misstatements
Chapter 10 Assessing and Responding to Fraud Risks
Chapter 11 Internal Control and COSO Framework

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 高級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class A, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]  AND  [ Advanced Accounting（I）]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
The course consists of two main sections. First, accounting for business combinations and
consolidations. Second, other important accounting issues, including foreign currencydenominated
transactions, accounting for derivatives and hedging activities, foreign currency
translations, segment and interim financial reporting, home office and branch accounting.
The course is comprised of lectures and tutorials. Attendance at lectures and tutorials is
compulsory. Learning is achieved through:
(1)Attending lectures and tutorials. Students are expected to do some pre-reading in order to
prepare for lectures. For tutorial sessions, students are expected to complete assignments before
class.
(2)Students are expected to actively participate in classroom discussions.
(3)Homework exercises.
(4)In-class quizzes
(5)Supplementary readings assigned by the course leader or tutor.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]  AND  [ Advanced Accounting（I）]

Second, other important accounting issues, including foreign currency-denominated transactions, accounting for derivatives and hedging activities, foreign currency translations, segment and interim financial reporting, home office and branch accounting.

Course Department: Junior Class A, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Software Application Introduction]  AND  [ Data Processing]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: An accounting information system (AIS) is a system of collecting, storing and processing financial and accounting data that are used by decision makers. An accounting information system is generally a computer-based method for tracking accounting activity in conjunction with information technology resources. The resulting data sources and reports can be used internally by management or externally by other interested parties including investors, creditors and tax authorities. In this class, students will be educated with the contemporary accounting information system models, processes, techniques, and applications. Lectures, discussions, special talks and tests will be given throughout the semester.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Accounting

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class A, Department of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 重要提醒:

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This two-semester course is designed to provide an introductory understanding of financial accounting, including accounting theory, concepts, principles, and procedures. Based on the content of this textbook, the lecture materials are divided into seven parts: the basic structure and concepts of accounting (chapters 1-5), accounting for assets (chapters 6-9, 12), internal control theory (chapter 7), accounting for liabilities (chapter 10), accounting for stockholder’s equity (chapter, 11), and the analysis of accounting information (chapters 13-14). In this semester, we will cover chapters 8-14. Understanding the contents in this course will not only help you learn the language of business, but also get you ready for further accounting courses.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class A, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will equip students with a collection of GAAP (IFRSs). It is important for students to understand the how and the why. To involve students more in the learning process, they are requested to prepare the related content before the class. Students are expected to learn the accounting theories and practice from this course, and to develop self-study and people skills from the participation in the process. The content discussed in the class include IFRSs, Taiwan, and U.S. financial accounting standards.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程介紹中級會計學第二學期，內容包括負債、金融工具、權益等主題之會計處理。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 審計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]  AND  [ Auditing I]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在高度資訊化營運環境中，大數據應用於分析或查核工作已為必然趨勢，瞭解電腦稽核技術應用的基礎知識，應用軟體來進行資料比對與確認，提昇查核品質與效率，已成為財會人競爭力的必備條件。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
