Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要內容係以政府會計為主軸，由財務報導提供有用資訊，以評估政府對公開報導、施政績效、財務遵循之責任及跨期間公平性， 其會計處理及財務報導應依循基本假設、財務報表要素之認列及基本會計原則辦理，使政府所掌握之資源作最適當之配置與使用，並產生合理允當之會計資訊，作為決策依據。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Cost Accounting]  AND  [ Advanced Cost Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 策略管理是企業經營最重要的決策之一。會計需與策略配合，然而實際的情境有很多變化，導致大部份學生在面臨真實的策略與會計決策時，不知如何處理。如何運用理論在實際情境下做策略性決策，是學生學習的重點。本課程主要目的在於藉由個案分析，使學生能面對各類策略與會計結合的問題，培養出思考問題，解決問題的能力。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Cost Accounting]  AND  [ Advanced Cost Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「策略管理」在探討企業整體與個別事業單位所面臨的策略性決策（strategic decisions），其思考與分析邏輯是相當重要。本課程教導學習成為一為管理會計專業人員所需相關的策略管理理論

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 公司治理與財務報表（打造後ECFA時代國際會計菁英的十八堂課）
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 【授課老師】安永聯合會計師事務所團隊

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 策略成本管理－個案實作
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Cost Accounting]  AND  [ Advanced Cost Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 吳安妮講座教授將30年之管理會計研究成果整合為「整合性策略價值管理系統」，於2012年及2015年取得臺灣及大陸與美國之商標權。本系統包含五大子系統，分別為1.策略形成系統、2.策略執行系統、3.作業管理系統、4.作業價值管理及5.策略價值創造系統。本課程主要以1.策略形成系統--SWOT計分卡（SWOT Scorecard）及2.策略執行系統--平衡計分卡（Balanced Scorecard, BSC）之個案實務操作方向及內容，讓學生了解學理的基本知識與個案實際操作之能力。

CourseName: Reporting and Valuation of Intangible Assets
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Valuation by itself is a profession and is a highly regulated industry in well-managed countries. It is useful for purposes of transactions, litigation, taxation, financial reporting and general management. Transactions, in a broad sense, include investment, IPOs, mergers and acquisitions, licensing, technology transfer, etc. For any rational person in the business arena with duty of care to manage and create value, the value that she/he wishes to manage and create would be carefully calculated in order to make sound informed decisions and to take prudent profitable actions.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 政府係任何國家組成要素之一，亦為任一國家最大的組織體，由於其組織體規模太大，可能因與人人有關而演變成人人不關心之窘境，致造成政府管理績效長期不如一般企業，因此當某一政府欲提高施政績效時，經常提出企業文化之理念。可見企業管理理念，係提高政府施政績效之良方，而會計又是企業管理最具關鍵性工具，故政府會計應為現階段提高施政績效最重要工具之一。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 成本管理會計（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Advanced Cost Accounting]  AND  [ Cost Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要在讓商學院之學生能了解成本管理理論與實務如何結合及運用，透過理論與實務經驗分享，協助學生了解如何發掘自己的特質及人生未來發展方向，以便在學時能夠盡早儲備各方知識及能力，日積月累下，假以時日能成為優秀的全方位專業經營管理人才，為所屬組織開闢新局面，創造更高績效。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大數據之決策管理及審計實務
CourseName: Application of Big Data on Decision-making and Auditing Practices
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 由資誠會計師事務所(PwC)具有豐富系統、流程及風險管理經驗之專家，闡述大數據所可能衍生之商業模式，並透過案例研討，期使同學瞭解大數據對於企業決策之用途，以及如何建構資料治理之框架。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程以大陸稅法為主，輔以大陸註冊會計師考題或大陸稅務師考題，俾利同學準備赴大陸或在台灣處理大陸稅務得以事先暖身。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 初級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 中級會計學（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Accounting
Prerequisite: [ Fundamental Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Financial Accounting Q4]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting(I)]  AND  [ Intermediate Accounting]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 鑑識始於法庭，從物理、化學、生物等層面，探求自然人死亡之原因，發現事實之真相，以利法庭判斷之作成，名偵探柯南故事之情節多屬此類。

Course Department: Junior Class A, Department of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This two-semester course is designed to provide a conceptual background of the audit environment as well as adequate procedural coverage as to be sufficient for those intending to take positions in public accounting or internal auditing. In this semester, we will concentrate on basic audit concepts (e.g., audit standards, audit report, professional ethics, audit planning, audit evidence, and risk assessment). In the next semester, we will focus on special audit techniques (e.g., EDP audit and audit sampling) and how to apply these techniques to various transaction cycles (e.g., revenue, acquisition, inventory and production, and payroll cycles). Please note that this course does not intend to be a CPA exam preparation course. However, understanding the concepts in this course will assist you when you prepare for the CPA exam.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Accounting
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This two-semester course is designed to cover both concepts and procedures of auditing and assurance services. The following chapters are covered in the first semester:

Chapter 1 The demand for audit and other Assurance Services
Chapter 2 The CPA profession
Chapter 3 Audit Report
Chapter 4 Professional Ethics
Chapter 6 Audit Responsibilities and Objectives
Chapter 7 Audit Evidence
Chapter 8 Audit Planning
Chapter 9 Assessing the Risk of Material Misstatements
Chapter 10 Assessing and Responding to Fraud Risks
Chapter 11 Internal Control and COSO Framework

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 微積分(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This two-semester course (304002001 and 304002002) covers basic topics in calculus including functions, limits, derivatives, integrals and series. Students are not required to turn in homework assignments, but are required to know how to solve the basic problems in homework assignments.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 線性代數(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This is a one-year course.
The topics for first semester include Linear System, Matrices, Determinants, and Vector Spaces.
The topics for second semester include Coordinates and Change of Basis, Kernel and Range of a Linear Transformation (a Matrix), Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors, Diagonalization, Quadratic Forms, and Linear Programming.

Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Linear regression models are widely used today in business adminstration, economics, engineering and the social health and biological sciences. Successful applications of these models require a sound understanding of both the underlying theory and the practical problems that are encountered in using the models in real-life situation. This course seeks to provide students techniques in applied regression analysis. The focus will be on how to perform regression techniques to analyze the data and interpret the results.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 變異數分析與實驗設計
CourseName: Analysis of Variance and Experimental Design
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will help students to understand the fundamental concepts of analysis of variance (ANOVA) and experimental designs, conduct analysis using R, and interpret the results for ANOVA and experiments.

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The focus of the course will be on both basic theory and applications of multivariate statistical methods: basic concepts and statistical reasoning which underlie the techniques of multivariate analysis, applications in the business functional areas including accounting, finance, marketing, and human resources, and organization behavior, and proficiency in using statistical software to analyze multivariate data.

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This course will cover    the following contents:
1. Stochastic Processes
2. Stationary Time Series models
3. Nonstationary Time Series Models
4. Exponential Smoothing Methods
5. Seasonal Time Series Models
6. Intervention Analysis
7. Transfer Function Models

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 微積分(全學年)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 數理統計學（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is the second course in a two-semester sequence on introductory mathematical statistics. It aims to introduce basic concepts in probability and mathematical statistics.

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將以資料分析為主軸，學生將由了解資料，討論資料的可能應用開始，進而討論要回答問題所需的統計及計算工具。經由實作分析，根據所得知結果，再進一步討論方法的好處壞處，計算的瓶頸及優勢。如果有必要，在進一步討論如何修正方法，得到更好的結果，或者修其可能的應用。 (注意：網路上有不少課程也以 "Learning From Data"為名，但本課程並非"機器學習"課程; 而是強調以問題為核心的資料分析思維，特別將以統計學的思考準則為主，而計算的考量為輔。)

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將介紹如何使用R進行數據分析和視覺化計算。在最後的期末報告中，將運用學到的技能來分析實際商業數據，並下正確的策略與建議。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 高等微積分（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a one-year course.

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is the continuation of the course of Regression Analysis (I).  It is designed for undergraduate students majored in statistics or related field to gain advanced concepts and understanding in both theories and application of applied regression models.

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Statistics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course demonstrates data analysis using statistical methods such as linear models, generalized linear models, and matrix factorization techniques. The methods discussed will mostly be demonstrated in the R programming language. Basic statistical concepts, matrix operations, and programming skills are required.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 組織行為(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程在介紹人力資源管理的重要功能、活動及與組織策略之間的關係。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 組織行為(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class A, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 國立政治大學106學年度下學期

Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is an introduction to calculus and its applications to the management, social, behavioral, and biomedical sciences, and other fields. This course is designed to be applied and real-world orientation to concepts, problem-solving approach, straightforward, concise and comprehensive exercise practice.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 管理學(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The purpose of this class is to provide undergraduate students with an introduction to Organizational Behavior (OB). Through lectures, assignments, exams, and in-class activities, students are expected to gain understanding of the theories, practices, and issues concerning OB.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: TBD

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 管理科學(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides an introduction to the field of production and operations management. It is designed to highlight the practical and applied techniques, which can improve the organization’s quality and productivity. The course draws upon the students’ knowledge of accounting, science, mathematics, management, and statistics.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of Business Administration
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is an introduction to quantitative models in managerial decision-making. Management Science, a well-established discipline in the field of business, can be defined as the application of a scientific method to managerial problems in order to make better decisions. The applications of management science techniques cover a large area (industry, government, military, transportation, marketing, health care, etc.). Topics include Forecasting, Linear Programming, Transportation/Assignment, Network Optimization, PERT/CPM Models, Integer Programming, Goal Programming, Decision Analysis, Queueing Models, and Simulations. MS EXCEL will be the primary tool for the problem modeling and solving.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 行銷管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 作業管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 人力資源管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 資訊管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 財務管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Business Administration
Prerequisite: [ Marketing]  AND  [ Managing Operations]  AND  [ Human Resources]  AND  [ Information Management]  AND  [ Finanzmanagement]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Strategic management is that set of managerial decisions and actions that determines the long-run performance of a corporation. It includes environmental scanning (both external and internal), strategy formulation (Strategic or long-range planning), strategy implementation, and evaluation and control. The study of strategic management, therefore, emphasizes the monitoring and evaluating of external opportunities and threats in light of a corporation’s strengths and weaknesses. Originally called business policy, strategic management incorporates such topics as long-range planning and strategy. Business policy, in contrast, has a general management orientation and tends primarily to look inward with its concern for properly integrating the corporation’s many functional activities. Strategic management incorporates the integrative concerns of business policy with a heavier environmental and strategic emphasis. Thus, strategic management has tended to replace business policy as the preferred name of the field in recent years.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Business Administration
Prerequisite: [ Human Resources]  AND  [ Managing Operations]  AND  [ Finanzmanagement]  AND  [ Information Management]  AND  [ Marketing]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Strategic Management deals with the organization, management, and strategic positioning of the firm so as to gain long-term competitive advantage. Your previous coursework has primarily emphasized a specialized, functional perspective of business situations. In finance, you have been concerned with understanding how capital markets work and, in turn, affect the financing of a company’s on-going operations. In marketing, the focus has been on how to analyze, shape, and address the needs of consumers as well as how to manage a company’s marketing efforts. In operations management, you have learned about how to organize the production activities of a firm so it is able to produce quality goods and services at an attractive price. Finally, courses on the management of human resources have been concerned with the effective development and management of a company’s human assets. All of these functional disciplines play a critical role in the success of any company, but how do they fit together?

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: “Occupational Health Psychology (OHP) involves the interdisciplinary partnerships of psychological and occupational health science professionals seeking to improve the quality of working life, and enhance the safety, health and well-being of workers in all occupations. Because it exists at the intersection of behavioral science and occupational health disciplines, OHP is inclusive of knowledge and methods from psychology, public/occupational health, organizational studies, human factors, and allied fields (such as occupational sociology, industrial engineering, economics, and others). OHP is concerned with the broad range of exposures and mechanisms that affect the quality of working life and the responses of workers. These include individual psychological attributes, job content and work organization, organizational policies and practices, and the economic and political environments in which organizations function. OHP research and practice explores interventions targeting the work environment as well as the individual, to create healthier workplaces and organizations and to improve the capacity of workers to protect their safety and health and to maximize their overall effectiveness.” (Society for Occupational Health Psychology, 2017; http://www.sohp-online.org/field.htm ).

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course objectives are the in-depth discussions on modern machine learning techniques and their applications. Particularly, we will study learning techniques on generative adversarial networks (GANs). GANs are a class of artificial intelligence algorithms used in unsupervised machine learning, implemented by a system of two neural networks contesting with each other in a zero-sum game framework. One network generates candidates and the other evaluates them. Generative models are one of the most promising approaches towards the goal to endorse computers to understand the world.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 如何善用機器學習(Machine Learning)、深度學習(Deep Learning)處理大數據進行分析，成為企業競爭力不可或缺的一環。而機器學習與深度學習可透過TensorFlow 技術有效時限。本課程著重大樹據、機器學習以及TensorFlow的探討，並透過案例研究培養相關的技巧。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Management Information Systems
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Asian countries have shown their technological expertise and insightful approaches to economy and business in the past. Even more recently we have seen the growth, even the dominance of China in the information technology market. Some Asian countries have became major players in the IT and E-commerce industry with explosively increasing Internet usage, manufacturing capabilities, and fast changing mobile applications. This class presents the experiences of information technology revolutions among Asian countries (i.e., Taiwan, China, Japan, Korea), Europe and US. The different perspectives on the digital rights and governmental tools will be discussed with focus on the problems and promises of communications policy governing telecommunications and the formulation and promotion of IT industry concerning digital image technology and telecommunications. As telecommunications-based new media technologies develop rapidly and unevenly in the world, government and industry policy has become a priority among government leaders and academic researchers. This is particularly true in many regions, where clear and visionary policy has been lacking, leading either to ill-structured economic development or uneven growth among different social sectors.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程透過不動產管理的「權利基礎」、「管理範疇」與「營運模式」等角度進行研析，學員從學習中建立整體性的不動產管理知識，作為專業職能發展的基礎。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財務管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]  及  [ 投資學(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Finance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This class intends to provide students a further understanding of corporate financial strategies and their impact on firm value. The class contains the topics of corporate governance, corporate investment, corporate financing, dividend policy, and value creation. This is an advanced-level course. The fundamental knowledge of financial management and investment theory will not be lectured in this class. Those who do not meet the prerequisite requirement should not enroll to this class, no exception will be granted.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財務管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Finance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這是一門講授國際財務管理相關議題的課程，內容主要在討論國際財務管理基本觀念，包括匯率的決定因素、即期及遠期外匯的關連、外匯衍生性商品、企業避險的原因及績效評估、國際籌資、國際投資與租稅規劃等議題。上課方式有課堂講授、外匯模擬交易、個案討論、學術文章閱讀等。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 民法概要(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
民法是私人之間法律關係的基礎法律規範，幾乎可以說，所有可能的私有財產或身分關係的法律糾紛，皆係運用「民法為基礎的法律規範」以達到「定紛止爭」的目的。生活在工商經濟活動甚為頻繁的現代社會裡，重要的民法基礎知識是維護生活利益不可或缺的常識，從生活用品的買賣、旅行契約的應有內容到借款投資的法律風險等等，如能瞭解法律、預先做好風險管理，必能預防糾紛，順利的實現生活或交易的目的。
基於前述的觀點，本課程之目標有下列三項：
(一) 瞭解一般人必備的法律知識
(二) 建立預防糾紛的風險管理觀念
(三) 培養專業經理人應有的民法基礎

Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將介紹財產保險之商品類型、保險契約條款，以及財產保險之基本概念與理論。並安排財產保險公司高階主管講授財產保險經營管理實務以及公司參訪，包括核保、理賠、費率釐訂、再保險安排以及基本經營作業，增進同學財產保險市場實務運作之了解。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為本系大三必修課程，課程主要介紹社會保險之基本概念，內容將涵蓋台灣現行各類型社會保險制度(例如勞工保險、公務人員保險、國民年金保險與全民健康保險等)的基本介紹，並就相關給付進行說明，同時也將就目前台灣社會保險制度所面臨之問題進行討論與分析。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 再保險者，乃保險之保險也，亦是保險經營不可或缺之重要環節，可謂進階或高等(advancedd)保險學。本課程除介紹傳統再保險之理論與實務外，亦將涉及其他風險分散工具（Alternative Risk Transfer）。本課程除依照教學大綱逐次介紹，並研討相關實際案例，以求理論與實務能相互印證。

Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The purpose of this course is to equip the students with a general framework for understanding the effects of risk, the tools and methods used to measure and manage risk, the process of making risk management decisions.  The course provides a broader knowledge in risk management while the field of insurance is also included.  Some specific topics in risk management, such as derivatives or tax effects on risk management will be presented.  Institutional details with emphasis on current practices in Taiwan will also be presented.  Since the institutional details are constantly changing, our primary goal is to stimulate critical thinking and promote the development of problem solving skills to better prepare students for applying general concepts to new sets of problems, new types of risks, and new institutional structures.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 風險管理與保險經營講座
CourseName: Seminar on the Operation of Risk Management and InsuranceBusiness
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 為開擴同學求知與就業之視野，並期使本系學業課程能與業界實務運作更多的互動，以促進理論與實務緊密之結合，本課程邀請政府機關、金融機構與代表產業之高階主管，以企業個案分析模式，分享各產業之不同風險控管與企業風險管理之經驗，藉以引導學生對企業風險管理實務瞭解之興趣，期鼓勵投身志趣產業，建立本系學術與實務互動之專業形象。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 為因應保險科技發展趨勢，以及未來保險業因應新環境挑戰之人才需求，特開設本課程。本課程主要是希望透過專案實作方式，培養學生了解保險科技的應用與實作能力，希望能養成具有實作能力與應用能力的保險科技專業人才。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 區塊鏈與Python程式設計簡介
CourseName: Introduction of Blockchain and Python Programming
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course covers the concepts in bitcoin blockchain. The concepts include distributed systems, cryptography, P2P networks, blockchain, bitcoin clients, wallets, proof of work, consensus algorithms, alt coins and related data structure. This course also introduces Python programming in numerical computation. The students should have great interests in Fintech, cryptocurrency and have solid background in mathematics.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 金融控股公司經營與策略
CourseName: Strategy and Operation on Financial Holding Company
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 金融控股公司制度為我國金融市場最重要之制度之一，目前國內已成立16家金控公司，並已經涵蓋國內大部分的重要金融機構(如銀行、保險與證券公司等)，因此本課程將以金融控股公司之策略經營層面為主軸，並同時討論金控實務面上之重要議題，希望修課同學對於金融控股公司有一完整全面的了解。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 財務管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The purpose of this course is to develop a way of analyzing and thinking about investment strategies under a practical investment environment. Hopefully, to some extent, students will be able to fill the gaps between the theories and the practice in investments.

Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The goal of the Financial Mathematics course is to provide undergraduate an understanding of the fundamental concepts of financial mathematics, and how those concepts are applied in calculating present and accumulated values for various streams of cash flows as a basis for future use in: reserving, valuation, pricing, asset/liability management, investment income, capital budgeting and valuing contingent cash flows. After finishing this course, students should understand the follows.

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為風管系（所）學碩合開選修課程，邀請政府機關（構）及產業界（不限金融保險業）高階主管就風險管理實務演講，由授課老師帶領討論以期理論與實務結合，並引導同學投身志趣產業工作。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 海上保險因應國際貿易產生，是所有保險的起源，也因此是所有保險的母法，Institute Cargo Clauses是全世界唯一統一的保險條款，也是聯合國貿易與發展會議唯一建立模範條款，在學術上極為重要。國際貿易絕大部分貨物是海運，因運量大運費低使商品較具有競爭力，而海上保險與海上運輸，國際金融一樣於國際貿易中具有關鍵的重要性。海上保險主要承保海上作業的風險，因此海上保險涉及海事法的全部，不對海事法各個領域的規範有週全與深入之瞭解，無法深入瞭解海上保險法與實務。亦因此海上保險是海事法中最有趣最深奧與最困難之部份。猶記得一九八二年負笈現代海事法之起源地 － 英國倫敦進入倫敦大學深造，追隨英國海事法泰斗Professor E. R. Hardy Ivamy深入學習海事法最深奧之處，由倫敦大學歸來至今已三十餘年，我國海商法「海上保險」章二十七個條文，雖然經民國八十八年之修正，但距離國際社會海上保險主流的法律規則與實務仍有相當大的空間可以共同努力予以改善。交通部航港局已推動修正計畫。

Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Risk Management and Insurance
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: A number of important issues relating risk management and insurance will be discussed and analysed. This course will be delivered using a question and answer (Q&A) approach throughout the whole class. Students are required to preview the course materials before attending the class, be ready for answering questions and actively participate in class discussions.

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由每周邀請一位外校的演講者，分享其最近的研究成果，讓同學有機會培養做研究的能力。

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由每周邀請一位外校的演講者，分享其最近的研究成果，讓同學有機會培養做研究的能力。

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 企業國際化已然成為世界經濟發展之重要趨勢，面對全球競爭情勢，國際企業無論是開發國外市場或在他國從事營運，其考量因素與決策程序遠比僅在自己國內經營時，要來得複雜許多。因此，今日之企業必需以全方位和系統化的方式，隨時偵測評估市場變化，藉以掌握國際行銷商機。國際行銷管理涉及各種行銷計畫的決策，負責國際行銷業務之經理人必需擬定策略，針對個別國外市場設計及執行適當的計畫，並協調整合所有的行銷活動，以期達成良好的績效。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: 無
Course Department: none
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 無課程簡介

CourseName: Senior Research Seminar in International Trade andInvestment
Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is divided into two parts. The first part introduces the normative theory of trade. We analyzethe optimal trade policy when the government has different objective functions (maximizing welfare of the society or maximizing the welfare of the  government etc.) and under various market structures. We also consider the strategic interactions of home and foreign governments and examine the economic principle of GATT and WTO. The second part considers some advanced topics of positive trade theory including the decisions of export, foreign direct investment andstructure of multinational firms.

CourseName: Senior Research Seminar in International Finance
Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The aim of the course is that the students develop an understanding of the main implications of increasing integration of the world economy. By describing the various ways that countries are affected by each other -through trade linkages, multinational production, or financial markets- the course will try to explain how these forces affect the decisions of individuals and firms. Topics covered in the course include theories and facts about the gains from globalization, the current account, exchange rate determination, currency crises, Optimum Currency Areas and Monetary Union, and Sovereign Debt and Default . The class will maintain focus to applying this knowledge to real world applications.

CourseName: Advanced Seminar on WTO Law:Trade in Services
Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 服務的產值約占全球國民生產毛額的三分之二，相關投資也幾乎達全球外人直接投資總額的三分之二，以貿易加值為核心的統計，更估計服務貿易占今日全球貿易比重近百分之五十。雖然其重要性與日俱增，但全球服務貿易多邊規範之發展卻一直到1986年烏拉圭回合談判才展開。由於至今不過才30餘年的歷史，相較於貨品貿易，無論是在自由化程度、規則之發展、或爭端案例之累積方面，仍有相當大的進步空間。

CourseName: Advanced Seminar on WTO Law:dispute settlement
Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The dispute settlement system in the WTO has played a crucial role in solving international trade disputes among WTO Members at the multilateral level. This course analyzes how WTO Members use such multilateral dispute settlement system in settling trade disputes based on substantive trade rules agreed upon such as the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) or the General Agreement on Trade in Services (GATS). Instead of examining substantive international trade rules, this course focuses on addressing various aspects of procedural issues in the WTO dispute settlement at different stages of consultation, adjudication and implementation.

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程主在建立碩士班學生獨立研究之能力。學生必須自行尋找研究主題，與授課教師討論，在課堂上報告問題、動機、重要性，可能解決問題的方法以及預期的結果，並在期末撰寫書面報告。

CourseName: Independent Research on International Trade Policy(III)
Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a compulsory course for graduate students of the Department of International Business who have major in the International Trade Law. It has four different course numbers: (I), (II), (III) and (IV). However, it is not required to take them in a sequential order. Nevertheless, for graduate students enrolled after 2009, it is required to take at least three of them before applying for oral defense of their master thesis.

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
We introduce the major financial hedging instruments in the capital market. Options, forward and futures, and swaps
are discussed not only in the valuation process but also in their empirical practices. Students are both trained in the
theoretical modelling and practical applications.

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course provides a forum for discussion of various issues related to international management and strategy. The topics include the following: headquarters-subsidiary relationships, cultural and political environments of multinational firms, international knowledge management, and other international strategy related issues.

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 世界貿易組織 (WTO) 於1995年正式成立運作，乃第二次世界大戰之後，國際經濟體系之一件大事。WTO已有164個會員，涵蓋全球貿易總額98% 以上，因此被視為「國際貿易聯合國」。WTO對國際貿易規則與各國貿易政策，因此帶來巨大深遠之影響。我國及中國大陸在WTO架構下，從2002年起，也得開啟經貿關係新頁。國際貿易向為各國經濟成長之火車頭，台灣又是外貿依存度非常高之國家。WTO對台灣經貿發展，特別重要，得以保護台灣合法經貿權益，並與國際貿易體系融合接軌。台灣已發展為全球前二十大貿易大國。我國得透過WTO，貢獻頗具特色之台灣經驗。所以，WTO對於台灣而言，乃是重返國際舞台之一大機會，相對也是一大挑戰。

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is designed to educate future leaders concerning the international business with a focus on Asia. Through various cases discussion, the course will increase students’ awareness of how multinational enterprises may compete differently because of their unique capabilities. It will also expose students to understand the increasing complex sociopolitical environments in Asia.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 固定收益證券﹕分析與創新
CourseName: Fixed Income Securities: Analytics and Derivatives
Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The aim of this course is to provide you with an introduction to the valuation of fixed income securities and the management of fixed income investment portfolios.

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之前身為開設給國貿系碩士班選修之「金融市場法規」，故屬研究所等級課程，惟大三、四同學想要嘗試研討型課程（Seminar）、且願意花時間獨立研究者，歡迎選修此門課程。國際金融法專題（一）與（二）各自擁有獨立主題，故未修專題（一）者，仍可修習專題（二），不影響學分之承認。

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國際經濟法專題研究（一）
CourseName: Advanced Topics on International Economic Laws (I)
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 國際經濟法（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 排放權交易制度雖然為環境法上的政策工具，但因其影響了國內廠商的競爭力，各國開始思考設計邊境措施的可能性，此外，考慮到的市場的效率，排放權交易制度也開始有連結的設計，以上種種均使得排放權交易制度成為國際經濟法下日益受到關注的議題。故，本專題將以排放權交易制度為主題，以法律層面，包括國際法與國內法、也包括公法與私法切入，對其運作進行詳細的分析與評估。

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 面對競爭激烈與訊息萬變的行銷環境，行銷人員要制訂準確且有效的行銷決策，往往必須要有切中行銷議題的行銷研究結果做為決策依據，因此，無論行銷或行銷研究人員皆必須具備紮實的行銷研究能力。

Course Department: MA Program of International Business, Second Year

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
The course is essentially a survey of econometrics. It will particularly emphasize on econoemtric model of nonlinear flavor. Many nonlinear models have gained increasingly popularity recently. Some basic statistical properties of linear model can also be easily generalized to the nonlinear contexts. Topics to be covered include: analysis of variance and covariance, error component models, discrete choice models, discrete regression, censored and truncated regression models with selectivity, and duration models. In general, these models are found useful in applied mircoeconomic, business and finance literature. Some their applications are also seen in recent macroeconomics literature.
The course will begin with a review of estimation principles and diagnostic testing of various specification failures, mainly OLS and GLS estimation methods and testing procedures based on the estimations, It then moves to a fairly comprehensive treatment of the aforementioned models. To deal with the nonlinearity in models, the principles of maximum likelihood estimation and generalized methods of moments will be studied. Besides, I will go over the topic about the bootstrap, a recent important resampling tools in dealing with small-sample problems. Some basic asymptotic or approximation ideas will be given. Most of the materials that I will present are covered in Wooldridge (2013). You may wish to consult other primary documents listed below whenever necessary.

Course Department: PhD Program of International Business, Second Year

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 會計研究專題：相同會計師對於關係人交易和審計品質的影響
CourseName: Directed Study: The Impact of Related-party Transaction Coun terparties and Disclosures on Audit Quality- auditor style Effect
Course Department: PhD Program of Accounting, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 關係人交易在實務上是常見的企業活動。由於關係人交易的複雜性及難以辨認性，會計師需要仰賴管理當局所提供的關係人與相關交易資訊，使得該項目難以查核(Gordon, Henry, Lauwers, and Reed, 2007)。然而，過去研究顯示，由相同會計師查核兩造雙方之公司，其財報具有較高之可性較性(Francis, Pinnuck, and Watanabe, 2014)，亦併購效率較高(Cai, Kim, Park, and White, 2016)。本研究則欲探討，關係人交易的審計品質是否因兩造雙方為相同會計師查核而改善。

Course Department: Department of Accounting Master's Program in Revenue, Second Year
PhD Program of Accounting, Second Year

Course Department: Department of Accounting Master's Program in Revenue, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 策略管理是企業經營最重要的決策之一。會計需與策略配合，然而實際的情境有很多變化，導致大部份學生在面臨真實的策略與會計決策時，不知如何處理。如何運用理論在實際情境下做策略性決策，是學生學習的重點。本課程主要目的在於藉由個案分析，使學生能面對各類策略與會計結合的問題，培養出思考問題，解決問題的能力。

Course Department: Department of Accounting Master's Program in Revenue, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要在讓商學院之學生能了解成本管理理論與實務如何結合及運用，透過理論與實務經驗分享，協助學生了解如何發掘自己的特質及人生未來發展方向，以便在學時能夠盡早儲備各方知識及能力，日積月累下，假以時日能成為優秀的全方位專業經營管理人才，為所屬組織開闢新局面，創造更高績效。

Course Department: Department of Accounting Master's Program in Revenue, Second Year

Course Department: Department of Accounting Master's Program in Revenue, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 政府係任何國家組成要素之一，亦為任一國家最大的組織體，由於其組織體規模太大，可能因與人人有關而演變成人人不關心之窘境，致造成政府管理績效長期不如一般企業，因此當某一政府欲提高施政績效時，經常提出企業文化之理念。可見企業管理理念，係提高政府施政績效之良方，而會計又是企業管理最具關鍵性工具，故政府會計應為現階段提高施政績效最重要工具之一。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 策略成本管理－個案實作
Course Department: Department of Accounting Master's Program in Revenue, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 吳安妮講座教授將30年之管理會計研究成果整合為「整合性策略價值管理系統」，於2012年及2015年取得臺灣及大陸與美國之商標權。本系統包含五大子系統，分別為1.策略形成系統、2.策略執行系統、3.作業管理系統、4.作業價值管理及5.策略價值創造系統。本課程主要以1.策略形成系統--SWOT計分卡（SWOT Scorecard）及2.策略執行系統--平衡計分卡（Balanced Scorecard, BSC）之個案實務操作方向及內容，讓學生了解學理的基本知識與個案實際操作之能力。

Transactions, in a broad sense, include investment, IPOs, mergers and acquisitions, licensing, technology transfer, etc. For any rational person in the business arena with duty of care to manage and create value, the value that she/he wishes to manage and create would be carefully calculated in order to make sound informed decisions and to take prudent profitable actions.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「經營策略理論研討」(Seminar in Theory of Strategic Management)係為企管、科智所博士班學生所設計的策略理論研討課程。重點在於採用「策略九說」分類架構，有系統地研讀經典論文，並探討在新經濟時代(後資本主義)下的經營策略與管理相關新議題。本課程特別專注於近年因為全球化與數位科技所衍生的經營策略新議題，例如地球是平的、社會創新、公私協力、巨量資料、分享經濟與網路社群等世界趨勢與科技進展所帶來的組織策略或跨界管理挑戰。藉由有系統地閱讀最新策略文獻與觀察產業管理實務，本課程期待同學能歸納出現代經營管理的策略本質，並善用理論來解釋不同的真實案例。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 研究方法(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to lay the foundations of good research in the MIS field. It does not deal with specific techniques per se, but rather with the assumptions and the logic underlying MIS research. Students become acquainted with a variety of approaches to research design, and are helped to develop their own research projects and to evaluate the products of MIS research.

CourseName: Seminar in Information Systems and Technology
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 資料模式(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course will be taught through a combination of lectures, group discussion, and assigned paper presentations & discussion, and group IS Design Research projects and reports. The roles of students include: (1) Read assigned readings and describe the issues, perceptions, and possible courses of actions. (2) Actively participate in the discussion. (3) Review literature relevant to the readings and the projects. (4) Continually conduct the group case study projects and evaluate their business values from IT and reflect on what is learned and what needs to be learned. (5) Work collaboratively with peers. (6) Well engage generative activities as the written & oral presentations on the group projects.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 決策科學(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程內容包括數量方法基礎知識、進階技術及應用課題、個案及論文研討等

Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course objectives are offering tech-oriented students solid training on the ability to investigate and adopt modern technologies. This year, we will target on artificial intelligence and block chain and smart contracts with middle-size system development. Students are expected to have in-hand system develpoment and in-depth discussions on issues regarding the practice of artificial Neural Networks on the infrastructure of Tensorflow and GPU, as well as smart contract develpoment and deployment with Etherum and Hyperledger. Some security issues and verifciation techniques of smart contracts will also be discussed.

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course serves as an important triggering class for the student in Ph.D. Program of Management Information Systems. In this course, we focus on the data analysis related topics and student should get familiar with tools, algorithms, concepts, and the execution environment to perform data analysis. In addition, we add one more important research field and application – security – in this course. Students need to learn to be an architect to solve a security-related problem by using data analysis algorithm. Related security and data analysis theories, research papers and background knowledge will be instructed in the class. We will introduce several security systems that actually implement data analysis algorithms to achieve their security goals.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 資訊管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 策略資訊管理已成為企業增加執行力與洞察力最迫切需要注重的領域，是企業機會與不確定性，優勢與風險的一個來源。儘管資訊管理問題有著令人煩惱的時刻，策略資訊應用卻早已經納入了企業制訂與執行策略、組織與領導企業、和提供獨特價值的方式中。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 系統分析與設計(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: As enterprises are in a highly competitive environment nowadays, their process models have to be well managed in order to align with their strategies. Thus, this course tends to introduce a series of topics including Value Creation Models, Platform Innovation, Process Innovation, Strategic Alignment, Process Redesign, and Service Quality through several real-world case discussions and group projects.

Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course objectives are the in-depth discussions on modern machine learning techniques and their applications. Particularly, we will study learning techniques on generative adversarial networks (GANs). GANs are a class of artificial intelligence algorithms used in unsupervised machine learning, implemented by a system of two neural networks contesting with each other in a zero-sum game framework. One network generates candidates and the other evaluates them. Generative models are one of the most promising approaches towards the goal to endorse computers to understand the world.

Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 如何善用機器學習(Machine Learning)、深度學習(Deep Learning)處理大數據進行分析，成為企業競爭力不可或缺的一環。而機器學習與深度學習可透過TensorFlow 技術有效時限。本課程著重大樹據、機器學習以及TensorFlow的探討，並透過案例研究培養相關的技巧。

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 金融科技興起，已成為當今經濟發展不可檔之趨勢，其中不只是資通科技及其應用，監理科技和以區塊鏈為基礎之信任機器業已成為極為重要之課題。本課程首先將探討金融科技之起源與定義，進而闡述金融科技之發展策略與典範移轉，其後將介紹歐美、中國之個案。在課程之第二部分，課程將探討金融監理科技之發展，然後介紹區塊鏈及其於信任機器和智慧合約之應用。學期中亦將進行三次專題演講，由專家介紹金融科技與、金融監理和信任機器之實務發展。

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides perspective and research topics in the challenging and complex world of Information technology management. Major themes will include but not be limited to: Collective Intelligence, Fintech, Data Mining, Text Mining, Web Mining, and Informatrics.

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This class – Enterprise Innovation Platform (2) is a continued class of Enterprise Innovation Platform (1). Rather than discussing a number of basic models and framework of innovation platforms, this semester will look into some famous cases in depth. Also, some field studies on real-world companies will be carried out in order to bring students practical experiences of learning how innovative enterprises are striving towards success in the competitive environment. Moreover, the invited speeches will discuss the critical success factors of how traditional businesses are transforming themselves into innovative players with the aid of innovation platforms.

Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This class presents the experiences of information technology revolution on media and marketing. As telecommunications-based new media technologies and e-marketing applications develop rapidly and unevenly in the world, government and industry policy has become a priority among government leaders and academic researchers.
It is technically possible to connect everyone to everyone else by wireless means. But would this necessarily be a good democratic society or even a pleasant place to live in? The same technology that can provide surveillance for national security, law enforcement and accountability can also be used for social and political control and the targeting of unpopular groups and individuals. The same technology that can bring instant and cheap communication can also bring pornography and hate speech.
Access to lifelong learning opportunities and government services can also be used to unduly influence and persuade non-critical, naive users by spying on their preferences, habits, life-styles and practices, or to divert and distract citizens away from empowering themselves via self-governing, civic, participatory democratic activity.
Despite the technological commonality, the social implications of communication technologies are quite different among nations, states, regions. Once a media culture takes shape in a society, it becomes a de facto standard for users.
Digital marketing has changed the way we live our daily lives, and fundamentally altered the 21st century marketing and advertising landscape. Mobile usage is pervasive in marketing, growing substantially, and presents an enormous opportunity for savvy marketers who design and execute smart mobile marketing strategies. This class will investigate some philosophical and practical models to help understand the essences of digital media and e-marketing.

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 服務業佔台灣GDP的比重接近七成，即使是製造業，大部分以代工為主的也是服務化的製造業，服務業可以說是台灣經濟的命脈，資訊科技更是服務業升級中重要的元素。服務業的競爭需要對顧客需求及服務流程有很深入的了解，同時需要有系統地進行改善及創新，維持良好的競爭力。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 供應鏈管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a graduate course to Collaborative Commerce Systems. The topics covered include the state of the art and future research directions on Collaborative Commerce Systems.

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces the students to the top research writing in the related literature. It exploits English writing skills to guide the students through the composition of a publishable paper, and walks through the revision process with students to complete a paper acceptable to international journals. Prerequisite: Ph.D. student standing. The students are required to have the first draft of a research paper in English approved by the instructor before signing up for this course.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 供應鏈管理(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is an advanced graduate course to Supply Chain Management. The subjects covered include the state of the art and future research directions on Supply Chain Management.

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: It is a FinTech-related course with an emphasis on the aspects of blockchain and smart contract theory, operation and implementation issues for the next generation of FinTech leaders with proven deep technical and managerial skills, experience, and credibility to design, engineer, implement, and manage their overall blockchain program and smart contract, and explore the possibility of applying blockchain and smart contract in new and innovative applications. This course will also discuss the certain concept of IoT (Internet of Things) to enrich the application of smart contract, as well as the modern Cloud-based computation model, such as virtual machine and Docker container. It is designed for senior students who wish to work in positions such as FinTech Consultant, Blockchain Engineer, IT Director/Manager, FinTech Architect, FinTech Analyst, and Chief Information Officer. The design of this course is to bridge the gap between academic theory and industrial practice. The student will learn why and how blockchain and smart contract are designed, what is the limitation of blockchain and smart contract, how to apply blockchain and smart contract in the real-world application, how FinTech affects our finance operation and innovation, and the security issues related to blockchain and smart contract.

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The aim is to establish an understanding of the role of service operating strategy (including service operation, service delivery, service quality, service innovation, service technology, etc.) to the success of modern businesses/organizations in a variety of industries, and how to achieve it.

Course Department: MA Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course serves as an important triggering class for the student in Ph.D. Program of Management Information Systems. In this course, we focus on the data analysis related topics and student should get familiar with tools, algorithms, concepts, and the execution environment to perform data analysis. In addition, we add one more important research field and application – security – in this course. Students need to learn to be an architect to solve a security-related problem by using data analysis algorithm. Related security and data analysis theories, research papers and background knowledge will be instructed in the class. We will introduce several security systems that actually implement data analysis algorithms to achieve their security goals.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 行動商務與大數據管理
CourseName: Mobile Commerce and Big Data Management
Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The mobile commerce coverage will help students learn about the systems and consumer behaviors that combine to make up the ecosystem, market player, and consumer behaviors to learn how mwebistes, mwallet, mpayment, mcoupon, and mvoucher operate through different sectors including retail, transport, and consumer banking. Students will recognize a range of emergent trends and relevant laws and guidelines, including privacy and data protection. This course will provide a balanced view of theory and practice, which should allow the student to use and build practical big data analytics and management systems. Because of big data, managers can know more about their businesses, and directly translate that knowledge into improved decision making and performance. As the tools and philosophies of big data spread, they will change long-standing ideas about the value of experience, the nature of expertise, and the practice of management. At the end of the course, students should be able to answer the following questions:

Course Department: PhD Program of Management Information Systems, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course would incubate students with the ability of data mining and big data analytics to solve business problems using SAS and R/Python. The course also explores the recent literature and related research issues. The course primarily focuses on financial data analysis currently used by institutional traders or VIP investors, using SYSTEX database or the similar, in order to investigate the potential of big data analytics in practical financial application. However, students can choose the application areas based on their interests.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will cover the literature of international financial management with emphasis on the exchange rate parity conditions, determinants of corporate hedging and cross-listing decisions, and topics of international syndicated loan markets. Course supplements include cases and papers of related topics.

Course Department: PhD Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The objective of this course is to develop the basic microeconomic models for risk and insurance with setting that economic agents are faced with uncertainty. The main topics include decision making under uncertainty, insurance demand, adverse selection, moral hazard, and insurance company operations. The models and cases discussed in this course are adaptable to many situations in finance and economics, but with a emphasis on insurance markets as means of transferring risk and wealth.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 保險法(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: MA Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 保險為風險管理的方法之一，屬遭逢意外事故可獲得的保障。由於保險具有相當之專業性，不論為財產保險或人身保險，均屬提供被保險人或受益人財務安全與心意安寧的服務。本課程之目標，期使同學對於保險法內涵有通盤瞭解，除能在相關的考試能有順暢之作答外，進而能將相關知識應用於日常生活中。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to help student to understand the basic concepts of insurance accounting system and financial reporting requirements in the insurance companies.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為本系大三必修課程，課程主要介紹社會保險之基本概念，內容將涵蓋台灣現行各類型社會保險制度(例如勞工保險、公務人員保險、國民年金保險與全民健康保險等)的基本介紹，並就相關給付進行說明，同時也將就目前台灣社會保險制度所面臨之問題進行討論與分析。

Course Department: PhD Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
Aims: Gain a through understanding of the followings:
1.basic pricing of actuarial mathematics
2.the application of the dynamic mortality model
3.the application of Levy process in actuarial science
4.the application of the longevity risk.
5.modeling and reserving the guarantee liabilities (GMAB, GMDB, GMWB,… ).
6.static and dynamic hedging
7.the properties of the Markowitz portfolio selection model.
8.evaluate the risk and return characteristics of guaranteed investment
9.apply the concept of Multivariate Jump Diffusion Models to asset allocation
10.    Identify and apply portfolio management techniques to the ongoing investment management of financial institution and pension fund assets
11.    apply approximation method to the topic of asset allocation,..,etc.
12.    modeling the mortality model.

Course Department: PhD Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year

Specifically, we will cover corporate finance and risk management and insurance literature and then show how the literature is applies into risk management and insurance research.

Course Department: PhD Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 針對資本、投資與避險理論作深入討論,同時包括金融保險機構清償能力及資產 負債分析,著重風險分散與風險理財機制 (諸如銀行、證券與保險風險控管機制建立、風險證券化 、另類風險移轉 ART 分析等)，利用個案針對融資投資與風險管理深入討論及實務個案研討。

Course Department: MA Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 海上保險因應國際貿易產生，是所有保險的起源，也因此是所有保險的母法，Institute Cargo Clauses是全世界唯一統一的保險條款，也是聯合國貿易與發展會議唯一建立模範條款，在學術上極為重要。國際貿易絕大部分貨物是海運，因運量大運費低使商品較具有競爭力，而海上保險與海上運輸，國際金融一樣於國際貿易中具有關鍵的重要性。海上保險主要承保海上作業的風險，因此海上保險涉及海事法的全部，不對海事法各個領域的規範有週全與深入之瞭解，無法深入瞭解海上保險法與實務。亦因此海上保險是海事法中最有趣最深奧與最困難之部份。猶記得一九八二年負笈現代海事法之起源地 － 英國倫敦進入倫敦大學深造，追隨英國海事法泰斗Professor E. R. Hardy Ivamy深入學習海事法最深奧之處，由倫敦大學歸來至今已三十餘年，我國海商法「海上保險」章二十七個條文，雖然經民國八十八年之修正，但距離國際社會海上保險主流的法律規則與實務仍有相當大的空間可以共同努力予以改善。交通部航港局已推動修正計畫。

Course Department: MA Program of Risk Management and Insurance, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 為因應保險科技發展趨勢，以及未來保險業因應新環境挑戰之人才需求，特開設本課程。本課程主要是希望透過專案實作方式，培養學生了解保險科技的應用與實作能力，希望能養成具有實作能力與應用能力的保險科技專業人才。

CourseName: Introduction of Blockchain and Python Programming

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course covers the concepts in bitcoin blockchain. The concepts include distributed systems, cryptography, P2P networks, blockchain, bitcoin clients, wallets, proof of work, consensus algorithms, alt coins and related data structure. This course also introduces Python programming in numerical computation. The students should have great interests in Fintech, cryptocurrency and have solid background in mathematics.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 策略資訊管理已成為企業增加執行力與洞察力最迫切需要注重的領域，是企業機會與不確定性，優勢與風險的一個來源。儘管資訊管理問題有著令人煩惱的時刻，策略資訊管理卻早已經納入了企業制訂與執行策略、組織與領導企業、和提供獨特價值的方式中。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 策略資訊管理已成為企業增加執行力與洞察力最迫切需要注重的領域，是企業機會與不確定性，優勢與風險的一個來源。儘管資訊管理問題有著令人煩惱的時刻，策略資訊管理卻早已經納入了企業制訂與執行策略、組織與領導企業、和提供獨特價值的方式中。

Course Department: MBA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程分為兩大部分，第一部分為中國大陸投資法律，第二部分為台灣公司證券法律。
第一部分：台灣公司證券法律
公司作為資源聚合與專業分工的載體，推進著人類社會的發展。與此同時，科技的發展、人類社會結構的變化，也重新塑造公司法制的面貌。21世紀以降，許多國家紛紛革新公司法制，鄰近如新加坡與香港，亦分別在2012年與2014年翻新公司法。我國公司法上次大幅修正於2001年，距今已有15年時間，公司法制早已被各界，包括外國投資人評價為不合時宜，成為我國產業發展與社會進步的絆腳石。為因應各界期盼，去(104)年增訂閉鎖性股份有限公司專章，大幅鬆綁現行公司法，然效果仍屬有限。今年，由產官學組成的修法委員會進行的公司法全盤修正建議，將翻轉我國公司法以大型製造業為規範基礎的公司法制，並以彈性鬆綁與公開透明作為公司法修正的兩大主軸，以期重新塑造我國企業遵法守法的文化，達到使市場參與者利用而非濫用公司制度之目的。
本課程將透過時事案件與法院判決分析，使學員瞭解我國公司證券法制的運作規則，同時點出現行制度的問題所在，並解析各國立法趨勢與我國未來法制革新的方向。

第二部分：中國大陸投資法律環境
自1991年以來，中國大陸已是我國對外投資投向地累積第一名，且所佔比例高達78％的絕對比例；中國投資也幾乎是我國不同產業的全民運動，中國大陸同時也是我國最大貿易順差的來源國。同時中國大陸也是各國投資之所在，長期以來為吸引外來投資僅次美國的第二名。是以，對於中國大陸的投資環境與實務運作的系統性觀察與檢視，成為我國相關企業與高階經營決策經理人所不可或缺之所在。
對於一個國家法律制度的評價與研究，其重要之起因在於『使用』。台灣已成為最頻繁使用中國法制的國家之一。一個企業經營者或經理人不能不對這一法律系有依基本的瞭解。
另外，中國大陸不再僅是受資國而已，2014年之後也已經成為資金的淨輸出國家，且金額總量僅次於美國，其投資的區域選擇以及對於產業別的投資佈局，對於我國產業發展的具體影響評估。
加諸外國投資者法即將立法頒布施行，其將對現有外資三法的全新替代，台商經營決策者如何因應與調整。同時，我們一併以台灣證券業、銀行業在中國對外開放的條件下，其機會與挑戰的掌握。
本課程將以最庶民的語言，解析中國大陸最複雜的投資法律問題，讓專業經營管理人理解如何作出投資中國大陸的決策判斷依據。同時經由不同的類型案例為檢視，得出投資中國大陸的佈局和總體投資環境的理解。

Course Department: MBA Program, Second Year

Course Department: MBA Program, Second Year
Prerequisite: [ Organization Theory and Management]  AND  [ Marketing]  AND  [ Human Resources]  AND  [ Managing Operations]  AND  [ Finanzmanagement]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Strategic management is that set of managerial decisions and actions that determines the long-run performance of a corporation. It includes environmental scanning (both external and internal), strategy formulation (Strategic or long-range planning), strategy implementation, and evaluation and control. The study of strategic management, therefore, emphasizes the monitoring and evaluating of external opportunities and threats in light of a corporation’s strengths and weaknesses. Originally called business policy, strategic management incorporates such topics as long-range planning and strategy. Business policy, in contrast, has a general management orientation and tends primarily to look inward with its concern for properly integrating the corporation’s many functional activities. Strategic management incorporates the integrative concerns of business policy with a heavier environmental and strategic emphasis. Thus, strategic management has tended to replace business policy as the preferred name of the field in recent years.

Course Department: MBA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 新興科技與行動商務興起，改變了產業的互動關係，創造了全新的經營模式。這些商業模式並非植基於傳統的線性鏈結，而採雙邊或多邊的市場，串連多方需求，創造借力使力的價值，並形成強而有力的生態圈。而其背後的管理邏輯及策略思考，更迥異於傳統的企業經營理論。如何從傳統策略管理邏輯出發，並擁抱全新的平台策略，建構新的經營模式，成為未來企業經營最大的挑戰。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 平台策略與創新實作專題
CourseName: Special Issues on the Platform Strategy and Innovation
Course Department: MBA Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 隨著平台經濟的興起，愈來愈多的企業，開始改變經營的型態，並利用新興科技，邁向平台經營。本門課為「平台策略與創新實踐」課程的延續，主要為訓練學生能將課程所學之知識，運用在企業經營中，尤其是協助企業建立平台經營模式。故本門課要求修課者，必須要已修習或正在修習「平台策略與創新實踐」的課程。本門課程與國泰世華合作，修習者除了參與五次業師演講外，並必須參與業師所指定的專題，在授課老師的指導下，完成專題。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在如今瞬息萬變的全球經濟情勢以及日益激烈的企業競爭態勢的大環境下,公司高層經理人必須面對具 有高度不確定性的資本投資與融資決策。本課程之主要目標在幫助學生運用財務管理的觀念做成公 司財務決策分析與規劃,希望以課堂討論及「個案教學」方式達到學生深入將學理知識與實務運用 結合一體,以達到學以致用的效果。 主題涵蓋公司治理、資金成本、資本預算、企業評價、資本結構、企業融資等。同學在修此們課之 前,需要擁有財務管理的基本知識。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 科技管理與智慧財產理論研討（二）
CourseName: Seminar in Theory of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management (II)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 博士生為本所之重要資產，在博士生與本所教師的研究夥伴關係之下，本所積極提供博士生於學術專業的培育。在本所「書中學、做中學、遊中學」的中心理念下，鼓勵師生間的學術與生活交流及博士生的自我探索與同儕互助。此外，藉由邀請所外研究優良學者與本所師生分享與討論，拓展博士生的學術視野。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 科技管理與智慧財產理論研討（四）
CourseName: Seminar in Theory of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management (IV)
Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這是全所的學術研討課，所有老師與學生每月一次聚在一起用餐並討論學術議題。
是為科管智財同學們所設計的基礎課程。
智慧財產權作為當代社會鼓勵人類創新之重要法律工具，重要性已不言而喻。然而，以醫藥品之研發成果為例，其具有攸關生命尊嚴之獨特社會意涵，常具備公共衛生層面等迥異於其他產業或產品之政策考量。本課程將以簡易經濟理論為主，說明智慧財產權制度之設計理念；並以我國及美國之智慧財產權法之入門引導為輔，協助同學理解重要法院判決或立法歷程辯論背後所隱藏之真實意義，並將特別著重於與跨領域（如商管知識）之印證與對話。

CourseName: Seminar in Theory of Strategic Management (I)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「經營策略理論研討」專注於經典文獻的掌握並積極面向未來新世界的策略新思維。藉由精典文章評析、專書閱讀、實務案例解析與師生與同儕間的討論、共學與思辦，形成一個開放式學習社群。藉由集體智慧整理並歸納出「新策略九說」的知識系統。本課程進行過程中將涵蓋環境、科技、經濟、人文、社群、組織等不同層次取向的策略學理討論、案例討論與專題報告。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 科技創新與智慧財產專題（二）
CourseName: Special Topic in Technology Innovation and Intellectual Property Management (II)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要目的在於結合產業實務與學術理論，實踐科技管理與智慧財產研究所(本所)做 中學、書中學、遊中學之精神。本課程為一學年，上下兩學期之連貫課程，引進崇智協會校友資源，結合「產業平台」之七大產業：資通軟硬、 網路、創業、數位文創、生技製藥、智財法律及傳統產業，架構跨產業多元的學習。本課程邀請目前任職於各產業之校友擔任業師，與授課教師共同帶領學生自主規劃學習計畫與課程內容。課程內容將由教師、校友業師、學生三方共同設計，授課方式多元，包含講座、參訪、論壇、行動等學習。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 思考脈絡－創新採納與擴散
CourseName: Thinking in Context: Innovation Adoption and Diffusion
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 為什麼有些產品推出就一炮而紅，有些卻乏人問津？為什麼一項政策推出就抗爭四起，有的政策卻富國利民？本課程將以一系列案例介紹創新的設計、採納、擴散與轉移。創新其實來自「創舊」，成功的關鍵因素是讓思考有脈絡。本課程帶領學員理解如何成為「企業裡的人類學家」。透過一系列實況案例，本課程帶領學員重返現場，抽絲剝繭、找出脈絡。別讓創新成為遺憾的解決方案。當我們學會思考脈絡，就能夠以大局觀來看待問題，設計出令人感動的創新。

本課程目的在學習——
·覺察Sensing：事業創新機遇
·掌握Seizing：産品／服務創新能耐與資源佈局
·轉型Transforming：事業動態能耐

CourseName: PhD Seminar in Quantitative Research Methods

Statistics are not our focus, though we encourage you to get a solid understanding of statistics so as to advance your learning effectiveness. Your learning outcomes also can be largely increased if you can connect your own domain knowledge / theories / experiences with appropriate research methods that we discuss in the class. Equally, we believe that it’s our collective efforts making the class successful. Therefore, active dialogues (asking and responding) and engagements are highly appreciated as well.

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 於商學院產業組博士班院必修課程最後一個階段，學習者已有前四學期的先備知識，本課程預期在此基礎之上，將協助學習者熟稔撰寫研究論文的流程與論文組成要件。並透過實際論文撰寫演練產出研究成果。課程將由學習者各自尋找研究主題的指導老師，藉由與指導老師的研討互動與獨立搜尋文獻及研究方法，系統性的發展研究成果，並於研究發表營發表。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, First Year

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 如附件

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 智慧財產權與競爭法的衝突與調和
CourseName: The Conflict Between Intellectual Property Rights and Competition Law and Its Reconciliation
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 競爭法中的反托拉斯法（卡特爾法）與智慧財產權法以往被認為是二個對立的法律，因為後者的各種排他權利被解釋成對競爭的限制。但是此種對立說忽略了二者的共同目的與互補性質，因此自上一世紀七○年代開始被先進國家所揚棄。取而代之的見解是，二者各以其方式與功能形成並維護競爭：智慧財產權是構成競爭得以開展之私有財產權的一種，反托拉斯法則是規範此種財產被投入於競爭後的事項，二者共同協助競爭發揮其經濟功能（例如促進技術進步）以及社會功能（例如節制私人力量）。儘管在目標上相輔相成，但是並不表示二者之間沒有存在著某種緊張關係，畢竟反托拉斯法在於維持市場開放，避免被獨占或壟斷，而智慧財產權法卻是以授予獨占性排他權利的方式，激勵人們從事發明或創作。尤其在知識經濟時代，智慧財產權經常被事業當成競爭的策略手段，此在我國產業與國外大型智慧財產權集團既競爭又合作的關係上顯露無遺。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 詳附件

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 國際智慧財產權法專題研究（二）
CourseName: Seminar on International Intellectual Property Law (II)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course examines intellectual property (IP) law and policy in the international arena by addressing the core international agreements governing intellectual property, such as the Paris Convention, and the Berne Convention; and the TRIPS Agreement (Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights). We will focus on the legal and economic implications of the international intellectual property standards in the light of prior Conventions, with particular regard to such topics as copyrights, patents, trademark, and trade secrets.

CourseName: The Platform Strategy and Innovation Practices
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 新興科技與行動商務興起，改變了產業的互動關係，創造了全新的經營模式。這些商業模式並非植基於傳統的線性鏈結，而採雙邊或多邊的市場，串連多方需求，創造借力使力的價值，並形成強而有力的生態圈。而其背後的管理邏輯及策略思考，更迥異於傳統的企業經營理論。如何從傳統策略管理邏輯出發，並擁抱全新的平台策略，建構新的經營模式，成為未來企業經營最大的挑戰。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 文化產業與智慧財產權專題實作（二）
CourseName: Practice of Cultural Industry and Intellectual Property (II)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程為「文化產業與智慧財產權」的延伸課程。透過和內容產業的合作，讓學生執行與智財權有關的專案，以從業師身上學習實務知識。
This course is an extension of “Cultural Industry and Intellectual Property.” Industrial experts will join the course to assign a project to each participating student. The project will be related to intellectual property. During the execution of the project, the student will learn practical knowledge from the expert.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 組織與領導專題實作（二）
CourseName: Management Practice of Organization and Leadership (II)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 科技與創新管理為企業在動態市場上強化其競爭力的重要手段之一。本課程探討如何以策略性創新與科技管理來創造企業核心競爭力以營造競爭優勢，並從產品發展週期之觀點來審視如何實施科技與智慧財產管理。希望藉由本課程的修習，擴大學員對科技創新活動與管理功能的認識，進一步整合知識，提高科技與創新管理的能力，以創造企業經營的競爭優勢。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 詳附件

本課程主要探討有關科技創新與新產品創新之前階段相關的「市場/技術」預測。原則上，不論是創新或是創業的過程;或擔任PM（產品經理）或Sales/Marketing職務時，大致上都需要先做好「市場」（大小）或「科技」（趨勢）方面的預測。本課程的目的，即希望針對此一重要課題加以深入的探討。本課程中所討論的預測標的，原則上比較偏向「創新」方面的預測，與一般企管比較偏向近穩定(不確定性較低)狀態下的市場調查/預測有所不同。此外，本課程在內容上強調「預測方法」的探討。
服務業已經佔有GDP及所有經濟活動的70%以上。本課程特別針對服務業來探討服務創新的發展與相關的管理（過往有關創新方面的討論，大都偏向以製造業為主要標地。）本課程在內涵上強調理論與實務並重，除了學理與Papers的討論之外，本課程亦強調實際案例的討論，希望讓同學透過實際案例與學理的探討，對此一重要課題有更進一步的瞭解。

The course is to introduce the issues related to the commercialization of Intellectual Property (IP) in Taiwan and other countries, including different models of IP management and commercialization strategy.

CourseName: Legal Research Methodology for Intellectual Property Law
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to teach students how to use the Westlaw database efficiently. The framework of the Westlaw database is based on the legal research methodology for American law. So, the basic knowledge of the American legal research methodology will be introduced. Then, a research project related to IP laws will be assigned to each student. Students will polish their research skills by doing.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 文化產業與智慧財產權
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程所定義的文化產業包括音樂產業、電視產業、電影產業、劇場產業和其他表演藝術有關的產業。這些產業區塊都存在相關的智慧財產權議題，例如所有權、權利轉讓、合理使用、侵權行為、契約爭議等等。本課程從產業特性觀點來理解相關的智財法律議題。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 著作權法律與管理專題（一）
CourseName: Seminar on Copyright : Law and Management (I)
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Copyright law is the essential legislation concerning Technology, cultural and entertainment industries. With the fast development of the Internet and digital technology, the use of digital materials have created a torrent of disputes and challenges from all ways of life. Moreover, since the Supreme Court decision in Alice v. CLS Bank (2014), the practice of the software patent has been fundamentally changed. A trend to revert to copyright law protection is emerging. Such new development and the various legal challenges facing the ever digitized world are all related to copyright and the deployment of appropriate management skills for companies relating to all relevant fields.
本課程是設計給智科所專用，上課時間自7-5到8-30 兩學分課程，為配合規定課程要求，總計應上12次，因此除每週三外，應另行補課三次。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 熊彼得（Joseph Schumpeter）對創新曾做出如下的定義：「Innovation is “new combination” of existing resources.」，既有的資源中最重要的就是人類過去所累積的技術知識，而專利資料庫就是全面又豐富的公開知識庫。因此，本課程將鼓勵學生從生活中實際的產品/服務使用經驗中，發現待滿足的需求及期望中的願景；接著從專利資料庫中搜尋相關的創意，重新組合成創新的提案；然後分析產業的供需現況，提出事業經營模式來落實創新的願景，經過需求的驗證與網路廣告的實習之後，將完成的創新個案提出來報告與研討。課程將分為以下五個段落：

「社會企業」(social enterprise)指的是一個用商業模式來解決某一個社會或環境問題的組織，例如提供具社會責任或促進環境保護的產品／服務、為弱勢社群創造就業機會、採購弱勢或邊緣族群提供的產品／服務等。其組織可以以營利公司或非營利組織之型態存在，並且有營收與盈餘。其盈餘主要用來投資社會企業本身、繼續解決該社會或環境問題，而非為出資人或所有者謀取最大的利益。「社會創新」(social innovation)則是針對社會需求所提的新穎想法、觀念、策略，甚至是其所衍生的組織與制度，例如：衛生健康、教育學習、社區發展、工作環境…等(維基百科)。具體而言，社會創新是一種以滿足社會各式需求為目的的創造性行動。
本課程為科管智財所選修課程，並有條件接受跨所選修，共計三學分，以碩士班學生為主設計的課程。修課學生必須具有下列條件之一：(1) 曾修習過「文化創意產業與服務創新」課程；(2) 有藝術文化機構工作經驗（含實習、志工），並能提出證明者。此外，修習本課程的學生需在課程期間定期地參與藝術活動。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 專題討論－生物科技管理個案
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 主要討論內容包括：從Drug Discovery Today, Nature Biotechnology, JAMA Intern Med., N. Engl. J. Med., Nature Reviews Drug Discovery,..等的期刊中，所挑選出與最新科技、智慧財產權及相關判例、生技製藥產業經營管理、生技製藥創新創業、產學合作等議題相關的文章。

不懂科技如何創新？所有生意模式的創新都來自於科技：因為有NFC才會有ApplePay；因為有人工智慧(Artificial Intelligence, AI)才會有自動駕駛車；iBeacon/Eddystone即將發展出全新的行銷與廣告模式；金融科技(Fintech)即將取代人類讓全球170萬金融服務人員失業(花旗銀行2016/03研究報告)；Tesla電動車、gogoro電動機車、Toyota燃料電池車即將成為我們代步的交通工具，面對這些新興科技席捲而來，我們的文法商學院卻缺少這方面的教學內容，對國家整體的產業競爭力是很大的阻礙。
廿一世紀「知識經濟」的興起，成為引導未來經濟發展的主要力量，不但改變了傳統產業的交易模式，也造成了產業結構的變化，由於科技產業有很大的就業市場，而且不論證券業、金融業、科技管理及科技法律等都與科技產業息息相關，但非理工背景的同學往往很難了解各種科技產品的科學原理及製作過程，甚至被許多專業術語所困擾，因此在做市場投資與分析時常對科技產品一知半解，間接減少了非理工背景同學們在未來就業市場上的發揮空間。

Course Department: Graduate Institute of Technology, Innovation & Intellectual Property Management PhD Program, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 管理學雖然在國內外已經被認定為一個學門（有自己的學會及期刊），但是其學術研究通常被認定是應用性研究，也就是說是從其他基礎學門（經濟學，心理學，社會學）擷取理論以應用在相關的管理議題。以策略管理學為例，目前主流的理論有三：分別是Portor(1980)的產業競爭分析（Industrial Competition Analysis, ICA）， Williamson(1975)的交易成本經濟理論（Transaction Cost Economics, TCE）， Wernerfelt (1984)的資源基礎觀點(Resource-based View, RBV)。如果我們追本溯源，Portor的產業競爭分析事實上是來自Bain的產業經濟學(Industrial Organization, or Industrial Economics), Williamson的交易成本經濟理論是來自法律經濟學家Coase (1937)的廠商理論，而Wernerfelt的資源基礎觀點則是基於經濟學家Penrose(1959)的廠商成長理論。在策略管理早期發展的階段，相關理論確實是借用自其他已經發展成熟的學門。

Course Department: College of Communication Specialized Subjects for Freshman and Sophomore Majors
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will lead the students into investigating the various aspects of consumer behavior through an inter-discipline perspective. Related theories form economics, psychology, sociology, anthropology, and communication are used to scrutinize and discuss the processes of consumer behavior and orientations. Consumer behavior cases are discussed so as to illustrate the related theories. The course will be taught through lectures, in-class group discussions, case study, group projects of observational study and presentations, and so on.

Course Department: College of Communication Specialized Subjects for Freshman and Sophomore Majors
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to help students understand and use appropriate statistical tools to conduct, interpret and report results for their research. It will introduce students to the underlying logics of the common test statistics used in communication research and familiarize them with the statistical package, SPSS. The course will be rooted in practice and interpretation of real data sets and examples from research published in communication journals.

Course Department: College of Communication Specialized Subjects for Freshman and Sophomore Majors
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This graduate seminar class will introduce students a range of fundamental issues about new media convergence by examining the impact of SoLoMo technologies on fast-changing media landscape. Students will learn how to use analytical lenses to understand new media convergence phenomenon at individual, organizational, and industry levels. Next, it will examine how various converging technologies such as big data and artificial intelligence affect electronic media, Internet, and mobile industries. The socio-political, economic, and cultural issues involved in media transformation and diffusion of emerging information communication technologies will be investigated. During this semester, the instructor has collaborated with University of San Francisco to have three talks regarding social media and intercultural communication offered by experts from Facebook, YouTube, etc.. (City University of Hong Kong and Baptist University, Hong Kong are collaborated partners.) Singapore’s experts will also share their new media research experiences in class.

Course Department: College of Communication Specialized Subjects for Freshman and Sophomore Majors
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course explores the concepts and techniques of visual communication in science and factual works. Over the course of the semester students will engage with the history and aesthetic of visual representation in science communication. Students will also engage in hands-on experiences with various media ranging from children’s books to virtual reality technology. Accessible to students from all disciplines, this introductory course contains workshops provided by master students who are working on related topics.

Course Department: College of Communication Specialized Subjects for Freshman and Sophomore Majors
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Social media play a key role in campaigns and the daily work of marketing, advertising and public relations professionals. This class will integrate the growing research in the area with the social media practices in these industries.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為「新聞與資訊學程」核心課之一。本課程將以實際操作專題寫作與資訊化專題應用，訓練同學應用事實資訊的資料蒐集、編整與呈現。

Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課主要教授統合運用傳播研究方法解決問題之能力，以及對相關倫理議題的敏感度。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 新聞網站平台運作實務
Course Department: Senior Class , Department of Journalism
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程是傳播、設計和資訊科學的跨領域整合課程，將以實作的方式，帶領同學產製多媒體報導，以培養未來新聞室所需人才。當今新聞媒體因應網際網路快速發展，已從紙本漸漸轉移到網路上。伴隨網路發展而來的媒材多樣性，使得影像、影音、動態圖表融入新聞報導、也因而產生動態圖表、新聞遊戲、擴增實境、虛擬實境等新的新聞報導形式。所有新聞媒體組織，遠至美國的《紐約時報》，近至臺灣的《報導者》，無不投入各種人力物力資源，以嘗試創新的可能性。在人員的組合，也大大改變。記者和編輯不再是新聞室主角，目前在新聞室的日常生活中，工程師、設計師、專案管理經理等角色份量也逐漸加重。在一個多媒體報導從無到有的過程中，記者、工程師、設計師和專案管理經理之間的溝通和協力合作非常重要，本課程將探討這些新聞室主要角色的工作重點，並帶領同學通過實作，建立一個知識基礎，期能在未來進入職場時，能夠加速跨領域合作能力。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大眾文化專題─離散、媒體與外籍配偶
CourseName: Seminars on Mass Culture ─ Diasora, Media, and Foreign Spouses
Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 過去新聞媒體所謂的「外籍新娘」如今因為結婚生子已構成台灣人口中的重要成分—新移民。對於親子兩代新移民的關懷是本課程的重心，而我們關懷的手段有兩種：對於過去媒體的報導及隱含的偏見，我們要利用相關報章投書及社會科學的理論與研究全面地加以檢討；對於當下新移民為生活所付山的努力，我們則要透過4部電影來做見證。利用廣泛閱讀及電影見證的方式，我希望訓練出明天報導相關議題的「專家記者」，甚至是導演或製片人。

Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 介紹台灣媒體近年的相關新聞工作案例,結合教材導讀,進行分析與討論。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 大眾文化專題－電視文化
Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程旨在探討電視媒介形成的文化現象，從早期電視作為一「現代」之科技象徵到「後現代」的消費文化機制做歷史的整理閱讀。前半學期著重制度／內容／閱聽人研究，並討論此一家戶普及的媒介在日常生活與文化政治理論中的各種形貌，共有八篇文章。個案研究共十二篇論文，閱讀以台灣電視文化的各種現象為研究主題的期刊論文。學期中安排兩次業界人士演講以及兩節開放討論主題。

Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 設計專題－說故事的方式
Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism

Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism

Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism

Course Department: Junior Class , Department of Journalism
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 以電視新聞產製流程為主體，採單元式講授及實作演練，輔以業界實例進行研討，並走訪電視台實地見習新聞線上工作情況。此外，因應數位匯流傳播型態變革，部分單元融入網路平台影音新聞實務，並透過介紹新媒體內容產製，啟發學生的創意及新思維。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為公關學程高階課程，開設目標旨在幫助同學熟悉公共關的實務與策略的規劃為目標，將「公關概論」、「公關寫作」等課程中介紹的公關策略運用、如何建立媒體關係、新聞稿寫作與媒體特性分析等範圍加以整合，讓同學從個案操作中學習公關企劃書的寫作，公關策略的思考與規劃，公關活動的執行與效益評估。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course focuses on the application of the public relations process. It involves the development and presentation of a complete communication plan for a community organization (the client). Students, working in teams, are required to research the organization’s public relations problems and opportunities; develop campaign objectives; plan public relations strategies and tactics; and evaluate campaign accomplishments. Relevant print and electronic public relations materials are produced, and the final campaign plan is presented to the client.

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 科技發展帶來行銷傳播複雜且不斷變化的今天，

CourseName: Special Topics in Creative Communication : Project X

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 政大創意實驗室邁入第十二年，歷經創意學程、Ｘ書院與虛擬共振書院幾個不同階段，即將於2018年秋天回歸「創意」、「實驗」與「空間」，成為校內創新、創造、創發與創意的基礎元素。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這門課以創意和實作為主，希望可以帶領同學發展一系列作品，為畢業之後下一階段做準備。本課程適合以下兩種同學修習：（1）已經具備設計、影像創作基礎，想要利用一學期的時間完成一個專題或作品集；（2）雖然不具備實作能力，但對於「發想」廣告創意有興趣，希望開發自己的創意潛能。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 社群媒體從以前的公告欄到現今的數位媒體像是臉書等，立基於人與人之間的「關係」及連結，傳遞資訊並潛藏著巨大的社會資本。本課程針對社群媒體，從社會學的社會網絡概念探討網絡間的資源與社會資本，進而聚焦於社群網站上獨特的特性，如何應用於行銷上。此外，並透過自由選擇之實作（小組為單位進行粉絲團或頻道經營）及許多課堂活動，讓學生能進一步體驗社群行銷中形象管理及品牌行銷策略企劃等，並定期運用上課所傳授的技巧至實作報告中。最後，讓學生們分組在所選擇的品牌，進行社群媒體行銷企劃（提出一完整的短中長期企劃）。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 創意溝通專題：美術攝影創作
CourseName: Special Topics in Creative Communication :Fine Art Photography
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課堂中，學生經由「定期作品發表」，學習如何大膽釋放「玩性」，引動敘事動機成為一個有效的創作者；藉由集體討論，學習如何以同理心，探索表象背後被漠視意義的觀眾；深思同時是創作者和觀眾，如何能靜心反芻，回溯被自己所淡忘的創造本能。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 期望透過本課程讓學生瞭解數位出版市場現況、數位出版品的風格與類型、學習圖文編排與數位出版編排的設計概念與軟體技術，並透過實作演練製作期中作業及期末數位出版專題製作。
