CourseName: Dentsu Aegis Network :Media Innovation in a New Marketing Era
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 整合電通安吉斯集團旗下各家媒體代理商公司資源，由多位專業資深同仁授課，通過課程學習

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 創意溝通專題：洞察與想像
CourseName: Special Topics in Creative Communication :Introduction to Insight and Imagination
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 廣告的終極目標是解題，題目如何解、從哪解、怎麼解得漂亮？

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 策略溝通專題：人際溝通與說服
CourseName: Special Topics in Strategic Communication :Human Communication
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程內容描述：    本課程的教授將結合人際溝通與說服學理介紹、應用和實際生活經驗映証，使同學們能在日常生活中活用理論，用以觀察、分析、診斷自己與別人的行為。同學們可從自身或親友經歷，或大眾傳媒的當紅偶像劇、大陸劇、韓劇或電影中找尋實例來映證或挑戰人際溝通理。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed for students who aim to become decision makers in the field of marketing communication.

CourseName: Public Affairs Reporting and Public Relations Writing
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 藉由公關寫作方法，貫連行銷公關知識，做為活用。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 創意溝通專題：廣告文案
CourseName: Special Topics in Creative Communication :Advertising Copywriting
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在網路時代，文案的傳播力量越來越和影像等量齊觀｡而且，文案從策略到撰寫技術，都必須比傳統廣告時代更加精進，才可能在萬文齊發的現代發揮應有效果｡這個學期，本課程將以新教材授課，把廣告文案的探討拆解成數個嶄新的討論範疇，從實用主義的角度，帶領同學一窺文案的堂奧｡

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 公共關係基礎(單學期)(修習且及格) 或 策略溝通專題：行銷公關(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Advertising

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本科目主要內容為教導學習者影視節目製作之專業流程，透過學理探討、節目賞析與創作指導等，引導學生完成前製作、製作、後製作等階段重要工作，培養學生進行現場單機製作及影棚多機節目製作之專業能力。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 待公告。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 學術與實務業界都說Content is King，不只如此節目IP創造、多元媒體平台也都是趨勢，透過本課程從企劃、腳本、劇本的判讀，到影視節目的實務工作執行，幫助同學在進入產業前，直接認識與學習各類節目在當今業界的實務運作方法。

CourseName: Nonfiction Film : Theory Study and Directing
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程將分為理論與實務，藉由文本與影片之研讀討論，認識影像
的敍事技巧，由對在地文化與不同的社會議題關心，啟發對事件有
敏銳的觀察力，希望學生以攝影機觀察並透過鏡頭語言，紀錄自己
關注的在地文化議題並拍攝成紀錄片，以期同學能對理論與實務均
有全貌性的了解。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課在學習過程中強調創意及自我表達的能力，期使同學認識演出所需布景、道具、燈光、服化設計之方法及表現重點。同學將依據腳本精讀戲劇衝突與轉折，掌握人物及情節的核心象徵，創作有特殊風格的設計圖稿。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 網路影音與社群媒體對於傳統電視媒體轉型和新媒體匯流帶來巨大衝擊，唯有透過創新影音內容產製與行銷型態，才能在科技與產業快速變革的挑戰中，找到台灣影視產業未來的發展模式與生機。本課程與台灣YouTube內容創意學院合作，希望以實驗性流程進行社群自媒體企製、行銷與數據分析教學，首先讓學生開發獨特自媒體影音內容，透過社群媒體經營粉絲互動，再用數據分析針對內容開發、社群行銷及使用者等洞察有用資訊，這些訓練將培養學生具備現今台灣影音產業最需要的創新能力及整合人才。本課程獲得政大教學精進計畫輔助課程，內容除了講授多螢幕社交電視、OTT影音、網紅直播趨勢，更指導學生YouTube頻道企製與Facebook粉專經營，本學期以知識性自媒體主題，學生將針對台灣特色進行IP創作和社群行銷，內容超越泛娛樂化和個人秀網紅表現形式。本課程目標是讓學生透過專案執行，在實作當中學到自媒體關鍵能力(內容企劃、頻道經營、粉絲互動、社群數據分析)，獲得社群影音實務經驗。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 跨國影視產業與政策比較
CourseName: Cross-Country Comparisons of VideoIndustry and Policy
Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將學習如何搜集各國影視產業與政策資料，從影視產業經濟特性、戲劇節目市場競爭環境介紹起，並討論跨國媒體集團形成與壟斷問題，或是創新科技對既有媒體商業模式與網路中立等政策衝擊。學生需大量閱讀美國、中國、韓國、日本與其他國家之影視產業與政策資訊，透過多個案研究方法比較，了解不同國家與全球跨國影視產業發展，以思考台灣未來的影視產業與政策方向。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 教授課程從三個重點出發：「電影配樂史與配樂師們」、「影視配樂理論技術介紹」及「近代配樂技術應用範例及欣賞」帶學生們了解關於電影配樂的範疇及技術實作與中西影視配樂的現況。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程內容主要為專題攝影概述、專題攝影作品賞析、實務創作與討論。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程著重在物體及角色的動態，學期一開始為停格動畫及簡單手繪的結合，之後則有多堂After Effects軟體學習。期末將以After Effects為主要工具來整合不同來源素材，設計、製作角色的表演。

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 政大廣電系【編劇學】，

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Ⅰ認識電視產業的基本生態架構(產業鏈與作業流程)，本課程以相關產業實務重要操作面向來進行初探。輔以酌情邀請產業實務卓越人士，與學生直接對話，雙向建構產學效能。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 從傳播科技匯流，再到人工智慧（AI）與物聯網（IoT）發展，當今傳播科系學生要設計的傳播內容，不再局限於新聞、廣告、廣播電視或影劇文本，可能是遊戲、博物館的互動app、mhealth的服務、學校教育的互動教材，本課程讓學生認識製作行動終端設備內容所需的知識，使學生有進一步的機會接觸行動傳播內容形式與其科技，並從實作與小組討論發展成品，為往後內容設計與管理作準備。目前對於何種節目性質，鏡頭與剪輯語言會適合新媒體，往往都流於經驗之談，此課程開放給對依照科技形式製作內容有興趣的同學，從訊息處理過程、人機介面、組織需要、消費者需要等面向討論與實驗。鼓勵同學創作行動內容與新的消費方式與行銷/社會行銷模式。行有餘力，也將介紹行動傳播的社會、政治與經濟面向的影響，結合理論與實作應用行動科技來達到傳播的目的，不管是人際溝通，社群建立，工作，遊戲，學習等， 讓學生成為更有效率並具備人文思考的行動傳播內容使用者與製作者。

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television

Course Department: Junior Class of Department of Radio & Television
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課是為喜愛音樂、具有音樂基礎或展演經驗，並對聲音媒體有高度興趣的學生開設，希望透過聲音現象及樂器聲學的探討，了解聲音的各種特性，並以適當方式加以錄製與重現。特別鼓勵學習者組成團隊，共同完成音樂創作錄製與出版行銷。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程檢視理論的重點在於：每一理論關懷什麼問題？從何觀點出發？建立在哪些前提之上？如何探討傳播現象？有哪些重要的研究發現？該理論學說的內涵為何？有何貢獻與侷限？為我們帶來哪些啟示？

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 影像是我們生活不可或缺的一部分，我們用影像來記錄、溝通訊息、和社交。在此同時，產製影像的技術，不只產生巨大轉變，而且所謂的「相片」，也不再局限於一張紙。今日的攝影，從感光科技、顯像與後製、儲存媒介、到再現與分享的途徑，全都產生革命性的改變。這個時代的攝影，應該視為「影像科技」（imaging technology）的一環，與資訊科技、通訊科技習習相關。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 影像是我們生活不可或缺的一部分，我們用影像來記錄、溝通訊息、和社交。在此同時，產製影像的技術，不只產生巨大轉變，而且所謂的「相片」，也不再局限於一張紙。今日的攝影，從感光科技、顯像與後製、儲存媒介、到再現與分享的途徑，全都產生革命性的改變。這個時代的攝影，應該視為「影像科技」（imaging technology）的一環，與資訊科技、通訊科技習習相關。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
影像是我們生活不可或缺的一部分，我們用影像來記錄、溝通訊息、和社交。在此同時，產製影像的技術，不只產生巨大轉變，而且所謂的「相片」，也不再局限於一張紙。今日的攝影，從感光科技、顯像與後製、儲存媒介、到再現與分享的途徑，全都產生革命性的改變。這個時代的攝影，應該視為「影像科技」（imaging technology）的一環，與資訊科技、通訊科技習習相關。
　　在這樣的時代背景之下，本課程，作為傳播學院最基礎的一門工具課，目標是讓同學（1）了解數位影像的原理，（2）了解創造高品質數位影像所牽涉的環節和技術，（3）熟悉基本的軟體、硬體操作。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之目的即在提供前述傳播書寫能力中之影像技藝的學習。課程為一學期，主要授課十二單元，並配合其他學習活動，以完成學生理解與實驗影像傳達的基本能力。與本課程平行的相關課程，另有圖像製作、採訪寫作、基礎創意寫作...等課程。而本課程的進階課程，則有進階影像製作、導演方法、影視劇本寫作、紀錄片製作...等課程。同學宜主動研究傳院課表，自主建構個人的學習地圖。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之目的即在提供前述傳播書寫能力中之影像技藝的學習。課程為一學期，主要授課十二單元，並配合其他學習活動，以完成學生理解與實驗影像傳達的基本能力。與本課程平行的相關課程，另有圖像製作、採訪寫作、基礎創意寫作...等課程。而本課程的進階課程，則有進階影像製作、導演方法、影視劇本寫作、紀錄片製作...等課程。同學宜主動研究傳院課表，自主建構個人的學習地圖。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之目的即在提供前述傳播書寫能力中之影像技藝的學習。課程為一學期，主要授課十二單元，並配合其他學習活動，以完成學生理解與實驗影像傳達的基本能力。與本課程平行的相關課程，另有圖像製作、採訪寫作、基礎創意寫作...等課程。而本課程的進階課程，則有進階影像製作、導演方法、影視劇本寫作、紀錄片製作...等課程。同學宜主動研究傳院課表，自主建構個人的學習地圖。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to introduce you to some key ideas and issues in the field of the sociology of the arts and popular culture, by examining the relationship between individuals, the arts, and society. The course synthesizes theoretical approaches and empirical studies, and includes off-campus learning activities in the form of participatory observation.

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 人類是視覺的動物，大部分的資訊都需要透過視覺來接收，隨著通訊技術的改變，視覺化的資訊成為溝通的重要工具，不論在學術、新聞、商業或娛樂領域，視覺化的資訊的重要都越來越高。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Understand the content and purposes of text news reports in the foreign media

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程主要教授插圖及漫畫圖像的理論概念、創作方法、文創應用與行銷案例探討。在圖像理論部分以實際案例佐以理論的方式，讓學生深入淺出的理解圖像符號學、格式塔視覺心理學及圖像敘事等理論，並採用漸進式實作引導演練，讓即使沒有創作基礎的學生也能習得圖像繪製與分鏡構圖等的創作方法與技巧；課程將探討圖像在新聞時事、商業設計、娛樂觀光及文創產業等領域的應用與行銷案例，讓學生依個人興趣選擇圖像創作或文創應用企劃，並對於有創作能力與興趣的學生，將進一步指導參加法國安古蘭漫畫或金漫獎等比賽。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course introduces the fundamental knowledge in public relations practices. The students learn about the role and the functions of public relations in strategic communication, mainly through the teaching/learning approaches of lectures, group discussions, student presentations, and readings.

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 介紹影視媒體裡運用的主要視覺元素，分析其相互關係與結構。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 上個世紀二次大戰後，科技的發展為人類帶來了進步的福祉，然當人類進入高度仰賴高科技的二十一世紀，包括台灣在內的全球各地，無可避免面臨了大自然與人為後果的嚴厲反撲，包括氣候變遷、環境污染、健康風險等，使得我們無法置身度外於Ulrich Beck所言之風險社會。故前瞻性的教育內涵有必要從跨領域視角，理解、正視、善用、與反思傳播（包括大眾媒體）在面對環境變遷時所扮演的角色。本課開課宗旨即以此作為出發點，期冀引領同學針對當今全球與在地關鍵環境變遷議題進行耙梳；本課所探索的大眾傳播則包括各種不同的媒體形式，包括新聞報導、紀錄片、娛樂內容、商業或公益廣告行銷、網路社群媒體討論、公開的藝術展覽等。鑑於培養環境變遷傳播能力牽涉科學、文化、社會、政治等面向的跨領域學習，本課也歡迎非傳播相關科系的學生修習。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程強調現代行銷觀念在企業組織中所扮演的角色及功能，內容涵蓋如何了解行銷及行銷過程、如何在動態的行銷環境中評估機會、如何發展行銷策略及行銷組合、國際行銷環境、行銷與社會等相關議題，並輔以企業行銷管理實務之介紹。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程在於介紹與解析，伴隨電影藝術興起之後，隨之發展的各種電影理論。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 這不是一門攝影創作課，或一門教授攝影拍攝技巧的課，而是一門從文化研究角度分析攝影文本的課。攝影一直是應用範圍最廣的一種視覺媒介，在數位時代與網路科技的變革下，又讓攝影全面進入人們的生活與文化，成為一種生活方式。此課程希望分析、討論、思辨作為生活方式的攝影，如何不僅是藝術形式，更是文化內容。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程內容主要介紹藝術的基本概念、不同類型的藝術、藝術領域相關語彙等，包括不同區域的藝術史、藝術賞析與評論的方法與角度等。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 你知道為什麼美國有近半數的民眾不相信全球暖化，而台灣相信全球暖化的比例卻超過九成嗎？你知道為什麼歐洲人比美國人對於基因改造食品更加反感？你知道為什麼車禍發生的頻率比墜機高很多，但卻很少聽到有人害怕坐車？你知道為什麼吃美國瘦肉精牛肉得病的機率比被雷打到還低，台灣民眾仍然反對美牛進口？電影明天過後大大的賣座，但究竟這樣的娛樂好萊塢片對於我們的環境意識是否有所影響？如果這些是你經常想問的問題，那麼恭喜你，這堂課就是你應該要選的一門課。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程視音樂為社會生產 (social production)與音樂生產(musical production)，雙探它在文本與社會過程裡的意義與寓意，尤其聚焦音樂的社會使用(social use)，並探索相關熱門議題；例如，在社會設計的可能性。本課程以文化社會學、媒體社會學、音樂社會學、國族研究與公民身分為方法路徑。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「我們不知道是誰發現了水，但肯定不是魚。」這句經典名言出自於知名的傳播學者麥克魯漢，他認為，魚每天生活在水中，被水包圍著，不知道早已全身溼透，如同被媒介及其產製資訊所包圍的閱聽人，不知不覺被媒體影響著對於外在世界的認知與看法。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程帶領同學探索傳播科技在日常生活中的運用，討論傳播科技所引發的影響、聯想以及引申的意涵。除了理解傳播科技在當代生活中的應用，也從歷史角度回顧傳播科技與社會變遷的關係，並試著遙想未來可能的變化。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程是傳播學院的基礎專業課程。修課同學不需有法律或傳播的背景。不論同學未來從事媒體工作或是研究媒體，都需要有傳播法規與媒介倫理的常識，才能更瞭解傳播生態或對節目製作與經營管理有幫助。希望在兼顧理論與實務的同時，提供同學對新聞、廣電、電訊、廣告、新媒體、網路等相關法規及倫理的認識，同時亦希望同學瞭解傳播法規及倫理在實務上的操作。本課程還希望培養同學面對一些傳播法規與倫理的議題，不僅有分析的能力，亦知如何應對。授課老師亦會與同學分享國內外最新的法規動態及在電訊傳播主管機關服務的心得與觀察。希望同學能快樂地學習，並且和老師有互動的討論。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 政大創意實驗室邁入第十二年，歷經創意學程、Ｘ書院與虛擬共振書院幾個不同階段，即將於2018年秋天回歸「創意」、「實驗」與「空間」，成為校內創新、創造、創發與創意的基礎元素。帶著盤點與收合的意圖，2017年春夏，由Ｘ書院、傳播學院、藝文中心與Ｘ學院籌備辦公室共同設計這門創意入門課，並與「創意溝通專題：Ｘ計劃」共享12個工作坊。這門課的目的，是把師生推出舒服圈，往四面八方尋找兩件禮物：一件用來一起創造與設計，另一件則用以回應自身未知之「Ｘ」。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程目標：

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課將掌握新聞採訪寫作的基本因素：(1)了解什麼是新聞，以及怎麼找新聞、採訪新聞，了解不同類型的新聞，以及判斷新聞不同面向，進而學到用不同角度寫新聞。(2)從事實出發，訓練學生採訪寫作技能，循序漸進，修課學生在基礎採訪寫作訓練下，接觸各種型態的採訪，練習重要寫作要領及技巧。(3)依基礎練習，以媒體屬性提供不同新聞採訪寫作的實務訓練，及綜合製作新聞技巧。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為有志從事紀實報導者設計，尤其聚焦各種新聞採寫實務，並探討相關典範轉移等熱門議題。本課程主要以新聞實務為方法，並結合新聞學、傳播研究與社會學路徑。

Course Department: Freshmen Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課旨在透過簡介戲劇的結構、台灣有的戲劇形式以及相關中西戲劇思潮，引發學生觀察、調查身邊或喜好的戲劇形式乃至表達方式。除了引發創作戲劇的興趣以及做研究的熱情，更希望學生從自身出發，透過戲劇的框架理解自己和生長的環境。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在傳播這個領域裡，最基礎的便是創意與寫作。這裡所謂的創意，並不僅僅指稱創造力，它更包括了我們如何思考、如何感受、如何觀察、如何體驗、如何想像；所以，我們也可以稱之為「想像」（thinking）。同時，這裡所稱的寫作，也不僅指稱以筆寫作，它包括了以其他形式表現自己的種種方式，例如：影像、圖像、聲音、肢體，乃至全新的抽象符號等等；新文學批評裡，有時以「書寫」（writing）概稱之。無論是「創意與寫作」或「想像與書寫」，都包含「創」、「作」（或「想」、「作」）這兩種層次。這門課便在重新看待這兩件我們似乎天天都在進行的動作。並且，希望能以一個學期的短暫時間，讓大家重新看待，或重新拾回這種原應是本能，但卻被我們疏忽的能力。希望這門課，能讓我們更活潑地思考、好奇、體驗、感受、玩味、想像，並從而用有趣、感人、有效、有原創、具實驗性的方式表現自己之所想。

Course Department: Sophomore Class D, Undeclared Major in College of Communication
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 在傳播這個領域裡，最基礎的便是創意與寫作。這裡所謂的創意，並不僅僅指稱創造力，它更包括了我們如何思考、如何感受、如何觀察、如何體驗、如何想像；所以，我們也可以稱之為「想像」（thinking）。同時，這裡所稱的寫作，也不僅指稱以筆寫作，它包括了以其他形式表現自己的種種方式，例如：影像、圖像、聲音、肢體，乃至全新的抽象符號等等；新文學批評裡，有時以「書寫」（writing）概稱之。無論是「創意與寫作」或「想像與書寫」，都包含「創」、「作」（或「想」、「作」）這兩種層次。這門課便在重新看待這兩件我們似乎天天都在進行的動作。並且，希望能以一個學期的短暫時間，讓大家重新看待，或重新拾回這種原應是本能，但卻被我們疏忽的能力。希望這門課，能讓我們更活潑地思考、好奇、體驗、感受、玩味、想像，並從而用有趣、感人、有效、有原創、具實驗性的方式表現自己之所想。

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Social media play a key role in campaigns and the daily work of marketing, advertising and public relations professionals. This class will integrate the growing research in the area with the social media practices in these industries.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course explores the concepts and techniques of visual communication in science and factual works. Over the course of the semester students will engage with the history and aesthetic of visual representation in science communication. Students will also engage in hands-on experiences with various media ranging from children’s books to virtual reality technology. Accessible to students from all disciplines, this introductory course contains workshops provided by master students who are working on related topics.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This graduate seminar class will introduce students a range of fundamental issues about new media convergence by examining the impact of SoLoMo technologies on fast-changing media landscape. Students will learn how to use analytical lenses to understand new media convergence phenomenon at individual, organizational, and industry levels. Next, it will examine how various converging technologies such as big data and artificial intelligence affect electronic media, Internet, and mobile industries. The socio-political, economic, and cultural issues involved in media transformation and diffusion of emerging information communication technologies will be investigated. During this semester, the instructor has collaborated with University of San Francisco to have three talks regarding social media and intercultural communication offered by experts from Facebook, YouTube, etc.. (City University of Hong Kong and Baptist University, Hong Kong are collaborated partners.) Singapore’s experts will also share their new media research experiences in class.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The objectives of this course are to:

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The academic discipline of this course is International Relations, a subfield of Political Science (not merely a subject of International Studies). In other words, we will study international organization in the context of world politics. The Organizations and Institutes covered are thus mainly State-centric intergovernmental arrangements. Non-governmental organizations, international civil societies or business/ private institutions are not in the scope of this course.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course attempts to help students develop problem solving skills in global business contexts. To help achieve this, it is taught in a lecture and case discussion format. The lectures present key concepts in global strategic thinking while case discussions sharpen students’ skills in analytical problem-solving situations. While the lectures are essential to internalizing salient content knowledge in global business, project-based & case discussions are key in developing the problem-solving and communication skills valued so highly in management practice. Discussions of cases are also valuable in familiarizing you with the kinds of problems typically faced by decision makers, and all the risks and rewards involved in implementing a chosen decision alternative, whether in the technology-driven or the service industries. It is in such a pedagogical context, also in response to the unique nature of global communication program at NCCU, the course is also designed to provide an appreciation for cross-functional and interdisciplinary perspectives complementary with their existing media-related core competency. This is because today’s global operations increasingly require these proficiencies in managing core business processes. For example, product development teams today include managers from finance and engineering, even from disciplines such as anthropology and sociology, in addition to marketing. They also include professionals from multiple national cultures, such as German and American managers working together at Daimler Chrysler and American, British, and German engineers working with anthropologists and demographers on new car projects at Ford Motor Company.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to help students understand and use appropriate statistical tools to conduct, interpret and report results for their research. It will introduce students to the underlying logics of the common test statistics used in communication research and familiarize them with the statistical package, SPSS. The course will be rooted in practice and interpretation of real data sets and examples from research published in communication journals.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course will lead the students into investigating the various aspects of consumer behavior through an inter-discipline perspective. Related theories form economics, psychology, sociology, anthropology, and communication are used to scrutinize and discuss the processes of consumer behavior and orientations. Consumer behavior cases are discussed so as to illustrate the related theories. The course will be taught through lectures, in-class group discussions, case study, group projects of observational study and presentations, and so on.

Course Department: International Master's Program in International Communication Studies, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Every spring semester, IMICS offers an internship course with credits. However, if you are a Taiwanese Scholarship recipient, you are unable to take this course by regulation. The internship must be related to communications and you must acquire prior approval from Professor Tsung-Jen Shih before beginning the internship. You can register for the internship course before or after completing the actual internship. If you register for the internship course but do not complete the internship within the spring semester, you will receive an "incomplete" mark on your transcript. You are only allowed one “incomplete” mark this way on your transcript.

Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為整合型創作課程，目的在培養研究生的獨立思考與創作能力。廣泛介紹未來新媒體創作的發展趨勢，與未來人類存在哲學的思維，誘發同學對於科技媒體本質與影響的研究，並從其中找尋自己的學術定位，開始嘗試提案與實際創作。

Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為整合型創作課程，目的在培養研究生的獨立思考與創作能力。廣泛介紹未來新媒體創作的發展趨勢，與人類對未來存在哲學的思維，誘發同學對於科技媒體本質與影響的研究，並從其中找尋自己的學術定位，開始嘗試提案與實際創作。

CourseName: Implementation of Digital Content and Technologies
Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, First Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
身為新媒體創作者，數位內容就是創作素材，必須懂得它們的特性、了解如何操弄、運用它們數位內容所的同學在寫作論文或發表創作時幾乎少不了資訊技術修習課程的過程中，同學們將學習如何使用資訊技術操作與展現數位內容包含文字、排版、音訊、音樂合成、圖形、圖像、動畫、影片與互動。本課程基於普及與通用程度、適合操作多媒體與容易上手等原因，選定JavaScript為實作程式語言配合HTML5平台。課程定位為技術入門，假設修習者可能略為接觸過程式語言，會視同學的程度再予以調整。 

本課程配合校級計畫「南風四重奏」，同學必須參與二週跨領域工作坊，出席將列入學期成績計算。

CourseName: The interactive film of the future
Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, Second Year

Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「設計思考實踐」碩士班 課程的主要目的是培養同學運用設計思考發掘問題，解決問題的能力。同學們會學習到以下主要內容：

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: 無
Course Department: none
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 無課程簡介

Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 觸控介面(Touch UI)是繼圖形化介面(GUI)之後最重要的操作介面，透過手指在觸控裝置上的直接操作，讓互動過程更加直覺自然。本課程以觸控式裝置(如手機、平板、互動桌、互動牆等)為主要互動平台，介紹人機互動(HCI)及使用者介面(UI)於此類平台之發展歷程、研究方法以及設計準則，培養學生於新一代使用者介面之設計開發能力，並能應用這些研究方法至未來的創新介面當中。

Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課堂講義含跨數位出版不同課題，修課同學從中建立數位出版基礎概念及實作能力，期末分組設計實作數位出版作品

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 互動科技：媒材、感知與設計
Course Department: Master Program in Digital Content, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程著重互動設計中物聯網人機互動，將虛擬資訊藉由實體物件作為操作手法，結合使用者的行為探究，將數位世界與現實世界整合，讓學生們藉由跳脫傳統電腦操作介面，發揮創意發展不一樣的操作媒材，包含創造生活創意中的智慧物件。課程採專業知識與技術學習，主授陳聖智老師與協同教學胡誌麟老師

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程依指定教本而設計，依次討論下列當今社會科學方法論的六大重要議題：價值、因果解釋、詮釋、理性選擇、方法論個人主義、及規範。每一議題花二週(約四篇論文)討論。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 日常生活中存在各種媒體科技，手機、電視、網路、電腦等等，人們習慣甚至依賴其存在，卻也透過其中介，對於各種物質產生聯想與詮釋，然這些細微的互動，卻因屬日常生活實踐，被認為平淡無奇而忽視之。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 許多行為相關研究多以「實驗設計」作為資料蒐集的方法，研究領域包含心理學、消費者行為、行銷溝通、人管議題與行為財務學等。本課程旨在介紹實驗設計的方法，並學習如何應用實驗設計方法蒐集資料以驗證相關研究議題。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 同學將接觸重要敘事學者和相關理論，以便理解敘事之意涵，增進分析敘事的能力。課程內容包括從生命看故事，從理論看文本，從傳播看敘事互動。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程試圖從不同角度，討論不同媒體的閱聽受眾；課程內容涵蓋閱聽人理論、測量與研究方法，漸次說明變化中的閱聽人概念。本課程除了引介大眾傳播媒體情境下的閱聽人理論外，同時兼及數位媒體環境中的閱聽人，因此亦包括具有創作產製功能，以「與他人溝通」為閱聽任務之一的閱聽人。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 批判傳播理論—新媒體篇
CourseName: Critical  Theories on New Media  Studies
Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 針對資訊革命的衝擊，數位媒體已取代大眾傳播媒介，成為最重要的傳播管道。「批判傳播理論：新媒體篇」因應這樣的趨勢，內容包括：1、數位媒體的哲學基礎，2、新媒體的定義，3、新媒體的批判與反思，4、數位社群，5、新媒體與民主，6、新媒體的研究方法

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 傳播與社會專題：傳播說服、傳播心理與傳播效果
CourseName: Communication and Society Seminar: Persuasion, MediaPsychology and Media Effects
Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程聚焦於傳播效果取徑研究，關注傳播說服與傳播心理研究的理論脈絡與發展；研究應用層面涵蓋廣告說服、消費說服、健康說服與政治說服等。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程目的在探索傳行業和工作之趨勢，培養因應變化之能力。上課方式以思考、想像、設計為主，閱讀為輔。內容主要分作三部分：（一）教師引言，（二）個案研析 （三）學生設計案。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The seminar in Social and Entertainment Media will focus on the development of theories and research trends/topics in social media and digital game literature. Students will learn how these two streams of research originated and evolved in communication research. In addition, students will examine phenomena in these two popular media forms and their effects on human well-being, cognition, and emotions. Furthermore, we will look at how these two media outlets apply into different areas. The course will be consisted of 1/2 of social media literature and 1/2 of entertainment media research.

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「媒介經濟學」主要是以個體經濟學與產業經濟學理論，分析媒體與電訊市場運作，傳統上經濟學過多的數理模型，使得傳播學生不易親近，本課程主要介紹基本理論、概念，並不涉及複雜的計算，也不需要先上過大學部的經濟學，但建議手邊至少要有一本基礎的經濟學書籍，以方便隨時可以參考翻閱。由於不同課程間的分工與上課時間限制，「媒介經濟學」並不擴大至「傳播政治經濟學」、「文化消費」或「賽局策略互動」等議題，建議同學可以選修傳院其他相關課程，期望從更多元角度思考媒介經濟問題。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 1.與同學一起觀察和分享全球化、區域化與在地文化的關聯；

CourseName: Communication Ecology and System in Mainland China
Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課從政治、經濟、文化、科技和網絡面探討中國大陸傳媒和傳媒體系的發展。西方國家看中國傳媒產業，認為和國家的政黨控制脫不了關係，但中國自己調查報告認為，新媒體的崛起成為傳媒產業超越GDP快速增長的重要驅動力——移動互聯網使傳播管道碎片化，營銷模式不斷創新，形成新經濟增長點。傳統媒體在進行結構調整，出現新一波營業模式。究竟何者是中國傳播新生態的真面貌？本課將綜覽大陸傳播生態與制度的重要議題、歷史發展、現狀及未來。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程之開展，實奠基於系統思維與法則，靈活思謀以策略管理為核心意理與理論基礎，進而從當代
知識管理來探析媒介應有的核心能力 (core competence) ，以及如何建構此競爭優勢。故本課程相
關之重要主題包括：系統理論、策略管理、競爭策略之觀念、思維、理論與知識，及經理人角色、職
能與職責，推展至知識管理、品牌管理與整合行銷傳播等事業策略之觀念、理論與知識、技巧。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程結構安排主要包括：風險論述與風險傳播、環境傳播/報導論述與重要問題探討、以及健康傳播/報導論述與重要問題探討。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課自介紹「言說」與「言說分析」入手，闡明言說分析的各種取徑、應用、評論、以及實例分析。課程分為言說與結構、言說與社會行動、言說與身份認同、以及言說與意識型態幾部分。

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程分成三大部分：

Course Department: Ph.D Program in Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程規劃從「類目」（categorization）、「框架」(framing)、「隱喻框架」（metaphorical framing）「概念融合」（conceptual blends）等心智運作原理，逐步建構意義與思考之間的脈絡。經由「體現」（embodiment）、「體現認知」（embodied cognition）的理論，論述隱喻性思考如何根植於身體與環境的互動。 一系列由淺至深的概念及論述引領我們以不同的取徑探索人類的心靈、身體與環境的交織，及其如何衍生出我們的認知、語言、溝通、文化等等層面。

CourseName: The interactive film of the future
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程特色：

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 兩岸流行文化研究—中國電影專題
CourseName: Research on Popular Culture of Taiwan and China：Topics on China Cinema
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課將程透過1978年中國改革開放之來的電影，介紹中國政治社會的變遷與文化風景的變化，主題包括：80年代文化熱、92年全面市場化前後的城市變化、城鄉表述、青年次文化、社會階級身分的想像與表述、大國崛起的想像與論述等。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 新台灣電通講堂：創造未來的「品牌創新與體驗設計」
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 科技發展帶來行銷傳播複雜且不斷變化的今天，

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 檢視亞洲媒體在全球化、新科技衝擊下，傳統媒體面臨轉型匯流挑戰，新興媒體在激烈市場競爭中找到立足點，本課程將針對中國和其他海外華人多、媒體發達之國家(印尼、新馬)，在課上介紹各國影音、行動及社群媒體發展之新興生態，探討它們在政經、市場及科技文化等次系統角力下，(華語)影音媒體發展有哪些影響?主要新影音媒體業者有那些創新與匯流? 除論文導讀與專題報告外，本課程將指導學生以鉅觀方法(社會技術系統法等)進行亞洲新媒體研究，學生將從次級資料搜尋、文獻整合分析，透過理論架構加以深入論述，完成研討會論文品質之期末報告。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 傳播與文化專題：跨領域視野
CourseName: Seminar on Communication and Culture :Crossdisciplinary Perspectives
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程為傳播碩士學程之新聞專業核心課程，授課內容聚焦新聞專業知識面向，本年度課程將以「資料新聞學」（Data Journalism）為知識核心。資料新聞學是新聞學和資料科學的跨領域知識整合領域。新聞工作者蒐集、清洗和分析大規模數據資料，建構新聞議題和內容。新聞圖表則是資料新聞學呈現的方式。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程講授的內容重點包括：管理與媒介管理的意涵、策略管理與策略定位、媒介經理人的角色及功能、人力資源策略管理、媒介組織結構與分工、節目策略與生產管理、及行銷策略與促銷作為等議題。並為考慮學習者畢業後就業謀職之需求，在人力資源部分，加入求才求職相關學理與實務內容，並整合口語傳播相關面談技巧之內容。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程結構安排主要包括：風險論述與風險傳播、環境傳播/報導論述與重要問題探討、以及健康傳播/報導論述與重要問題探討。

CourseName: Communication Ecology and System in Mainland China
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課從政治、經濟、文化、科技和網絡面探討中國大陸傳媒和傳媒體系的發展。西方國家看中國傳媒產業，認為和國家的政黨控制脫不了關係，但中國自己調查報告認為，新媒體的崛起成為傳媒產業超越GDP快速增長的重要驅動力——移動互聯網使傳播管道碎片化，營銷模式不斷創新，形成新經濟增長點。傳統媒體在進行結構調整，出現新一波營業模式。究竟何者是中國傳播新生態的真面貌？本課將綜覽大陸傳播生態與制度的重要議題、歷史發展、現狀及未來。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The seminar in Social and Entertainment Media will focus on the development of theories and research trends/topics in social media and digital game literature. Students will learn how these two streams of research originated and evolved in communication research. In addition, students will examine phenomena in these two popular media forms and their effects on human well-being, cognition, and emotions. Furthermore, we will look at how these two media outlets apply into different areas. The course will be consisted of 1/2 of social media literature and 1/2 of entertainment media research.

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「媒介經濟學」主要是以個體經濟學與產業經濟學理論，分析媒體與電訊市場運作，傳統上經濟學過多的數理模型，使得傳播學生不易親近，本課程主要介紹基本理論、概念，並不涉及複雜的計算，也不需要先上過大學部的經濟學，但建議手邊至少要有一本基礎的經濟學書籍，以方便隨時可以參考翻閱。由於不同課程間的分工與上課時間限制，「媒介經濟學」並不擴大至「傳播政治經濟學」、「文化消費」或「賽局策略互動」等議題，建議同學可以選修傳院其他相關課程，期望從更多元角度思考媒介經濟問題。

CourseName: Nonfiction Film : Theory Study and Directing
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程將分為理論與實務，藉由文本與影片之研讀討論，認識影像的敍事技巧，由對在地文化與不同的社會議題關心，啟發對事件有敏銳的觀察力，希望學生以攝影機觀察並透過鏡頭語言，紀錄自己關注的在地文化議題並拍攝成紀錄片，以期同學能對理論與實務均有全貌性的了解。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 創意溝通專題：美術攝影創作
CourseName: Special Topics in Creative Communication :Fine Art Photography
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課堂中，學生經由「定期作品發表」，學習如何大膽釋放「玩性」，引動敘事動機成為一個有效的創作者；藉由集體討論，學習如何以同理心，探索表象背後被漠視意義的觀眾；深思同時是創作者和觀眾，如何能靜心反芻，回溯被自己所淡忘的創造本能。

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 電通安吉斯講堂：新行銷世代下的媒體創新
CourseName: Dentsu Aegis Network :Media Innovation in a New Marketing Era
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 整合電通安吉斯集團旗下各家媒體代理商公司資源，由多位專業資深同仁授課，通過課程學習

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課是寫作課，也是實作課，以前無意開在研究所，因為研究所宗旨在學術研究。最近體察碩士班學習旨趣已多非為學術，實作課且是新聞與資訊傳播學程的核心，本課可為其進階科目。

CourseName: Short Film Script Writing and Appreciation
Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: （一）短片欣賞討論與解析

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed for students who aim to become researchers and decision makers in the field of integrated marketing communications (IMC). Readings and class discussions will include both practical and theoretical topics that will lead to a comprehensive understanding of this paradigm.

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程規劃從「類目」（categorization）、「框架」(framing)、「隱喻框架」（metaphorical framing）「概念融合」（conceptual blends）等心智運作原理，逐步建構意義與思考之間的脈絡。經由「體現」（embodiment）、「體現認知」（embodied cognition）的理論，論述隱喻性思考如何根植於身體與環境的互動。 一系列由淺至深的概念及論述引領我們以不同的取徑探索人類的心靈、身體與環境的交織，及其如何衍生出我們的認知、語言、溝通、文化等等層面。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 請見

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課自介紹「言說」與「言說分析」入手，闡明言說分析的各種取徑、應用、評論、以及實例分析。課程分為言說與結構、言說與社會行動、言說與身份認同、以及言說與意識型態幾部分。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 課程分成三大部分：

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 「想像、敘事與互動學程」提供同學們各種創意與創作之知能訓練。作為這個學程的核心課程(另一為導演方法)，「想像與書寫」主要提供同學們，關於想像與敘事所應有的基礎概念與方法。雖然最終，我們或許領悟，敘事(說故事)這個行當，並沒有一定的原則，因此也沒有絕對或標準的知識可以傳授，但我們仍然試著提供可能有效的想故事和說故事的系統性方法，或者至少是一種有系統、可依循的探索過程，以協助同學們創作。說故事這件事包括了想和說這兩個過程。想一個故事是說故事的前提，而說故事則是使得一個故事有效被聽見的方式。前者接近我們常說的創意，它並不僅僅指稱創造力，更包括了我們如何思考、如何感受、如何體驗、如何想像、如何觀察；所以，我們也可以稱之為「想像」（thinking），亦即尋找、想像一個故事；而後者則接近我們常說的創作，也就是將一個故事呈現出來。這裡，所謂的呈現，不僅指稱以筆寫作，它包括了以其他形式表現自己的種種方式，例如：影像、圖像、聲音、肢體，乃至全新的抽象符號，或數位互動、隨境移動...等等；新文學批評裡，有時以「書寫」（writing）概稱之。無論是「創意與寫作」或「想像與書寫」，都包含「創」、「作」這兩種層次。「想像與書寫」這門課便在重新看待這兩件我們似乎天天都在進行的動作。並且，希望能以十八周的短暫時間，讓大家重新看待，或重新拾回這種原應是本能，但卻被我們疏忽的能力。希望這門課，能讓我們更活潑地思考、好奇、體驗、感受、玩味、想像，並從而用有趣、感人、有效、有原創、具實驗性的方式說出我們的故事。

Course Department: Master's Program of Communication, Second Year
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 1.與同學一起觀察和分享全球化、區域化與在地文化的關聯；

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語語言學概論(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class A, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides a general introduction to the scientific study of language, with special emphasis on the English language. Students will explore different aspects of human language and how language operates through linguistic observation, analyses of language data, discussion of linguistic problems, group project, and other class activities. With a better understanding of the nature of language, students are expected to become more objective in dealing with human communications. Topics covered in the second semester include pragmatics, language acquisition, language variation, language change, psycholinguistics, neurolinguistics, and sociolinguistics.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語語言學概論(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Linguistics is the scientific study of language, specifically of language form, language meaning, and language in context. At the heart of linguistics is an understanding of the unconscious knowledge that humans have about language, the structure of language in general and of particular languages, how children acquire language how languages vary, and how language influences the way in which we interact with each other and think about the world. In the first semester, the following topics will be included: the nature of language, human language and animal communication, the sounds of language, the sound patterns of language, the words of language, the sentence patterns of language, and the meaning of language.

Course Department: Freshman Class A, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides an overview of the elements and the conventions of the major literary genres to beginning students of literature. The genres treated include fiction, poetry, prose and drama.

Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The primary aim of this course is to expose students to a number of key literary texts, prosaic, poetic, and dramatic. With poetry, we will examine a great range of texts from different periods, beginning with the ancient world and gradually making our way through the centuries. In the second half of the class, we will consider two canonical modern works from the United States. Through interpreting a variety of texts and genres, students will expand their cultural and historical awareness, while developing advanced skills in critical thinking and written analysis.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: At the centre of this course lies a concern with the interplay between literary form and historical transformations in seventeenth and eighteenth-century England. We will ask the following questions: to what extent does a literary work serve political or ethical purposes? What is the relationship between literary imagination and social concerns? In what ways can words express and embody powerful feelings? Central issues that potentially can complicate these questions may include freedom, authority, memory, travel, gender and class.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Reading and Writing II is a required course for English majors. According to the guidelines for the course established by the English Department, students will learn abstract logical reasoning skills and apply them to various writing situations in which a synthesis of multiple rhetorical forms is required. Students will also be expected to develop their own critical appreciation and evaluation of the text. The intellectual work of reading aims to facilitate the students’ own writing using their readings to work with through and against based upon their own development of critical thinking.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is the second year of the two-year writing and reading program. It aims to continue increasing students’ skills of academic writing and reading. For writing, students will learn the major rhetorical forms and logical reasoning skills. These strategies include definition, comparison-contrast, cause-effect, argumentation (persuasion), responses, and a research paper. As to reading, this course aims to enable students to establish their own critical evaluation of texts. Reading skills include not only those taught in the first-year writing and reading course, but also critical thinking and analysis. These skills will be taught via lecture, discussions, assignments, peer review, and individual/group conferences. Through mastering these skills, students are expected to become active and critical readers and writers.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course invites students to see writing and reading as complementary arts, one reinforcing the other. Students will learn different rhetorical skills that inform a persuasive essay, such as how to define a term, how to explain a causal relationship, how to compare and contrast two subjects, and how to argue a point convincingly. These writing strategies will appear in the model essays, newspaper articles and one classic English novel that we are going to read. By examining these texts carefully, students will learn that the writing skills they have learned in class are not abstract ideas detached from everyday reality. They are in fact an important part of our daily life, one that shapes our understanding of the world around us.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course aims to develop students’ critical thinking and analytical skills through reading and writing. Students will read academic articles and literary writings, discuss several rhetorical devices, gain focused practice with proper citations and conventions, write critical essays and make logical connections between various sources.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: In this course, we will focus on reading comprehension and the process of writing at the university level: brainstorming new ideas, organizing those ideas, conducting research, using quotations and citations, writing drafts and revising, and peer reviewing. We will develop these skills by preparing to write across several different genres of academic essay: 1) the cause-and-effect essay; 2) the argumentative essay; and 3) a lengthy research essay. The goals of the course include strengthening your critical thinking and reading skills, your ability to analyze and synthesize information, and your skills at researching, organizing, and presenting written text.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course, Writing and Reading II, aims to develop the English majors’critical thinking, analytical skills as well as academic research ability through strict intellectual practices of reading and writing in the English language. Students will read all sorts of academic articles and literary writings, explore a variety of rhetorical devices employed in English writing by different authors, gain focused practices with proper academic citations and conventions, write critical essays and make logical connections between various sources, which ammounts to the final accomplishement of a research paper on a literary work of their own choice according to the most up-to-date MLA academic writing tyle.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is the first year of the two-year program of English writing and reading. It aims to develop both the writing and reading skills of English majors.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides training in grasping the main ideas of the reading material, assessing whether it achieves its own purpose, and critically reflecting upon the issues raised. Students will be taught to call upon their reading experience to write illustration, process analysis, casue and effect and classification essays with effective rhetorical forms and writing strategies.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed for undergraduate freshman students so as to develop paragraph and essay reading and writing abilities. Students’ own appreciation and critical evaluation of passages are expected.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Goals:

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is the first year of the two-year integrated program of writing and reading for NCCU English majors. The content of the course will focus on the essay-level writing development, introduction to major rhetorical modes, grammar review and practice, as well as extensive and intensive reading.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 寫作與閱讀（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
Brief Introduction of the Course 

This is the first required writing course for students in NCCU's Department of English. 

In this course you will take the knowledge that you learned about communicating in English during your high school years and then take the next step in communicating and writing proficiently in English. 

The course focuses on writing clear and correct essays, but at the same time, you should improve your speaking ability, your reading ability, cultural awareness, and knowledge of current events and issues.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
1.介紹當代中西翻譯理論。

2.練習文學作品之英翻中、中翻英。

3.Classes will be conducted in the forms of lecture and discussion. Class attendance is required. Students are expected to actively participate in the class discussions.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: To introduce students to the art and practice of translation.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course provides an overview of translation theories/studies as an academic discipline. It aims to help students develop a better understanding of the nature of translation, types of translation, the roles of the translator and how translation is viewed in the course of history. Brief histories of translation East and West will also be briefly covered in the course.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 翻譯專題：新聞英文翻譯
CourseName: Topics on Translation : Journalistic English Translation
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to be an application-oriented course with drawing heavily upon real-world news material including those on press and electronic media. Based on the general belief that translation is a skill that is developed through constant practices, students are required to write a large number of in-class assignments, participate in group discussions, and present their work.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Great literature can be studied mainly in two ways: wide survey and intensive study. The planning of this course is thus a kind of compromise of the abovementioned approaches based upon a threefold principle: the writer chosen for intensive study must be great himself/herself, representative of his/her age, and significant to the contemporary student reader.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
1. Based on the chronology (American Literature 1865-1914, American Literature 1914-1945, American Prose since 1945, American Poetry since 1945), this course is a survey of American Literature after 1865.

2. To deepen students' understanding of the texts, various kinds of literary theories (New Criticism, Structuralism, Post-Structuralism, Feminism, Psychoanalysis) will also be introduced and applied to each text.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 英語口語訓練（二）：口語訓練與閱讀
CourseName: English Oral Training (II) : Oral Training & Reading
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語口語訓練（一）：口語訓練與聽力(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
Prerequisite: [ English Oral Training（I）：Oral Training and Listening]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: ENGLISH ORAL COMMUNICATION AND READING (TWO) is a continuation in classroom instruction and experience in oral communication skills, particularly those related to public presentation, group discussion, and more.  According to the English Department’s EFL Committee Mission Statement, the goal for students in this course is that they should demonstrate reasonable fluency and pronunciation in standard English.  Ability to participate comfortably in general conversation is determined by:  Comprehending and responding appropriately, Initiating, continuing, and ending a conversation, Interacting with cultural awareness, Improvising in new situations, Using grammar flexibly, Seeking and providing information in an organized manner, and Narrating an event.  The course approaches communication, comprehension, fluency, improvisational language structures, and communication theory.  The course will use a great deal of culture-specific materials, such as videos and critical thinking/communication exercises.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 英語口語訓練（二）：口語訓練與閱讀
CourseName: English Oral Training (II) : Oral Training & Reading
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語口語訓練（一）：口語訓練與聽力(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
Prerequisite: [ English Oral Training（I）：Oral Training and Listening]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
Brief Introduction

This is the second semester oral training course that is required for English Majors at NCCU.

In this course you will learn how to be more effective communicators in English.

This course will focus on improving your ability to communicate spontaneously and on how to present information effectively in formal and informal situations.

This course will provide advanced oral training with discussion topics coming from a range of reading material that will be required for the class. Students will improve their ability to do impromptu and formal speeches in front of an audience, think critically and express their viewpoints, lead and participate in group discussions, understand and communicate multi-culturally.

The new wiki will be located at http://2018-convo2-nccu.wikispaces.com/

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 英語口語訓練（二）：口語訓練與閱讀
CourseName: English Oral Training (II) : Oral Training & Reading
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 英語口語訓練（一）：口語訓練與聽力(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
Prerequisite: [ English Oral Training（I）：Oral Training and Listening]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course aims to cultivate students’ critical thinking and public speaking skills and to stimulate students' interest in a great variety of public issues. Students will learn to adopt a critical perspective to approach 12 modern-day issues and deliver public speeches on different topics in both formal and informal situations. In practice, students will be working mainly in groups for regular in-class discussion to talk about their reading assignments. For each topic, students will be given extended reading material (or video clips) after class and worksheet as homework, if appropriate. As for midterm and final assessment, students will be giving presentations in pairs and individually to demonstrate their presentation skills.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
SEE THE WEBSITE BELOW FOR COMPLETE DETAILS OF THE COURSE.

The purpose of this course is to learn the fascinating history of how English became the language that is used so widely all around the world today. We will learn about what is language and how humans are uniquely evolved to learn and use language. Then we will learn about the Indo-European language family of which English is a member. Next we will learn about the evolution of English on the British Isles as it transformed during the Old English Middle English and Modern English stages. Finally we will examine the status of English as a global language. Alongside this process of learning about the history of the English language, we will also expand our vocabularies by learning about words that entered the English language during these different periods, and by learning how the meanings of words have evolved over time.

Class wiki is located at http://2018-history-of-english-nccu.wikispaces.com/

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: An introduction to academic research writing. This writing course based on critical reading and thinking will provide students with an introduction to and practice of the skills needed to produce academic research reports in English following conventional protocols and with an awareness of international standards of academic research. Sample papers from reputable professional journals will provide models of organization and academic writing so that students can learn acceptable and appropriate forms and styles of writing. The focus of the course is on the writing and formatting of research papers; research methods are introduced but because the students taking the course have many different interests the topics for research in this course will be of a general nature.T

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is to lead students into the field of teaching English. The focus is to help students acquire practical language teaching skills. Language teaching methods that have been applied in different contexts will be introduced.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: LITERATURE AND FILM . . . The purpose of this course is to explore various types and selections of literature and the transformations they undergo when appropriated into the film medium. Students will be expected to learn basic film theories and apply them in analysis of films and their literary origins. The course will cover film theories through their application to a variety of selected literary texts.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a survey of the modern European literature that has contributed to the creation and expansion of modern Western culture and literature. Designed as a brief overview, the course aims to introduce key concepts and ideas involved in the classical works in literary history from the eighteenth century to the modern period, including drama, poetry, and fiction.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course offers students an opportunity to develop the interpreting skill through practice on a variety of topics including culture, law, medicine, climate, technology, finance, politics, criminology, and science. The focus of the course covers the following items:

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces the basic aspects of linguistic meaning in human communication. It aims to give students access to some of the central ideas in the field of semantics so that students can gain a feel for what doing semantic is like. It seeks to give students a deeper insight into the nature of grammar and into the cognitive principles that motivate its structure so that students learn to see the study of language as a fascinating and challenging field of human experience. Topics will include studies of meaning, dimensions/scopes of meaning, lexical relations, things (reference and sense, quantifiers, and modifiers), deixis, predicates and participants, and situations as temporal units (aspect, tense, and modality).

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Course Description    This course, Trauma Literature, introduces those narratives that deal with certain traumatic pasts haunting the characters and explores how the unspeakable psychic wounds are represented in the fictional texts as the manifestation of repressed individual and collective memory. The focus will be placed mainly on the Anglo-American trauma narratives, including works by Katherine Anne Porter, Cynthia Ozick, Michael Chabon, Kazuo Ishiguro and the Nobel Prize winner Toni Morrison, and the representation of historical traumas which can be traced back to American slavery. The issue of racial identity will also be covered given that collective trauma shapes the historical memory of an ethnic group. Students are encouraged to infuse Chinese literary works and/or cultural experiences in Taiwan into their reading and discussions.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 進階英語口語訓練：新聞
CourseName: Advanced English Oral Training: Journalistic English
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Advanced Oral Training: Journalistic English is designed to improve students’ existing command of spoken English with a focus on journalism and world news. Each week’s class will draw from a current affairs news event, making use of written, web and video news. Students will be introduced and exposed to different genres of news, their writing style and how they are presented, thus aiding students in improving written and spoken proficiency regarding journalistic writing conventions, different types of reports, the formation of interview questions, the stylistic use of English, as well as presentation skills, pronunciation, body language, and the use of visuals aids.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course aims to introduce the basic phonological knowledge to undergraduate students including phonomes and allophones with their integral features, also the necessary internal structure, rule, application and ordering of the phonology.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程之教學目的在於透過英文小說 (長篇、中篇、短篇）之文本閱讀以提高學生賞析、詮釋與批判之能力，並兼及小說風格及閱讀策略之介紹。

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed to introduce undergraduate students to the major principles of literary theory as well as to established methods of literary criticism in the Western literary and philosophical tradition since Plato to the present time. By the end of this course, students will find themselves equipped with such critical approaches to literary and cultural texts as Classical Poetics, Renaissance Criticism, Neo-classical Criticism, Romanticism, Victorianism, Structuralism, Semiotics, Poststructuralism, New Historicism, Psychoanalysis, Postmodernism, Marxism, Feminism, Postcolonialism, etc.

Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This class aims to introduce practical issues in teaching English as a foreign language. The major focus of this class will be curricular and pedagogical concerns in teaching English to secondary students in Taiwan. Opportunities to observe English classes, give teaching demonstrations, participate in student teaching, and conduct post-teaching conferences will be provided. Cooperative learning and learner-centered approaches will be used. In the end, the course purports to enable students to become reflective practitioners by theorizing from their own practical teaching experiences and by critically reflecting upon theory and practice in TESOL.

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 西洋文學：中古時期及文藝復興時期
CourseName: Western Literature: The Middle Ages and the Renaissance
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This is a survey course introducing students to the premodern literature of the west.  Students will study how the Middle Ages and the Renaissance were often seen as a transitional period that transformed the cultural heritage of the ancient time and helped shape various cultural beliefs of the modern world.  Students will examine how the epic and tragic heroes in the Greek and Roman literature are turned into feudal knights and how such knights face a much more complex world with the rise of nationhood and the need to build an identity.  Students will also study how the biblical ideas of justice, love, and new life are examined, embodied, and redefined in love lyrics, hagiography, romance, satire, and autobiography.  It is hoped that through reading literary works and relevant background materials of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance, students will build a basic literacy about the important texts that helped shape western culture and understand how modern arguments about identity and the meanings of life, desire and love, justice and law, economy and poverty, nationhood and individualism are rooted in the medieval and Renaissance beliefs and doubts about human nature, goodness and evil, the nature of government, and art and language.

Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of English
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: In this course, students will study relevant biblical passages of similar themes over 2 to 3 weeks.  Sample interpretations of the Bible in western history will help students understand how these passages were interpreted and how biblical interpretations helped shape the way literary works were written and interpreted.  Relevant literary works will then be examined to show how theological concepts or religious lessons were recontextualized to examine personal and social issues throughout western history.  Students will also be encouraged to find how the Bible can be interpreted to examine personal and social issues of our day.

CourseName: Introduction to the Arab History and Literature
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯文史概論(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
Prerequisite: [ Introduction to the Arab History and Literature]
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯文史概論的課程主旨在於闡述阿拉伯世界的文化和歷史發展狀況，從西元7世紀開始至今。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯語語法（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
This course is the second course in Arabic syntax, One of the most important points in learning languages is understanding the grammatical system of language, in fact, without basic knowledge of the Arabic grammar, it's hard to use this language fluently, so this course will contain a variety of topics in Arabic grammar to develop students' abilities to understand the language, and use the language to correct grammar.
Students will study grammatical rules through various texts and examples, and must preview the texts before attending the class.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 當代阿拉伯語(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed in continuation to Contemporary Arabic (1st semester). The course picks up from where we stopped at the textbook; Modern Iraqi Arabic with MP3 Files: A Textbook, in the 1st semester (i.e., lesson-13) and goes on to complete the textbook to the end (i.e., lesson-20). Each lesson will be supplemented by authentic materials that include texts, phone conversations and videos with their associated activities. As in the 1st semester, the course provides students with a platform for transition from standard Arabic to a variety of Arabic dialects spoken in the gulf region. Particularly, to the gelet dialect of Arabic spoken in southern Iraq, Kuwait, Oman and other GCC member states.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 文學專題(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course aims to help students build up their reading ability in classical Arabic and expose them to the key texts in Classical Arabic works. The course will cover different genres and themes of classical Arabic literature, through which students will be guided to recognize key characteristics of these texts and the medieval Islamic intellectual world.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯各國政府(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本門課程主要是幫助學生了解中東各國政府之組成原因、並分析自19世紀起各個強權因各自的利益考量，扶植在地的勢力團體而形成國家之主因。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 古蘭經與聖訓(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course introduces the Hadith, one of the most important divine sources in Islam. The course covers the history and development of the science of the Hadith (ʿilm al-ḥadīth), with regard to its interrelation with the fiqh-jurisprudence and literature, and its role in Sufi and Shīʿī Islam.

CourseName: Trends of Modern Arabic Thought in Culture and Arts
\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 現代阿拉伯文藝思潮(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course surveys the intellectual history of the Arab world since 1798, the year when Napoleon invaded Egypt. The course will focus on the change and development of the social and cultural aspects of the Arab societies. The emphasis of region will be on the Arab nations, however, we will occasionally discuss related developments in the neighboring nations, such as Turkey, Iran, or even Israel. The goal is for the students to understand the common features that have shaped the Arab societies under the guidance of Islam, as well as the various experiences that have endowed the area with much cultural diversity. The time frame of this course will be up to the present time in order to untangle the complicated cultural and social issues that are affecting the Arab world today.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 伊斯蘭文明(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course aims to introduce students to different kinds of Islamic thought, to the sources of divine truth(s) for Muslims, which form the basis of Islamic civilisation. Islam, from its birth, is a universal phenomenon, developed in geographical, ethnic, linguistic, and cultural diversity. There is not a single set of governing rules for doing Islam. Students will learn to 1) understand Islam in its plurality and latitudinarianism; 2) reflect on the simplistic diagnoses and discourses around the conflicts in the Middle East.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯語（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯語(一)為認識阿拉伯語的入門課程。該課目配合教材العربية بين يديك，1,本學期將教授第七課到第十六課。其中，將根據各課單元的內容教授語法及補充相關單詞及講解文化背景。該學期會著重於語言的應用，並使用多媒體教學以期加強學習效果。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯語（一）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯語(一)為認識阿拉伯語的入門課程。該課目配合教材العربية بين يديك，1,本學期將教授第七課到第十六課。其中，將根據各課單元的內容教授語法及補充相關單詞及講解文化背景。該學期會著重於語言的應用，並使用多媒體教學以期加強學習效果。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯語（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯語(二)為阿語進階課程，該課目配合教材العربية بين يديك，該課程將探討阿拉伯文化、歷史背景及日常生活、全球化的阿拉伯國家所面臨的狀況。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯語（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯語(二)為阿語進階課程，該課目配合教材العربية بين يديك，該課程將探討阿拉伯文化、歷史背景及日常生活、全球化的阿拉伯國家所面臨的狀況。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯語語法（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯語言的書寫與閱讀能力，非有語法知識無法達成。阿拉伯語所涵蓋的語言現象非常豐富，從語法的學習中，得以習得阿拉伯語言的特殊性，尤其是「類比」、「究因」的運用以及其他的邏輯概念。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 阿拉伯世界導論(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 下學期課程著重於讓學生了解中東之歷史與現代中東政府對此區域之改變。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 應用阿拉伯語（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course is designed in continuation to Applied Arabic-I (1st semester). The course picks up from where we stopped at the textbook; Ahlan wa Sahlan: Functional Modern Standard Arabic for Beginners, in the 1st semester (i.e., textbook lesson-3) and goes on in covering the textbook up-to lesson-20. As in the 1st semester, this course aims at providing a platform for the students to practice Arabic in a target-language-only (immersion) environment in which classroom activities are geared toward developing functional abilities to use Arabic accurately and fluently in the four language skills, namely: Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing. This involves intensive classroom interaction and out-of-class assignments.

Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture

As in the 1st semester, this course aims at providing a platform for the students to practice Arabic in a target-language-only (immersion) environment in which classroom activities are geared toward developing functional abilities to use Arabic accurately and fluently in the four language skills, namely: Listening, Speaking, Reading, and Writing. This involves intensive classroom interaction and out-of-class assignments.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 應用阿拉伯語（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course caters to the needs of students of Arabic language who have acquired the basic keys of understanding for the language, and they need the opportunity to apply this knowledge to help them to be able to practice and consolidate their knowledge, and acquire relevant expressions, and develop communicative skills, and cultural understanding to use Arabic in many daily life situations which they need it.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 應用阿拉伯語（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course caters to the needs of students of Arabic language who have acquired the basic keys of understanding for the language, and they need the opportunity to apply this knowledge to help them to be able to practice and consolidate their knowledge, and acquire relevant expressions, and develop communicative skills, and cultural understanding to use Arabic in many daily life situations which they need it.

Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 阿拉伯語言的書寫與閱讀能力，非有語法知識無法達成。阿拉伯語所涵蓋的語言現象非常豐富，從語法的學習中，得以習得阿拉伯語言的特殊性，尤其是「類比」、「究因」的運用以及其他的邏輯概念。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 媒體阿拉伯文(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class of Department of Arabic Language and Culture
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: The course is designed in continuation to Media Arabic (1st semester). It presents the language of print and internet news media to students of Arabic seeking to reach the advanced level. Students learn topic vocabularies usually found in news articles and other internet news publications, as well as develop linguistic skills to recognize various moods of coverage, distinguish facts from opinions, detect bias and activate critical thinking and analytical skills needed to produce effective news readers.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 俄語會話（三）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Дисциплина «Практика устной речи» реализуется в форме занятий, в ходе которых студенты на практике отрабатывают основные навыки реализации говорения как вида речевой деятельности, при этом, в силу ограниченного количества аудиторных занятий, предполагается большая доля самостоятельной работы студентов. Методическая новизна в преподавании дисциплины заключается в социально-культурной направленности обучения и его практической ориентации.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 俄語會話（三）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Курс строится как продолжение программы, первая половина которой освоена в осеннем семестре. Будут изучаться следующие разговорные темы:

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 俄語會話（三）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Интенсивный коммуникативный курс русского языка

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 俄語會話（四）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Список основных тем для обсуждения и дискуссий:

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 俄語會話（四）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Курс строится как продолжение программы осеннего семестра, следовательно, предполагается опора на пройденные темы «мегаполис» (проблемы большого города, на примере Гонконга), «миграция, иностранные специалисты и приезжие рабочие», «глобализация», «движение антиглобализма». Для достижения поставленной цели предполагается подбор свежих телепередач (канал «Культура» и другие), в которых обсуждаются темы занятий. Попутно активизируется лексика по темам, включая ее грамматические свойства. На занятиях, помимо основных текстов из учебника, обсуждаются просмотренные и понятые дома фрагменты телепередач. Понимание быстрой русской речи проверяется специальными диктантами. Для домашней подготовки студентам даются точные адреса интернета обсуждаемых телепередач (с указанием минут и секунд начала каждого отрывка) и выдаются распечатки стенограмм всего, что говорится, с краткими пояснениями. В целях усвоения трудных случаев управления предлагаются электронные тренировочные упражнения.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 應用俄語寫作(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Курс весеннего семестра представляет собой продолжение программы развития навыков владения разнообразными стилями русской письменной речи в осеннем семестре 2017-18 учебного года. Движение учебного материала происходит от наиболее строгих, формализованных и архаизированных форм письма к наиболее свободным, допускающим известные вкрапления устно-разговорной речи. Более всего в осеннем семестре осваивался официально-деловой стиль, деловое письмо, элементы научного и публицистического стилей.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 初級俄語會話(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Freshman Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: Содержание общегодового курса соотнесено с ситуациями общения в магазине, на рынке, в столовой, буфете, кафе, ресторане, в офисе, университете (в деканате, на занятиях), в транспорте (в автобусе, в поезде, в аэропорту, на вокзале), на почте, в банке, библиотеке, театре, кинотеатре, музее, на экскурссии, в поликлинике, аптеке, разговор по телефону, общение в Интернете (в социальных сетях). Темы общения, позволяющие удовлетворять самые необходимые коммуникативные потребности: 1) Рассказ о себе и своей семье; 2) Друзья, знакомые; 3) Учеба, работа, профессия; 4) Школа и университет: система образования в России и родной стране; 5) Иностранные языки и их роль в жизни человека; 6) Свободное время, отдых, интересы, увлечения (искусство, спорт, путешествия); 7) Город, столица страны, родной город; 8) Россия и Тайвань; 9) Известные деятели науки, культуры, спорта России и Тайваня; 10) Экология: природа и человек.

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 捷克文（三）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 波蘭文（一）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 波蘭，對台灣來說是個神秘又陌生的國度。然而，波蘭擁有美麗純淨的大自然、優雅且富深度的歷史文化、熱情敦厚的人民、以及政經發展的潛力，值得我們一探究竟。2004年波蘭加入歐盟後，國家整體發展更是突飛猛進，擺脫了以往灰暗的印象。2009年全球金融危機之際，波蘭更是歐盟唯一經濟正成長的國家，表現非凡。台灣與波蘭交流日漸增加，波蘭語人才卻極度缺乏。語言是踏進這個國度的第一要件，也幫助我們開啟另一扇機會之窗。歡迎各位加入波蘭的行列!

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 捷語會話（二）(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: This course continues Czech conversation I and is based for students who have basic knowledge of Czech language. It provides linguistic tools necessary both for production and reception of (mostly oral) Czech language. The goal is to enable students a better understanding of communicative situations and a way of life in the Czech Republic. Throughout the course, lessons will be sequenced from presentation activities to guided practice activities and communicative activities based on new vocabulary and „real-life” situations. Listening and writing activities will also be incorporated into the lessons to improve students´ language skills.

Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 進階俄語：綜合(單學期)(修習且及格)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: （一）課程介紹以下與俄羅斯社會相關之主題：

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 波蘭文（三）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Senior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 本課程銜接斯拉夫語文學系所開設之[波蘭文(二)]，為一波蘭文中高級進階課程。選修此課程者，應具備波蘭文基本之語彙、文法、會話等方面的能力。授課除了以波蘭文講解之外，並以英文為講解之輔助語言。

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 波蘭文（二）(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 波蘭，對台灣來說是個神秘又陌生的國度。然而，波蘭擁有美麗純淨的大自然、優雅且富深度的歷史文化、熱情敦厚的人民、以及政經發展的潛力，值得我們一探究竟。2004年波蘭加入歐盟後，國家整體發展更是突飛猛進，擺脫了以往灰暗的印象。2009年全球金融危機之際，波蘭更是歐盟唯一經濟正成長的國家，表現非凡。台灣與波蘭交流日漸增加，波蘭語人才卻極度缺乏。語言是踏進這個國度的第一要件，也幫助我們開啟另一扇機會之窗。歡迎各位加入波蘭的行列!

\u8ab2\u7a0b\u540d\u7a31: 二十世紀俄國文學：動盪的時代、分裂的文學
Course Department: Junior Class B, Department of Slavics
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb: 19世紀末，俄國社會騷動不安，許多知識份子走向深邃的知性思考，為文壇注入強大的生命力。20世紀初，文學與政治尤密不可分，也是文化水準更高，蘊藉更豐，思維更深的年代。許多作家流離失所，飽嘗憂患，讀者也看見人性的尊貴、正義的力量，見證普世不移的價值。

Course Department: Freshman Class of Department of Japanese

\u5148\u4fee\u79d1\u76ee: [ 中級日語(單學期)(有修即可)]
Course Department: Sophomore Class of Department of Japanese
\u8ab2\u7a0b\u7c21\u4ecb:
本課程為修畢初級日語者之進階課程，主要目的在於教授同學讀解日語文章的技巧以提升閱讀日語文章的能力。
指定教科書中的日語文章採精讀方式學習，由教師說明句型與單字的用法，練習冊則由同學課後自行練習，並列為期中期末考試範圍。
課堂上除以主題方式補充相關的語法知識外，並不定期補充時事相關的文章以加強同學的閱讀能力。
透過平時及期末作業的繳交養成自主學習的習慣，以期能將日語的學習成為終身學習的對象之一。
